text: From 0.5l. Pours hazy orange with nice white head. Good head retention. Aroma of bread and bit banana. Nice weisse beer.

Beautiful pour & pretty tasty! Attractive cloudy orange w/ a white head & good lacing. The aroma has some nice Belgian spice. The taste is clean yet memorable which is rare for the style. Has more of a Belgian ale feel than a Weiss. Spicy & overall delightful for whats typically a boring style!
Pours with a massive white head. Herbal nose with some grain. Coriander and hints of golden syrup cake finish smoothly. Good.

wazig gouden/oranje met volle fijne witte kraag. aroma van citrus, koriander, lichte jonge banaan, mout, tarwe, kruidnagel. smaken zijn redelijk zacht, matig zoet, citrus, sinaasappel, mout, tarwe, graan, banaan, iets dun qua textuur, gist, geen top weizen maar ok.
Zitrusfruchtiger Antrunk, säuerlicher Körper mit leichter Banane. Feingehopft (Hallertauer Herkules / Hallertauer Taurus) im Abgang.

Bottle, alko. Golden hazy. Creamy puffy malted wheat sweetness on nose, huge ripe banana. Med bodied, slight thin, good estery though, with a bit dry, wheaty finish. Like the clovy weihenstephan a little better, abd the body could be a little malty chewyer, but nice and classically flavoured.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Drinked in bottle. At the nose is quite farmy (something that I personally like), bready notes, banana, pepper and other spices. In mouth is medium light bodied, quite carbonated. Full mouthfeel but at the same time refreshing. Hints of fruits, black pepper and cloves

500 ml swing top bottle. Gushing alert! I popped the bottle and it rushed out of the vessel like a damn volcano. Know that, dear beer fellows.
Huge everlasting fluffy white head. The beer showed itself in the glass as a beautiful foggy yellow honey brew. Surprisingly lazy and soft carbonation (gushing result?). 
Aroma gives me a strong yeast profile; some bubblegum & banana; distinct wheat aka flour; vague hop spiciness.
Flavour is big wheat, sour yeast, pleasant floral spiciness. Smooth mouthfeel. A-class hefeweizen. Less phenolic and sour as many other examples are. Wonderful!

Aroma: wheat, bread, banana, spicy.
Appearance: yellow, haze, with white head.
Taste: wheat, bread, spicy.
Palate: medium body, smooth, medium carbonation.
A very good example of the style. A very good import from a historical brewery. Dont miss it.

Bottle from a supermarket (as Hacker-Pschorr Weisse). Aroma: Weak aroma of yeast and bananas. Appearance: Nice head, golden hazy body. Taste: Yeasty, bubblegum, some cloves, bread, light aceton. Palate: Semi-sweet finish, low body, very high carbonation.

Dark golden color, bordering on copper. Quite nice yeasty and malty aromas, with noticeable banana, and baked wheat bread crust. Not too much clove in the smell. Very yeast-driven flavor, the clove-like phenols really pop out on the tongue. Has a bit of citrus tartness and some sweet bread tones. Finishes a bit metallic and a noticeable hop bite in the end, mixed with spiciness from the yeast. The clove just hangs on the tongue for minutes after a sip. Often, I complain about hefes being not spicy enough, but I feel there is too much yeast character for this to be enjoyable. For me, the style should be thirst quenching and crisp. This has too busy of a palate, the clove-notes keeping this from being refreshing. Id call it good for what it is, very complex, but not my style. Yet, I would buy it again for certain food pairings.
Très jolie robe jaune sombre et trouble. Bel équilibre global, épicée en légèreté, clou de girofle et muscade. Une jolie bière de blé. Étonnant je lai préférée en pression ???
hazy and dark golden colour with thick white head, aroma of wheat and banana, taste is wheaty and fruity, realy smoot. great beer!

Aroma is wheat, clove, fruity, banana, metallic. Appearance is golden amber, hazy, white head. Taste is wheat, fruity, slight clove, cereal, good. Mouthfeel is light body, light carbonation, wheat metallic aftertaste. Overall, solid.

Bottle. Cloudy orange in colour. Fruity; citrus-orange, banana. Yeasty. Spicy; cloves. Wheaty & Malty; caramel. Refreshing wheatbeer. Sweetish, smooth; not at all bitter. Dryish fruity finish. (2009-03)
Bottle at home. Pours hazy light brown with big off-white head. Aroma is wheat, banana and yeast. Taste has wheat, yeast, bread and banana. Pretty nice.

Ar: Mild banana with a hint of peach; very faint notes of of clove and banana; some light, sweet doughy accents. Ap: Deep gold and slightly cloudy; medium off-white head with decent retention; leaves a persistent ring of foam and a very think cap of bubbles. T: Mild banana with a fair amount of bubblegum; slight metallic off-flavor; a little bit of clove and peach on the finish; semi-sweet, a touch medicinal; very low bitterness. P: Medium-full body with medium-high carbonation; finish is medium-dry. O: This beer appears to have quite a number of good things going for it, but some sort of off-flavor has crept in, giving it a metallic note and a flat finish.
Hacker-Pschorr. A nice enough drink. Nice citric grass wheat taste, crisp.
Bottle from Corks & Kegs, Richmond. Pours deep golden with a large white head. Aroma of dust, mild banana, yeast. Flavor is ripe banana, wheat like mad, yeast. Not bad.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Tap at a Restaurant in krün. Pours dark orange, small white head. Nose is banana, floral, apricot, bubblegum. Palate is a bit bitter, a bit banana, floral. A weizen more on the bitter side, good, but lacks in the palate.
Draft at bierhalle, Toronto. Hazy body and a medium sized white head. The aroma has citrus and yeast. The flavor has grapefruit and a great finish.
Flaska på Thunder Bay Grille Pewaukee. Orangefärgad med fluffigt vitt skum. Doft av skumbanan och koriander. Mild med smak av skumbanan och koriander.
Cloudy ochre yellow, tall white head. Stays. Delicate banana on nose. Caramel, phenolic yeast. Light body. Lots of wheat on taste, bread, tart yeast. Low bitterness. Very classical.
buonissima! la miglior weiss che ho bevuto fino ad ora...non vedo lora di riprenderla
I am hoping the one I had was off because it was not good at all. It almost had a sour tinge to it that I would not want in a hefeweizen ever again. Where was the banana?

From bottle, at Bowling Seventies, San Marino. Pours loaded gold, hazy with very abundant head of fine white foam. Aroma is banana and some orange. Body is light-medium. Taste is sweet but not overtaking everything, as finish is dry enough and with a hint of bitterness/spicing.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Una birra weisse come deve essere, schiuma buona, sapore in bocca classico, fresca beverina

Bottle. Beautiful fluffy head. Strong banana notes. Sweet and creamy. Effervescent and clean palate. 

Reminds me of Germany!

On tap. Hazy golden orange color with white head. Aroma has some fermented grains and overripe banana. Taste is slightly sweet with wheat and light banana notes. Medium body with high effervescence. A bit acidic for my taste and the fermented note is also not doing it.

I bought this bottle at drink of the world Bern. I drank it yesterday at home. The color of this beer is pleasant for the eyes: yellow/orange and troubled. The carbonation is higher than usual and for a hefe-weiss and there is a side a bit metalic but it is acceptable. There is a side a bit watery, wheat, creamy at the tongue, banana, cloves but it is more discreet than an ayinger brauweisse, refreshing at the summer.

Bottle at home. Hazy orange pour with a tall white head. Notes of bananas, coriander, yeast and grains, mineral components. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel, medium to high carbonation and a bitter-sweet finish.
[2016-10-22] Golden, hazy, white head. The aroma has wheat, yeast and some spices. Almost like a witbier! The taste dominated by yeast and mild bitterness. High carbonation.
0.5 l bottle as Hacker-Pschorr Weisse (ABV 5.5%) from Alko Kokkola. Darkish for a weisse, nice high white head. Taste is only dry wheat. Hints of bananas. simple and o so good!

Aroma; leaves, grass, caramel, malts, coriander note. Look; about clear deep amber with off white dense head. Taste; caramel, grass, banana, dough, malts, coriander, leaves, yellow apple peel note, cinnamon n ginger note - leading to a fruity malt-leafy finish. Feel; normal body n carbonation. Overall; nice balance, very clean style. [50cl.swingtop-btl 5.5% BB.01.17]

Pours dark yellow with medium thick white head. Aroma is banana, cream, grain, fruits, apples, yeast, some citrus, light strawberry. Taste is soft, creamy, barley, light caramel, yeast, fruits, light banana, citrus. Very nice beer!

On tap at growler guys meridian. Pours out a hazy peach color topped with a fluffy white head. Nose is great citrus spice banana and yeast esters. Taste is more of the nice banana spice citrus notes. Earlier Rating: 5/5/2016 Total Score: 3.9On tap at growler guys meridian. pours out a cloudy golden orange topped with a sand head. Nose is great big banana spice clove esters some bubblegum sweetness. taste is more of the heavy banana clove spice great hef.

0,l bottle. Pours cloudy dark orange with big lasting white head. Aroma is yeast, bread, more clove than banana. Its medium sweet, light bitterness and slightly sour. Body is medium with creamy texture and average carbonation.

Bottle at the "Wine Cellar" at Goods furniture complex in Illinois. A step back in time. But the beer is solid. I dont really go for Hefe too much, but this is subtle and clean. Nice dry wheaty finish with just a touch of yeast and banana.

Flasche 0,5l: Bernstein, kräftige Trübung, kräftiger fester feinporiger Schaum; recht würzige Nase, eher trocken, Vanille, leicht nussig, malzige Süße, kräftige Hefearomen, leichte Röstaromen; im Körper schöne Süße, malzig, leichte Bananenaromen, kräftige Heferaromen, sehr cremig, sehr kräftige Kohlensäure, leichte Säure, leichte Zitrusnoten, angenehme Trockenheit; angenehmer trocken-malziger Nachgang mit Hefearomen
Hazy burnt orange gold. Frothy off white head. Everything about it is classic, quality hefe. I could (and have) drink this again and again. Just doesnt get old.
500ml bottle. Pours hazy golden with big white head. Banana, yeast, wheat, spices. Nicely balanced.

Hazy, mid brown beer with big and long lasting head. Very beautiful. Aroma includes yeast, banana and some citrus. Taste is also very citrus, also some hints of banana and yeast. Quite light body, and a bit too citrus.

From a bottle.
Medium-light body with medium-high carbonation. Smooth.
Malt dominated aroma with faint spice and banana.
Mild flavor with faint banana.Earlier Rating: 8/27/2013 Total Score: 3.2From bottle. Hazy golden amber with a good white head. Good lacing. 
Lots of banana and vague ripe fruit in the nose. 
Taste features more bready malts but still has a solid banana note, along with a bit of clove. 
Rather high carbonation, but this seems appropriate for this brew. Near medium body. Crisp. 
O: a good German Weiss (revisited in August 2015).
Bottle from beermerchants. Cloudy orange color. Thin to medium white head. Medium body. Light to medium sweetness. Aroma is banana, clove, spices, malt.

0.5 l bottle as Hacker-Pschorr Weisse (ABV 5.5%) from Alko Karkkila. Appearance is darker than most of the weizens. Nice head and everything. Taste had first only dry wheat and something oily. Later on the yeast added some very ripe bananas.
B. Pours a fairly clear burnt orange color with white head. Gets better as it warms up a little

DATE: August 7, 2016... OCCASION: finished a fantastic pre-birthday weekend with Matt, Aaron and Jer by entertaining the McCrackens and the Morgans--mnow relaxing while watching the Olympics... GLASSWARE: Weihenstephan weizen... pours a dense, almost opaque orange amber body with stray effervescence.... an off-white head is thick and two-fingered, settling to a full finger of froth and arching fingers that create camouflage-style tracings... spicy banana, pepper, and bubblegum, tobacco and ginger... light to medium-bodied, with a soft opening and a lingering aftertaste of banana... the impact is at the throat, refreshing and with some froth... the flavor profile is spicy and agreeable, with the aforementioned pepper, banana, clove and tobacco delivering a confident, satisfying experience... having liked their hefeweizen and Oktoberfest, I am not surprised to find this weisse a nice balance between slammable and savoring... a beer that no doubt embodies the virtues of the genre...Earlier Rating: 7/12/2013 Total Score: 4.4Date tasted: July 11, 2013... Glassware: Koenig Pilsener... Occasion: protein for tomorrows run--and a post-Bynam-signing toast....Appearance: thick, cloudy burnt orange body; equally thick, creamy head that exhibits nooks and crags like a sponges cross-section--worthy of patience... Aroma: beautiful aroma of orange,, banana, and some subtle spices that round the scent; quite pleasant... Palate: rather dry finish; prominent introduction, with a bit of crunch at the teeth... Taste: a surprisingly malty aftertaste; banana and clove with a comfortably clean consistency--refreshingly subtle... Overall: one of the upper-tier weisse beers Ive tasted; a no-frills genre-setting stud; with lemon, my fourth of July wing beer; on a ratings night, a reminder I probably should have reviewed this summers ago....
500 ml bottle. Hazy golden color with white to off white head. Malty and yeasty aroma, fruity, banana, spicy. Sweet taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.

On-tap at Zum Wildschutz, Garmisch-Partenkirchen. Cloudy yellow orange with a huge stable head. Aroma of banana, clove and fruity esters. Sweet, fruity, a bit spicy, clean and easy drinking. Light-medium bodied, lively carbonation. Nice well made Weissbier.
Aroma is banana and some clove; taste is banana with a lot of spice, finish is clove and a little bitterness; mouthfeel is creamy and carbonation is fizzy

Bottle @ Jacobs. Pours hazy golden orange with a creamy white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, little caramel, sweet fruit, banana. Flavor is sweet, wheat, yeast, fruit, banana. Medium body, average to lively carbonation. Refreshing. 170716
Bottle - hazy golden color with huge head. Taste is vanilla, banana, yeast, malt (medium sweet). Finish is well balanced. Body is thick. Great Weizen.
Warka 01/2017. Geshenk od wujka dla taty. Degustowane z ojcem po pół. Całkiem przyjemne piwko i chociaż nie mój styl to wypiłem z przyjemnością. Dobre.
Bottle. Hazy orange to yellow colour with a medium white head. Yeasty, malty and fruity aroma. Taste of banana, sweet malt, yeast, light to medium fruity. A very balanced beer.
A beer style takes advantage of a summer. When I opened the bottle left many smells. Fresh with just the right gas, balanced alcohol. A very good beer repeat if need be.
UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 Boca od 0.5....jednostavno ne znam ta bi napisao za ovo pivo osim da je odlično, boja, pjena, okus, miris jednostavno sve mi je odlično kod ovoga piva

Solid weisse with a clean finish and good taste. Closest comparable beer I can think of is Hoegaarden, but not as wheat beer isn't as cloudy. Light, citrusy, not heavily carbonated. Easy sipping drink!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Jul. 15. Thanks Marko for sharing a 0.5 l bottle of this. It poured hazy orange body with an average head for the style. Aroma of cloves, coriander. Flavor was similary spicy, with less estery notes than usual. Also smooth chalky and yoghurty. Banana was more pronounced towards its finish. Medium bodied. Quite interesting and pleasant Hefeweizen.
Pours hazy orange amber with big white frothy head. Aroma is bread, hay, banana, clove, touch of peach and smoke. Light sweet, some acidic. Nice.
11.2 oz. bottle. Poured hazy, thick foamy off white head. Aroma off wheat, spices and fruit. Taste was sweet, orange and spices.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, from Alko Anttila, Tampere, Finland. Medium, slightly pungent aroma with sweet malts and banana. Darker orange color with medium frothy white head. Medium taste with banana, wheat and some sweet malts. Averagely balanced with medium taste spectrum and medium/narrow aftertaste with banana and wheat. Medium, soft body with medium/light carbonation. Overall, a bit simple though bolder, high quality product.
0,5l bottle at home. Hazy golden colour with good amount of head. Malts, wheat, banana in the aroma. Medium body. Well balanced and very drinkable hefe, doesnt get watery.

Acquistata al supermercato la bottiglia da 50cl.Una birra dal gusto e aroma semplice ma deciso e abbastanza persistente.Si presenta ambrata con un bel cappello di schiuma denso e compatto.
Il corpo medio e il leggero sentore di agrumato iniziale, in contrasto con i successivi sapori dolci (lieviti,malto,banana) accompagnato da una media effervescenza rendono questa weiss una birra facilmente bevibile e dissetante.

On Tap at Growler Guys Meridian Dull hazy light tan/orange. Thin spoty head and lacing Big classic German Hef yeast notes. Mainly the banana side. Malt flavors and body were a litle sturdier than typical Hefs with a little more body and light toasted traces. A bit muddy unfiltered feel. Great flavors but I miss the cleaner crisp classics.
Pours a hazy golden orange. Aromas of bread/clove/ and some fruit. Had a taste of yeasty bread with some spice.
Has a subtle sweet banana breadish aroma. Hazy yellow body with a hint of amber. Solid white two fingered head. Lemony bread taste with a hint of bread. Tart and refreshing.

Pours a murky dark gold with massive off white head. Aroma is of wheat, caramel, citrus, spice and must. Tastes of wheat, caramel, citrus and light spice. Has a creamy, dry, medium body with average carbonation.

Tried to find fruit in this, but all I found was bready notes. And, I think, a big ham that had been studded with a few cloves, roasted and ultimately burnt. Good thing Im not a vegetarian! A little spice, but only at white pepper level. Bit more fruit in the mouth (dried banana? orange?)  but still a tight, grain-y flavour. Good level of creaminess, and nice that its not a banana-clone (dont think it really shouted at me banana, or the words typical of the style), but sorry to say that I found this too fusty/dusty. Maybe my bottle my was off or something.

.5l pour into shaker in a bar in Almaty, Kazakhstan. Hazy, straw, great lacing. Lightly sweet biscuity nose. Awesome creamy smooth body. Taste has a hint of citrus and wheat. Kind of chewy. Slightly dry finish. Very nice.
Orange/yellow color with big white head. Banana/vanila aroma, minimal carbonation, soft, easy finish.
Invitante, nez épicé. En bouche, on retrouve les mêmes arômes mais avec une finale légèrement aqueuse à mon goût.

Pour hazy golden color with nice and creamy white head. Smell is very pleasant, a bit grassy and fruity.

Body is between thin and medium with nice, creamy texture. Average carbonation for this style. Taste is mostly sweet with some sour notes towards the finish. Aroma is full and rich, wheat, grass, herbal and fruity. Nicely balanced and very, very smoothly. 

Overall, excellent example of the style. Tasty and refreshing. Highly recommended!

On tap at European Street Jacksonville. Pours a hazy golden color with a thin white head. Aromas of bananas and citrus. Taste the same with some malt and caramel flavor also. Light to medium on the palate. Overall nice hefe with good flavor.

Farbe: kräftiges ocker
Schaum: sämig und betändig. 
Nase: hm kellerig, muffig. Bisschen Weizen. Wenn das glas leerer wird kommt mehr der typische Bananenhefe-Geruch durch.Geschmack: feinperlig. Abgang dann erdig, Nachgeschmack recht deutlich nach reifer Banane. Insgesamt: gut aber zu kellerig.

Opaque, hazy golden yellow with a meager sized white head. Meek olfaction with notes of banana, yeast, caramel, and toast. Mid bodied and rather smooth. Taste far surpasses aroma with flavours such as intensive banana bread, caramel, vanilla, mango and minor hop in the finish.
Bottle. Yellow-orange with a decent white head. Nose of yeast, banana and bready malts. Tast has a lot wheat and yeast flavours. Very smooth and medium bodied. Nice one.

Hazy yellow orange color, large white head. Aroma of banana and wheat. Taste banana, honey, light t medium body. Citrus and hops in aftertaste. Good hefe, I would say little more bitter and carbonated then style average
Pours hazy light orange with medium head. Aroma is floral, yeasty, some bread as well; taste is similar with low to medium carbonization.
Very nice example of an Hefewiezen. Unfiltered and with a little bit of a kick. Pours cloudy and with a head. Hits the spot.
Bottle from World Market in Mountain View, CA. Aroma is mild floral, spiced breads. Taste is the same but not too overwhelming. Not a huge fan of the style but really enjoyed this one.

Red orange colour, hazy with the beige nice top.
Fruity and spicy, light at the same time. Refreshing and easy drinking. Semi-dry and good carbonation and swing top lid.
500 ml bottle. Hazy golden color with white to off white head. Malty and yeasty aroma, fruity, banana, spicy. Sweet taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.

Bottle. How have I never had this? I rolled the bottles (2) and a sediment was plentiful. A 2 finger beige head never quite goes away. The beer is orange gold and becomes dingy with that rolling. The beer has earth and cloves that dominate. A little banana. This is a classic take on a classic style.
Flaske. Farven er ufiltreret orange og skumkronen er tæt og hvid. Aromaen er banan, brød og karamel medens smagen er banan og citrus.
Cloudy orange with thick dense snow white head. Fine looking beer. Banana and cinnamon. Light body, average carbonation. Overall, good. Pretty good.

Blonde foncée, légèrement ambrée, trouble, haute mousse blanche. Nez de levures, banane. Bouche également sur le levure, banane, pain au levain. Corps dense et crémeux, bonne carbo. Une très bonne weiss bier.

Aroma: cloves and banana.
Appearance: very hazy golden color and white head.
Taste: cloves, banana, vanilla, semi-sweet, zesty.
Palate: medium body and high carbonation.
Overall: Decent weizen, really zesty and drinkable.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2017 0.5l flip-top bottle. pours an opaque orange yellow with a big steady white head and a nice lacing. aroma of banana, bubblegum, grass, spices. flavour of grass, yeast, bread, salt. fizzy carbonation, slightly bitter grassy finish. yeasty, not so much banana. nice.

Review sample, labeled as Hacker-Pschorr Weiss. Pours a big fluffy head in a tall glass, darker in color, a bit cloudy but more like an American wheat beer than a Hefe Weizen. Slight smell with just a little bit of fruity esters and a slightly spicy compliment from wheat malt. The taste does have a little bit of bubblegum and a slight touch of banana. Not as much spice as we know Weizen, again close to an American wheat style. The sweetness is subdued so theres not as much need for hops to balance it. The fruit and bubble gum in the nose are not as apparent in the taste. It is a little ticket than a Hefe, or for that matter, than a typical lawn mower beer, so be seated while you enjoy. No lemon, please. Some yeast sediment at the bottom but its too solid to pour into your glass. Earlier Rating: 11/14/2003 Total Score: 3.6Import Bottle. I've enjoyed this as a draft a few times, so how does a bottle taste after a long journey? Quite the same. I'm enjoying this as a "commuter speacial" (out of the bottle in a brown paper sack on the train). Good spicy weiss smell, actually a tad understated. Cloudy body. Full banana and clove taste, with a hint of lemon. A nice little head works up in the bottle. And a fine, playful effervescence on the tongue. A fine, fine beer.
Rated from old notes. Dark gold with a banana nut taste. Slightly dry. Hints of clove and citrus. All in all a very fine weizen beer.

L:
-pours a cloudy golden-orange with a medium to big ,creamy,white head
-medium to high carbonation visible
S:
earthy,leathery,banana,clove,wheaty,w bread,bubble gum,milky,toffee
T:
-banana,clove,bubble gum,honey,lemon,sweet
F:
-medium to high,soft carbonation
-light to medium body
O:
All-around great Hefeweizen

Fino, pitko pivo, ali nita značajno. Pio sam i mnogo bolje. Boja i zamućeni izgled mi se jako sviđaju, kao i čvrsta pjena. ima puno mjehurića, a okus me nikako nije oduevio. Kupljeno u Billi u pakiranju od 0,5 l

Dorata, mediamente torbida, schiuma bianca pannosa e ampia. Intenso aroma di banana e un pelo floreale. Molto bene al palato, banana, malto, molto dolce. Beverina e carbonata il giusto. Eccellente weiss.

Veiled gold color going for amber. Gorgeous foamy head that dies fast.

Well balanced aromas and flavors of sweetness and bitterness. Slight floral spices.

Super tasty and fresh wheat taste with a dash of honey.

Silky rich and warming. Medium body with champagne like carbonation.

A faint and short finish, but well balanced.

Overall an extremely well crafted beer!

500ml Swing top bottle poured into a Weizen glass. Use by Jan 2015. 
Aroma of banana - but light due to the three finger head. Appearance was a five with a beautiful orange / yellow colour, thick white foam and streams of bubbles rising up through the centre of the glass. But the taste was a let down. So much promise to be thin, watery and weak. No long finish or lingering flavour. I so wanted this to be good, but it was below average except for appearance.
Sticking with Weihenstephaner so far instead.
Very good wheat beer. Definitely one of my favourite ones. If you like weiss-beers give it a try.

50 cl bottle from Roto dinamic, served in a snifter. Dark orange to amber mit Hefe, with large steady white head that last long. Aroma is grains, banana, grass, yeast. Medium body, low carbonation. Taste is mild, moderatly sweet with low bitterness. Slightly umami finish. Creamy texture.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2017 As Hacker Pschorr Weisse. Pours a hazy orange color, topped with a big and semi-lasting off-white head, poor lacing. Banana and spices in the aroma, quite strong spicy presence actually. The taste is very mellow on the other hand, just slightly sweet and quite watery actually. Not a bad one. But nothing special.
Amber-golden pour. Creamy eggshell colored head. Wheat malt and citrus nose. A noticeable bite on the palate. Wheat malt, citrus, and cream flavors.
Dark golden weissbier, strong banana bread aroma, the flavour is banana, slightly herbal, lightly hopped finish, a pleasant example of the genre, if unremarkable
Très bonne Weissbier, on retrouve les arômes et goûts typiques de banane et de céréales.

Cloudy orange to pale brown colored, strong creamy lasting white head. Aroma is of banana bread doughy, cloves, bit acidy. Taste is moderate+ sweet banana bread, some caramel in there also, less cloves, moderate- citric acid, bready doughy yeasty finish, dry, some bitterness as well. Medium bodied, watery texture, moderate to strong carbonation.
Pours cloudy yellow.ro.gold with huge fluffy head. The a aroma is yeast, cloves, wheat, spice, fruit. The flavor is cloves, banana, wheat. Nice and light overall very good

Bouteille 500ml. Orangée, voilée avec épaisse mousse blanche. Arômes de pain frais, levures, bananes. Goût encore du pain, blé, céréale. Un petit goût de sirop de maïs en fin de bouche qui vient p-e du malt... Palais suffisant, belle rondeur. Effervescence modéré. Très bon produit.

Pours a hazy light gold with a thin white head that dissipates to nothing. Aroma is banana, clove, some wheat, and fruity undertones. Flavor is semi-sweet banana, clove, and wheat. Has a nice balance. Very good.

Originally rated on 11/2/07.. The smell is pretty good, consists of nutmeg, cloves and little citrus mixed in there. It looked pretty good, orangish-gold and decent head. Had this a few times at opal devines in austin, a good hefeweizen but not great, i prefer the pauliner hefeweizen.
Bananig, hefig. Typisches Weizen, Körper etwas dünner als bei der Konkurrenz, würzig, süffig, ok.
Hefetrübes Bernstein mit reichlich Schaum. Hefig, malzig, etwas Banane, süßlich, sehr spritzig.
Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, banana, wheat malt, fruits and hops.
Nice hazy color. Some sweetness but not overly. Hints of banana.Mild clove aroma.Smooth and creamy. Medium full body. nice aftertaste.Solid wheat beer.
On-tap, this pours a cloudy copper color with a fluffy beige head served with lemon. The taste is light, sweet with a good flavor of grain and citrus. Light, refreshing, and easy drinking.
Draught (a restaurant near Murnau) - Hazy gold/amber with a white head. Banana, peach and sultanas in the aroma. Refreshing taste with peach, banana, apricot and a hint of spice.

Bottle shared thanks to s_hartshorne, cheers Shane. Hazy Amber beer with large head. Aroma of banana, coriander and bubblegum. Taste is is banana, coriander and bubblegum. As expected from a hefe. A little watery. Good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle bier Huis ossett. Hazy strong gold good foamy white head. Aroma is banana clove taste same nice sweetness some yeast pepper light bitter finish. Nice mouthfeel subtle carbonation. Good balanced heffe.

Hacker-Pschorr Weisse has a thick, foamy, off-white head, a highly charged, bubbly, turbid, orange-gold appearance, tan chunks, and splotchy lacing left on the glass. The aroma is of low-level banana, bubble gum, and coriander notes, bread, and some sort of bright fruit. Taste is of those elements, with low bitterness, and a spiced bread presentation. Mouthfeel is rather heavy, and Hacker-Pschorr Weisse finishes semi-dry and easily drinkable. RJT

500ml bottle at a Russian-owned pizza joint in Chișinău. Pours cloudy gold with a medium white head. Aroma is banana, yeast and bread. Taste is medium sweet, citrus, wheat. A good summer drink for sure.
Cloudy yellow color, big white head. Aroma is kind of artificial. Brutally sweet, some banana. Medium body, lively carbonation. Ungood. //billa

Keg at Beer Run. Hazy orange, large fizzy tan head, good retention. Aroma of banana, yeast, creamy wheat. The taste is yeast, spice, banana, pineapple in the finish. Medium bodied, lingering spice, high carbonation. Earlier Rating: 2/13/2014 Total Score: 3.1330 mL bottle from Beer Run. As of this moment this is the 3rd most rated beer I have not yet rated. Pours a hazy orange color with a large frothy white head. Good head retention. Aroma of strong candied banana, banana, citrus, yeast. The taste is citrus, banana, spice, yeast, herbal hops. Thin bodied.

Cloudy orange color with nice thick foam head. Wheat and bread with a little banana in the nose. Malty, wheaty taste with hints of banana, but a little thin in the taste. The aftertaste is short and only a little wheat note stays.

Color albicocca, velata dai lieviti in sospensione, schiuma bianca di media persistenza.
Aroma che si discosta un po' dalle classiche weizen: lievito e frumento, chiodi di garofano, poco fruttata.
Al palato stesse caratteristiche, leggermente pepata, nota amaricante sul finale.
Corpo medio-leggero, ben carbonata.

Pours cloudy orange colour with really thick white head. Aroma: Mostly wheat and banana, honey maybe a bit salt. Taste, light sweet. Soft carbonation and creamy. Actually its like a big glass of milk with banana and honey. A really good hefeweizen. Loved it

Purchased, as Hacker-Pschorr Weisse, at a Billa store in Zagreb, shared with heavy, 1rice, cvitko1 & the Vunetovo people in Split. Murky golden body, slightly off white thick head, lasting. Sweet full aroma, caramel and cloves. Slightly thin taste, yeast, sweet maltiness, caramel. OK really, nothing special but tasty in a way.
Cloudy orange color with big white head. Wheat aroma with some banana and clove notes. Light sweet taste with pleasant wheat aftertaste. Nice weizen.

Pours cloudy orange-copper with a big foamy beige head, excellent retention. Aromas of bread, banana, caramel, pepper, citrus. Light body, smooth, medium carbonation. Lightly sweet, moderate citrus, light bitter
 finish. Refreshing, well-balanced, quaffable.
Bottle. Pours light hazy golden full white head. Aroma is mild, dough, clove, citrus. Medium-high sweet taste. Medium-light body, average carbonation (less than many wheats), smooth sweet finish.

Cloudy gold beer with a seriously thick pillowy white head. Nose of lemon, salt, and subtle spices. Flavor is mild and well balanced with a crisp acidity followed by a mild bitterness layered with clove and lemon. Thirst quenching and quaffable, this is a good beer for the style.

0.5l bottle. Muddy dark orange color with medium sized white head. Aroma of banana, clove, citrus and soap. Taste is light to medium bitter and little sweet and sour. If only these fruits aromas were more present it would have been better.

Anaranjada y turbia con preciosa y abundante espuma. Gran aroma frutal, plátanos y un toque de clavo. Excelente suavidad en la textura en boca, y rico sabor malteado con el trigo predominando. Toque frutal citricony con algo de banana y suave toque lupulado especiado. Neutro final seco. Muy buena.

Bottle shared with lots of people at Savori. Aroma: banana, orange, wheat, spices. App: hazy golden by the lie, minimal white head. Taste and palate: light to medium body, light sweetness, light dry acidity. Overall: an ok hefeweizen. Like them with a bigger body.

11.2 oz bottle purchased from Lunds. Orange Amber color with a large white head. Strong citrus aroma. Medium body. Very smooth. Flavored is well balanced between the wheat and fruit but is underwhelming.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromas of banana and clove. Hint of brown sugar. Banana dominates the palate with a hint of cinnamon on the finish. Slightly caramelized.
Bottle 500ml from supermarket in Miskolc-Hungaria,yeast flavor,tasted good,golden color.

A totally legit hefe weisse with all the tell-tale banana and clove aromas and flavors that are supposed to be in there. Cloudy gold with a big, persistent head. Classic nose and palate. Not as complex as some of the super-premium versions but Ive enjoyed every bottle Ive opened. One of my go-to beers, I usually try to have some on hand in the refrigerator.

Draft. Pours cloudy, light copper color with thick off-white head and some lacing. Banana aroma with some clove notes. Malty wheat flavor upfront with banana, clove, and coriander notes. Substantial mouthfeel. Very good overall.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A good weisse, but left me wanting. The flavors were all faint. The typical banana, clove, and crispy yeast were all rather understated. Thirst quenching, good, but certainly not the best out there.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2015 Colden colour with creamy head. Aroma and flavours of fruits, bananas, little notes of plums, some spices, wheat etc. Low carbonation, well balanced malty-bitter finish with sweet aftertaste. Very drinkable.
Had this on tap at School House Brew House. Refreshing, I wish it was good and I had two.
light sweet light spicy aroma,amber, hazy, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, nice harmonic finish.
Light amber coloured and hazy. Has a white head, creamy and fully lasting. Sweet aroma ,light malts, bread and faint spicy, yeasty. Flavor starts sweet,

Bottle 0.5l at Paulaner pub Belgrade Serbia.Pour it hazy orange color with small white head.On the nose peach.Taste and aroma quite light and not so well balanced,you can feel aeoma of banana and wheat, but too watery.

Bottle. Pours a fairly cloudy amber color with a moderate off-white head on there. Nose has a lot of wheat to it with just a hint of citrus and a bit of bread underneath. Taste is slightly sweet up front, and has a nice yeasty breadiness to it that makes it smooth and refreshing.

Bottle from Wine Emporium 290315. Pours with a big ice cream head that is thick, looks like shaving cream in a glass. Cloudy yet vibrant orange sunrise colour. Sweet and fruity in the nose with banana and melon coming through. Fills the mouth with a big banana sweetness. Thick bodied with a nice aftertaste. Head takes a while to settle. Great example of the style and I would expect nothing less from a German Hefeweizen breqed in Germany. Classy bottle with a swing top lid.

Single from the LCBO. Big creamy warm cap. Hazy golden-amber colour. Sweet peachy wheat smell with light spices and hints of bananas, yeasty vanilla. Slight tart mouthfeel, but a little bland. Light wheat taste with again, hints of bananas. An easy German wheat to enjoy in summer. Not as good right now as finishing a bad winter.Earlier Rating: 6/30/2010 Total Score: 1.9Originally review April 2004. O.K. I just had a Paulaner Hefe Weiss and now Im comparing with this one. Both bottled dates are the same (and o.k.). Both bought at the same beer store. Both Beer have that nice orange hue. Looks good up to here. Then, head dissapears very quickly. Very light carbonation. Scent and taste are very dull, very bland. Doesnt do much for me, now that I know that Mr. Paulaner kicks Mr. Pschorrs butt. (no I do not work for Paulaners brewery).

Bready banana, honey, and lemon nose, not like banana bread, but more like good dinner rolls with banana accents. Hazy amber, thick head, good lacing. Traditional bready banana notes, but with a nice presence of honey that isnt altogether common for the style. Medium body, light carbonation. Exemplary, consistent, accessible, and affordable.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2015 Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 10A). Bottle 50 cl - Batch L17151G. AROMA: notes of banana, clove and slight vanilla and bubblegum. faint wheat background. APPEARANCE: dark gold color and slightly hazy. large moussy white head with average retention. TASTE: moderate-low wheat flavour with notes similar to the aromas (clove, banana). low bitterness with a semi-sweet finish. PALATE: medium-light body with a slight fluffy texture. high carbonation. OVERALL: a good average weizen.

Bottle, 50cL. Home. A brown-orange beer ; light opaque ; big white creamy head ; good retention. No lacing. Aroma of banana, pear, clove, light biscuit, grain. Light sweet, light bitter, refreshing. Medium body, smooth texture, good carbonation, medium sweet spicy finish. Overall, a refreshing pleasant hefeweizen ; classic.

Tasted as Hacker-Pschorr Weisse. Classic Bavarian Hefeweizen with very thick, rocky, stable, frothy, yellowish white head with good lacing; colour a brownishly hued peach blonde, misty with strong fizz piercing through. Spicy and even somewhat sharpish, but pleasant aroma of cloves, nutmeg, dried apricot, hint of banana, dried leaves, straw, cardboard (probably from ageing too long), mango, bakers yeast, starch, toasted bread. Refreshing in the mouth as expected, with a kind of dried fruitiness at first, strongish carbonation, rounded, soft and smooth, somewhat starchy mouthfeel, sourish wheat accent accompanying the fruitiness; dryishly yeasty and wheaty finish with retronasal spiciness, as well as a hint of floral and herbal hops with a lightly bittering effect. Very quenching, a well-crafted Hefeweizen indeed, with its own personality, in laying more emphasis on the dry spiciness of the Weizen yeast than the banana-like fruitiness.

Nose is strongly barley with hints of grain as it pours. It settles into yeast and a sweet note of caster sugar. Very slight banana and cloves emerges; all a little bland.

Taste is cream, banana, a hint of candy floss, slight cloves, banana milkshake, a little spice, cereal yeast. 

Mouthfeel is quite full but there is a thinness in the finish.

Its an alright beer, which has some strong notes, but it never seems to get out of third gear.
500ml bottle (says weisse") into glass. Beautiful banana aroma. Cloudy golden beer with solid creamy white head. Thin body but refreshing. Bitter/fruity finish. Good not great.

Pours orange with nice head. Smells: citrusy. Mouthfeel is light. Taste: citrus and yeast. A very ordinary wheat beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Hazy golden orange. Nice head!
Aroma: Citrus, wheat. Grapefruit.
Taste: Nice wheat, citrus, banana. Good balance.
Bought: Coop (Switzerland), 500 ml, CHF ?.??
Info: 7/2-2015, BB: 28/2-2015
Hazy, orange appearance, medium head. Malty banana aroma, low acidity, balanced. Good Hefeweizen.

0.5l bottle. Hazy orange color with big creamy white head and lacing. Aroma is cloves, banana, yeast and wheat. Taste is sweet with banana, wheat and yeast. Medium body and average carbonation. Overall its great hefeweizen.
Poured from 500mL bottle. Hazy orangey yellow with white head. Yeast and mild banana aroma. Taste is a fairly boring yeast, slightly watery.

Best by 04.2014.
Poured from a pint bottle into a weizen glass on 01.31.14.

A: Orange. Opaque at top because of the yeast cloud. See through at bottom. 2 finger head.

S: Orange, clove.

T: Banana, orange, spicy clove.

M: Creamy smooth.

O: This is a Paulaner cousin. (Hacker-Pschorr and Paulaner are owned by Heineken). It has a bit more banana flavor than Paulaners hef, otherwise, its almost a clone. Its a fantastic hef. The flavors are strong, which I prefer. Excellent.
A fairly average and uninteresting Hefe. Decent notes of banana, wheat, spices and bubblegum. Light and refreshing. Not bad I guess.

500ml bottle right out of the fridge. Aroma is mild and neutral. Color hazy honey-like rich deep yellow-orange. Taste is medium sweet with a touch of bitter. Full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish. Delicious hefeweizen -- a classic.
Hazy golden colour. wheat. banana. Yeast. Toffee. Some bitterness. Nice hefeweizen beer.

Pours a dark gold with a nice foamy head. Tastes much like a Hefeweizen should. A very drinkable beer.
Had on tap
Yellow with xxl head. Some yeasty and liquirice. Some sourness. Dry finish.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle from the LCBO. Murky dark gold pour with a large white head that lingers, Nose is wheat and banana with bread, light toffee and light spice. Lightly sweet and tart with even lighter bitterness. Pear and raspberry with some cloves and nutmeg appear after a while. medium light body with prickly carbonation and a dry finish. Excellent Weisse.

500ml swingtop bottle
Hazy pale straw body, creamy white head.
Mild aroma; cereally malts, overripe banana & pear, touch of pepper.
Full body, slightly creamy texture, lively carbonation.
Malty body - cereals, wheat biscuits, touch of clove spice & ripe fruits. Mild bitterness, lingering pepper on finish.
A reasonable wheat beer, balance is a bit out.

I was curious to have this one knowing the long history behind it. It first exposes a fraguant nose with notes of beets and pickles (yeah, go figure) The robe presents a certain opacity of a caramel tone. The taste is balanced but no so interesting yet for historys sake I tried it!

Bottle labeled Weiss. Aroma of wheat, malt, citrus. Medium-light bodied brew. Mild palate, clean and balanced. Good stuff.Earlier Rating: 5/21/2014 Total Score: 3.8Cloudy yellow pour, a lot do white head. Wheat, citrus, malt, floral aroma. Taste is same. Extremely smooth. The nouns German and hefe to a T. The alcohol stings just slightly and then it is mellowed out by the citrus and wheat with a slight malt backbone.

Aroma: yeast, wheat, sweet, banana. Appearance: hazy, pale yellow, bit, frothy, white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: malty, grains, some banana, wheat, light dry finish. Overall: nice Hefeweizen, well balanced. Pint at the Champion, Bayswater.
Bottle. Pours hazy Yellow with a White head. Typical hefe aroma of banana and clove. Nice malty sweetness and a slight wheaty sourness. A bit of bubblegum. Nice hefe.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2015 Not an extraordinary weissbier, but still a good one that change from the industrial weissbier. Good taste otherwise, but we cannot find the "hiden" typical aromas of weissbiers such like banana...

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines and drunk at home. Hazy golden brown lasting near white head. Crazy that Ive not had this before. Bit of an underpowered hefe to be honest. Some banana. Bit of toffee. As I say it has some elements of a hefe but they are all quite muted. Not horrible, just a bit hmmm. OK hop bitterness on the finish.

From 500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange gold with a small but lasting White head. Aromas of banana, lemon, bubblegum and light spice. Taste is gentle citrus up front before a rounded banana note emerges. Pretty clean finish with a lightly spicy aftertaste. Nicely balanced and refreshing.
Poured from a bottle it is a cloudy golden color with a slight head. The aroma is grain and malt the taste is a tangy banana
From a 33 cl. bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with a thick white head. Flavors of lemon and banana. Crisp Dan finish.

Pours a clear gold with lasting fine-grained head and decent lacing. Aroma is wheat, banana, and clove. Taste is unfiltered wheat, clove, yeast, and grain. Pretty tasty, drinkable, and balanced. A standard for the style.

Keg at lescar, sheffield. Hazy orange ale with a glossy white head. Aroma is fruity, with strawberry, banana and raspberry. Taste is sweet and wheaty, a little earthy and dry to finish. Medium carbonation with medium/light body. Nice drinkable ale, cant believe they havent infused some fruit in this one.
16.9 FL OZ ($2.59) Pretty good wheat beer. I liked it. Could do with a bit more punch. but overall a very good beer.
Keg at the Bow bar. Pours hazy orange-golden, nose is banana, wheat, taste is similar, dry.

Bottle(s). Heavy wheat aroma with notes of banana and clove. Pours hazy golden colored as you would expect from a hefe with about one finger of white head and no lacing. Starts with a lot of wheat maltiness with a medium body. Finishes smooth with hints of banana and some clove as well. Nice hefe.
10.2014 (Butelka 0,5 litra) ZAKUP - Warszawa - Szklanka typu pinta - schlodzone - Aromat M , Smak M, Ogólnie 3.9

(Bottle as Weisse) Cloudy amber with dense BFI white head. Nice tangy aroma with hints of banana and apricot. Medium bodied with good creamy and bright carbonation. Nice fairly tart refreshing taste with good complexity. Bread, citrus, banana, pepper. A pleasant interesting refreshing beer.

Trop acide, pas assez douce pour une Hefe-weisse à mon goût.Lacidité masque tout lintérêt que jai à boire une bonne bière de blé : douceur jamais liquoreuse, corps velouté, arômes de banane et dépices, levures particulières et riches.
Couleur orangée trouble, forte mousse crémeuse. Nez de banane. Gout banane, notes levures et épices. Fin de bouche épices légères. Biere assez sèche et corps assez léger.

On tap at the Hacker-Pschorr Biergarten / Restaurant in Regensburg. Strong fruity aroma, complex, hints of nutmeg in the aroma. Light-bodied and easy to drink, only lightly sweet. Not much bitterness and very low in sourness (yay, any wheat beer that is not sour, Im a huge fan of). One of the best Hefeweizens Ive sampled...probably helps being on tap and close to the source.
Pours a cloudy yellow color with a banana aroma. Taste is unfiltered, banana and slight spice. A typical german hef weisse with an easy drinkability.
Nice Hefeweizen/Wheat beer. Lovely balanced profile of wheat, yeast, grains, etc. Good!
Cloudy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat, clove, & bananas; Flavor of wheat, yeast, bananas, citrus, and some spice; Classic hefeweizen.

My favourite Hefeweizen to date. Pillowy and snow white sits the head atop a cloudy dark golden-straw haze. Smells of mild spices, orange, basementy yeast, wheat and honey. The taste is great, smooth and leaving sweet hints of honey, wheat, orange and apricot mixed with very mild dank stank. Nice zazzy but chompy mouthfeel to her, youd be wise to get weissed up. Brrrrrrap.
Bottle. Hazy, brown, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & abrupt finish.
500ml bottle, pours a light cloudy brown with a white thick head. Aroma, banana sweetness. Taste, fruity sweetness, some pear and apple, yeasty. Interesting stuff to try.
Jól indul, de aztán elkommerszesedik, megcsalatja az embert csakúgy mint a reinheitsegebotot.

Bottle. Beautiful hazy dark gold orange with white head. The yeast filters through the body nicely. Perfect smell of yeast slight citrus and banana. Full and rounded mouthfeel. Flavor is really nice and funky with citrus but not too sweet. Only criticism is that you can sometimes get a bit of metallic depending on freshness. For the longest time this was my favorite beer and I still love it.
hvala mom prijatelju Kresimiru sto je donio ovo pivo ...za mene okus malo cudan ...ali moze se popiti ..

Brown color with a one finger tan head. Aroma is wheat, bread, malt, sweet and yeast. Taste is wheat and malty. A good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep caramel colour with a huge fluffy white head. Aromas of banana, hay, spices and bread. Hitting all the right notes for a hefe. Taste is full flavoured - banana bread, honey, with a light pepperiness. Good hefe.

500ml bottle. 05/14. Pours a slightly hazy pale amber colour with a towering off-white head. Aroma of cloves, banana and wheat. Subdued sweetness with a hint of citrusy tartness. Medium-light body, smooth, soft texture with an effervescent fizz and a dry finish.
A fruity (think apricots) wheat ale with a head to die for, this classic cloudy German brew is a perfect end to a hot summer day.

500ml bottle from LCBO. Creamy thick white head, slow dissipation and great lacing. Hefeweizens are some of the most beautiful poured beers and this is no exception. Classic hefe notes and aromas of banana and clove. Great carbonation for the style.
If you enjoy a cloudy, creamy wheat beer, this is definitely one of them. It is a smooth beer with one hell of a kick! Been drinking it for years.

Bue en bouteille de 50cl, couleur blanche, belle mousse effervescence bien présente, une bière blanche à lallemande tout ce qui a de plus basique. Un goût de banane en début de bouche, une continuité sur le côté farine et une explosion sur sur le froment.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; cloudy burnished amber pour with a big fluffy off white head, banana and clove aroma, taste is much the same as the aroma, banana, spicy clove, a hint of caramel, light bitterness, and soft carbonation, probably the best hefe Ive had.

Bottle. Pours a hazy, honey-gold, massive rocky white head with ridiculous retention and lacing. Nose is cloves, banana, bubblegum, fruity, slightly metallic. Mouth is medium bodied, creamy, light sweetness, apricot, malt, banana, white pepper, clove, yeasty spice, grass, toush of tartness and more of that copper penny metallic near finish. Nice.
UPDATED: AUG 2, 2015 Bottle 0.5l. Cloudy liquid, honey color. White head. Medium body, medium carbonation. Medium sweetness. Fruity scent, light sourness. Sweet, fruity. Nice one.

Transfer from BA review on 10-23-12-
 Poured from bottle into pint glass

 Appearance  Pours a hazy orange amber color with a thick and huge with head. The head has good retention, eventually fading to give a moderate level of lacing.

 Smell  The aroma is heaviest of wheat and yeast with some strong aromas of banana and citrus. When mixed with some spice notes it produces one nice hefeweizen aroma.

 Taste  The taste begins with a sweet and bready nature. The sweetness is mainly of an orange citrus nature with the bready nature being of a wheat flavor. As the taste advances more toward the middle, yeasty and spicy flavors come to the tongue. In the end the wheat flavor intensifies and combines with some banana and more orange flavors to leave a quite sweet and pleasant flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the lower then average side in terms of creaminess and thickness with a carbonation level that is fairly average. These are very appropriate for the style and makes for a quite easy drinking brew.

 Overall  Very tasty ad easy drinking. This is a very easy drinking, tasty, affordable and a classic hefenweizen . A nice choice and one to try.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2015 Cloudy amber color, huge white staying head. Some lacing. Medium body, soft carbonation. Aroma of banana, wheat, candy. Medium sweet taste, with no bitterness. Finish is dry. OK.

0.5 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a large white head. Aroma is very sweet with quite some banana, some yeast and wheat. Taste is also very sweet with quite some banana and a soft to medium bitter finish. Medium body, over medium carbo. Not too good of a weizen.

0,5L bottle, BB 01.15. Pours hazy amber with white head. The head stays. Aroma is very fruits, banana, and wheat. Flavor is sweet and sour, fruits, citrus, spices and wheat. Finish is very wheaty with spices. Overall: nice wheaty weizen. I especially like that the body isnt too watery.
Bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a big white head. Nose is banana, clove and wheat. Taste is same with some spice and light bitterness. Very drinkable.

500 ml bottle. Has orange colour with large white head. Yeasty aroma with citrus. The taste is rich in citrus, with bread, a bit of banana and spices. Not as sweet as Weihenstephaner or Edelweiss, has more of a bitter taste, but it does not take away from the enjoyment of this fine beer. Very nice drink during the hot summer.
From bottle. Faint aroma of citrus and yeast. Pours a hazy golden with white head. Very mild sweet taste. Medium body, creamy texture, and average carbonation. Overall a nice refreshing brew.
Scent of honey, orange peel, and yeast. Cloudy copper colour. Flavours of citrus, wheat, and caramel. Slight sour finish. Light body with lively carbonation. Subtle, but quite refreshing.

Veramente gradevole questa weisse!
 Secca , poca banana sia al naso che al palato, grande bevibilitá.

Bottle. Hazy, dark amber-orange color, with big white head. Aromas of drief fruits, banana and yeast. Taste is light sweet, with a salty touch and a decent bitterness. Carbonation is fizzy, texture maybe a bit watery. Aftertaste has some nice surprises in it, first banana and fruits, than spices and a lasting maltyness at the end. 

Well done Hacker-Pschorr, another nice beer from your brewery.

Serving: from bottle--purchased at BevMo!.

Aroma: light bubble gum, banana and clove.

Appearance: average sized, creamy, off-white initial head with very good lacing. Hazy, dark-yellow body.

Taste: moderately sour, citrus initial flavor and finish with average duration.

Palate: light body, watery texture and fizzy carbonation.

Overall: very good.Earlier Rating: 4/12/2013 Total Score: 4.7Serving: from tap at Brouwers Cafe.

Aroma: light, citrus aroma.

Appearance: average-sized, rocky, white, initial head with fully diminishing longevity.  Cloudy, dark-yellow body.

Taste: slightly lemony initial flavor and lightly sour  finish with average duration.

Palate: light body, watery texture and soft carbonation.

Overall: excellent. One of my favorite hefeweizens.

Bottle pour. Rich orange. Opaque orange with creamy white head. Some webbing. Beautiful. Inviting nose of bubblegum yeast, banana and faint pineapple, dull cloves and wheat. Taste follows, with a consistent hop showing pulling the equilibrium back towards just left of sweet. Yeast forward. A bit watery when you think about it, but otherwise a classic.

Pours a hazy dark rust orange. Has a strong orange peel, wheat and yeast aroma. A delicious taste of citrus, wheat, and light malt taste with a lingering citrus yeast taste. Refreshing but dry on the tounge.
Bottle from the Beer emporium, Sandbach. Cloudy golden with a nice big white head. Lots of good wheat flavour with a touch of spice and a little citrus. Nice and light and refreshing. Nice.
Pours a cloudy orange color with white head. Some clove, citrus, and malt on the nose, with a raw wheat note; follows onto the palate. Average hefeweizen.

Poured from bottle (Hacker Pshorr Weiss). Citrus malt aroma. Cloudy gold with white head. I taste orange , grape, hay, creamy malt. Full flavored. Just the right amount of carbonation makes this a very refreshing beer. A classic - cant believe Ive never rated this before.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Bottle pour. Nice finger and a half head, hazy gold color. Aroma is fruity with a little spice. Taste is similar, banana and spice. Really enjoyed this one.

A nice weisse, wheat based beer. From the bottle. Pours cloudy orange, big foamy head, some lacing. Smell is banana, wheat orange. Taste is similar to smell, almost a little watery though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2014 Orange hazy pour with a nice fluffy head. Banana bread aroma with a hint of malt. Great bready flavor with citrus and a bit of spice. Great beer.

While certainly a good Hefeweizen, this is somewhat straightforward in its flavors. A bit citrusy, a little sweet, a little spicy, but not particularly strong in any of these areas. Definitely drinks well, and Id certainly revisit it, but its not as flavorful as the best examples in the style.

hazy orange colour, huge, dense head, which lasts for several minutes;aroma of banana, bread, yeast and some citruses, maybe some caramel and earthy notes;taste of bread, citrus, banana and hints of caramel; excellent weizen

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2014 Rich, creamy and fluffy foam. Amber oranged color.

Sweet tastes, with a citrus hints and bread malts. Soft texture, but with very present carbonic touches .
Bottled. Dark amber coloured. Denseoff white head. Aroma. Banana, citrus, spice, yeast. Flavour. Banana, citrus, yeast, fruits, spice. Medium to full bodied. Ends yeasty and citric. Nice.

500 ml bottle. Hazy, golden amber colour with a huge, dense white head. Aroma has notes of banana, yeast and wheat. Sweet flavour of banana, yeast, wheat and a touch of citrus. Medium body, oily texture and soft carbonation.

500ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours orange with a light haze. Big banana nose, clove, bready yeast malt notes. Lemon zing on the taste, more cereal grain sweetness. Light body, creamy texture, clean, herbal finish. Nice.

Light and refreshing taste. Smooth and easy tasting, pairs great with BBQ. Awesome for an afternoon on the deck with friends.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a moderately hazy orangey amber with a massive white head. Aroma is vanilla, bubblegum, banana, mild spice and bready wheat. Flavour is Belgian fruity esters, vanilla, bubblegum, banana, clove and a mildly sweet bready/wheat. Great balance and a great example of the style.
Hazy orange/amber with a thick white head. Aroma is spice and faint menthol. Taste medium sweet and slightly bitter. Very drinkable, if not something Id go for often.

Nice dark-yellow, orangecolored wheat beer with a creme-colored firm layer of foam. The famous banana-like aroma arises when the bottle is opened. It has some bitterness in the aroma. A bit bitter in the first appearance, but this quickly moves on into a fresh, fruity aftertaste.

Mooi donkergeel, licht oranje kleurig witbier met een crème-kleurige stevige schuimkraag. Het welbekende banaanachtige aroma komt vrij bij het openen van de fles. In de verte in het aroma zit wel iets hoppigheid. Een iets bittere smaak in het begin, maar al snel een fruitige frisse nasmaak.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Lots of banana on this one. Very nice citrusy finish, a lot of banana, faint clove, high drinkability, malt body feels a bit different, a bit heavier compared to other hefes, still nice, would need to do a direct comparison to Schneider/Weihenstephaner to give a more correct grade.

500ml Bottle. had that beer a few times. golden straw and a bit hazy. the head is sustained ... the wheat odor is predominant . after comes the spicy/hoppy smell. taste is grainy wheaty and comes a small hoppy aftertaste ! taste like one of my home-brews. quite pleasant !

Pours a slightly cloudy gold with a big white head that dissipates fairly quickly. Nose is of grain and yeast. Very creamy on the palate with rich viscosity. Taste is of lightly roasted grains, a hint of apricot, with a clean well balanced finish, neither bitter nor sweet. In top tier of Weisse beers; try it with white sausages.

Shared a 50cl bottle. Pours a hazy orangish yellow colour with a thick white head. Aroma is spicy, cloves, yeast and banana. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is medium sweet well balanced with light bitter notes. Overall, a very good beer and I have another one in the fridge.

On tap. Pours a hazy golden color with a medium white head. Aroma of bananas and wheat. This is a mild flavored beer with banana and wheat notes. Smooth and easy to drink, and Id love to have another.
Medium body, light and easy to drink. Great refreshing flavor with citrus notes.

Legerement ambrée, tres grosse carbo, collet epais et persistant.
Des aromes de pain frais, depices et de bubblegum.
Cest une fois en bouche et sur le final que la banane fait sont apparition.
Ronde, bone longueur. Une tres bonne Hefeweizen

C'était la première fois que j'essayais cette bière et je suis agréablement surpris. Légèrement épicé et acide au nez, elle s'exprime beaucoup mieux en bouche avec des arômes typiques de banane et d'épices. La finale est soyeuse, sucrée toujours en présence de beaucoup d'esters. En plus d'être plaisante a boire, elle est idéale pour les brasseurs amateurs qui cherchent des bouteilles pour embouteiller leurs brassins. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amber, heavy white lacing and cloudy. Sweet banana aroma. Sips medium bodied elevated sweetness, wheat flavors are present. Sweetness in the middle and finish..apples, pears, alcohol, yeast. Crispness that compliments, but mostly. a nice authentic hefeweissen

Aroma - caramel, bread, citrus, banana, bubblegum, clove
Appearance - amber, hazy, frothy, white foam
Taste - medium sweetness, lightly bitter
Palate - medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, long finish

Bière brune orangée, totalement voilée, bonne effervescence, et surmontée dune copieuse mousse légèrement beige, très dense et résistante. Arômes de pain frais et de pain légèrement grillé, blé, légers effluves sucrés (miel, caramel, cassonade), quelques noisettes et un peu de malt fumé On retrouve également des arômes plus typiques de la levure à weizen, un peu de fruité (banane, fruits tropicaux), des épices (clou de girofle, poivre), et de légères notes de vanille. Il sagit dun bien beau nez, adéquatement complexe, adéquatement intense. En bouche, pétillement moyen sur la langue, et au palais cest très velouté, le blé fait admirablement bien sentir sa présence dans la texture de la bière. Au goût, beaucoup de pain frais et de blé, avec une saveur principalement sucrée difficile à décrire, je dirais surtout de la pâtisserie. La levure à weizen reste plus en retrait en bouche avec ses saveurs de banane et de légers épices (clou de girofle et poivre). Il ny a aucune amertume dans cette bière! Tout à fait délicieuse, à la fois accessible et satisfaisante sur le plan de la dégustation, cette bière est cependant un peu moins complexe en bouche quau nez, où on pouvait, entre autres, y humer la présence dorge malté, alors quau goût, le blé domine sans partage. Excellent produit!

330 ml bottle.
 Nice bready banana and marzipan flavor. Medium bready body, very slight banana aftertaste. A handsome beer, not run of the mill. I would love to try this on tap at a bar in Berlin.Earlier Rating: 9/25/2011 Total Score: 3.312 oz bottle. slightly tan orange colour- Looks like they squeezed apricots to get this.
 Very murky, frothy white head that strats heavy and fades quickly.
 spicy coriander and yeasty, buttery banana. Nice. med body along with the coriande and  banana flavour .
Bottle, pours an organish color with a white head, sweet taste of bread and some light spice, smooth and easy to drink.

Bottle at the Hope, Carshalton. It pours cloudy orange-amber with a thick white head. The nose is wheat, banana, clove, bruised fruits, dough and citrus peel. The taste is orange peel, earth, spice, wheat, banana, light bitterness, dull tartness and dough with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Balanced and very drinkable. A classic hefeweizen.

Drinking ice cold, and a few little ice crystals floating g in the glass. Murky light orange appearance and doesnt smell like much, likely because its so cold. A wonderful refreshing flavor shines through however. Tastes of wheat and orange, mild earthy hops. Pleasantly impressed!

Pours a heavily hazed golden with a medium creamy white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of a typical hefe with some nice and distinct cloves and bananas. Taste is not sweet and even a little tart, quite nice. Flavors are of fresh banana bread and wheat. Mouthfeel is smooth, carbonation medium and body light to medium. Overall a pretty good beer, true to style.
Bottle 500 ml from Budapest. Pours hazy golden with white head. Wheat, yeast and bananas aroma and flavor. Sweetish. Medium bodied.

Veramente una birra delicata, non raffinata né troppo presuntuosa, ma piacevole e dalla bevuta facile, senza retrogusti sgradevoli e rappresentando un equo compromesso tra bevibilità e sapore. Certo, non abbiamo un bouquet di odori, laspetto è abbastanza normale e non ha grossi picchi, ma in bocca il sapore dolce, la giusta frizzantezza e il corpo molto lieve ma delicato, non direi scialbo, la rendono piacevolissima. Bella bevuta, non la disdegno.
bottle. amber with one finger head. solid hefeweizen with a lot of spice and sweet wheat. slightly darker than most.
Bue à la pression. Belle couleur et jolie mousse fine. On sent principalement les céréales. Rondeur en bouche très agréable.

Amber, heavy white lacing and cloudy. Sweet banana aroma. Sips medium bodied elevated sweetness, wheat flavors are present. Sweetness in the middle and finish..apples, pears, alcohol, yeast. Crispness that compliments, but mostly sweet throughout & in my opinion is cloying. But nice to style authentic brew.

Bottle. Cloudy gold - thick, tight white head. Muted but pleasant banana, bubblegum, clove and orange blossom aromas. Initial wheat dominated sourness, with elements of banana creeping into the mid palate. Weak, hollow end.
This is my favorite German beer. Its smooth, very, very smooth. Tastes of a grand mix of wheat and fruitiness. Its delicious year round. Cheers!
Bottle 0.5l at home. Originally rated 27102011. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, bananas, wheat and malts.
Bubblegum and banana but a little bit too synthetic to be a great weiss. Does not have the natural undertones but too bubble gum manufactured.

11.2 oz bottle into a pint glass.

A: Pours a hazy dark amber color. The head is supremely fluffy, eggshell in color, and about two fingers high. Retention is impressive, and lacing is thick but inconsistent.

S: This is well hopped for the style. And that I can appreciate. The typical banana and clove notes are a bit muted here, but the healthy serving of noble hops make up for it quite well.

T: Now this is more like it. The hops exist merely as a drying mechanism on the back end, helping to cleanse the pleasant sweet cream-meets-banana flavors introduced to the palate. Its simplistic, but its smooth balance means...I kind of want to just drink it instead of review it.

M: Its relatively full bodied and a bit sweet, but that finish really does wonders drying the palate out without going overboard. Carbonation is actually a little subdued, which makes it superb drinkability all the more impressive.

O: This is actually one of my favorite styles when done right - and this is definitely done right. In fact, its one of those beers where Im glad I got a six pack instead of a single.

Pours a cloudy gold with a thick moussy long lasting head. Aroma of moderate clove phenols, fruity banana esthers, wheat, light bubblegum and vanilla in the background. Taste is fruity banana with some spicy cloves, balance is towards the banana with some light bubblegum. Light tartness on the finish with a medium light body and a high carbonation. Has a fluffy and creamy texture and overall is a nice drinkable and refreshing wheat beer.

"Darn good price for 500ml! Nice swingtop action too. Poured a thick generous amount of head, very foamy, a light brown hue (the head). The appearance is light amber, pretty hazy, cant see through. Wheaty/malty aroma with hints of banana and spices, but not too pronounced. Wheat is distinctive. Lightly hopped flavour, a bit of an orange tangy taste. Not too bad, pretty average really."
Tåget orange, fluffy, blivende hvidt skum. Typisk hvedearoma. Intet specielt her. En vis skarphed i smagen, peber og lidt syre, som også dominerer eftersmag.

I enjoyed this weissbier from start to finish. Poured a golden orange with remarkably long-lasting effervescence, which made for a persistent head as well. Aroma (though muted) and taste were both "soft" with the crispness one expects from a wheat beer and a surprisingly complexity of fruit and clove tastes with each drink. Nice mouth feel and typical wheat beer drinkability. This one was (and is) a great choice for a hot summer day.

Bottle from Drinkmonger. Murky orange body with a thin white head. Nice lacing. Mild aroma of banana, blood orange and chalky wheat. Flavour of apple pie, banana and soft pear. No spice. Medium body with a frothy mouthfeel. Lively fizz. Its a decent Hefeweizen, but doesnt have much stand-out quality.
Bottle. Amber pour with thick white head. Sweet aroma with notes of yeast. Taste is refreshing. A hint of bitterness. Quite low carbonation
Amber draft pour with little to no head. Aroma with caramel and banana with the same flavors. Very smooth, great tasting beer

Pours a deep amber color that looks thick as honey. Has a great wheaty smell and a delicately crisp palate without being dry. Taste is ever so slightly fruity, but otherwise mild and refreshing. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig, leicht würzig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig mit minimaler Bitterkeit.

Bouteille 500ml. Couleur orangée trouble, mousse blanc cassé crémeuse et persistente laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de banane mûre, blé, pain aux bananes. Goût de banane surtout en arrière-goût, légère acidité, blé, céréales, alcool, métallique en fin de bouche. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen-faible, un peu aqueuse.

2014/01/21 - Pours a cloudy dark orange-honey colour with a soapy, three finger, white head that slowly reduces to a surface film and leaves minor lacing. Aroma is banana, orange citrus, bubblegum and clove. Taste is banana, orange citrus, clove, caramel and biscuit. Mouthfeel is thick and oily with biting carbonation and a crisp, refreshing finish. A better than average hefeweizen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

poured from 500ml bottle into weizen glass

A - Cloudy, light, golden straw colour. 2 1/2 fingers of beautiful weiss head with great retention and somewhat decent lacing left on the glass. doesnt pass as much light as youd expect for such a light coloured beer.

S - medium intensity, herbal & spicy hops, banana, cloves, orange, maybe some red berries hiding in there (strawberry?), no alcohol

T - strong aroma of fcloves, banana, & bubblegum off the top, kind of spicy, somewhat floral, light hop bitterness, orange & maybe coriander

M - Medium body, dry, medium-high carbonation, goes down smooth, medium finish

O - really enjoyed this beer, nothing was overpowering, good balance, not sweet and not too bitter for a hefe, excellently crafted, will buy again

Serving type: bottle

SWING-TOP 50CL.

Look: amber and cloudy with a huge off-white creamy head with good retention.
Aroma: light fruity, wheat tartness, spicy but less phenolic than others.
Taste: light fruity, wheat tartness, light bitterness, again less spicy that your average hefeweizen.
Light amber color. Mild flavor. Heavy on the wheat. No head. Is do did I so do ak dk so do

Rated as Pschorr-Bräu Weisse  Orangetrübe Farbe, fruchtiger Geruch. Der AT ist leicht fruchtig-hefig, angenehm mild. Zum Hauptteil wird das Bier schön bananig (orangig?)-weich, fruchtig-hefig und ganz leicht herb. Diese leichte hefige Herbe setzt sich auch zum Hauptteil hin fort. Fruchtig-mild. Auf der Zunge bleibt eine angenehm mild-hefige, fruchtige Note! 
--> Leckeres Weizen. Kann ich es nur empfehlen!


Test vom 6.2.2011, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,12,12,12,12,12 - 12,00

Non dico che non si beve volentieri, perché sarebbe un sacrilegio, ma si tratta infondo di una interpretazione un po commercialotta di uno stile che ha bisogno di una marcia in più per raggiungere leccellenza. Maltata e bananosa q.b., alla fine ti lascia con la sensazione di esserti perso qualcosa.

Bottle in The Priory Arms. Pours copper brown with a big foam white head. Nose is creamy caramel, light clove, light citrous hop. Taste is light grain husk, toffee caramel, clove, slight spiciness. Some mineraliness.

(bottle) Pours in hazy amber to orange body with high white long lasting head. Aroma has yeasty fruitiness to it, like bananas, some cloves. Really gentle. Taste is wheat sweet with high, but very short lasting bitterness with hint of acidity. Body is oily, thick, with high carbonation.

A little cloudy at first it clears up as it sits. Taste like a good clean wheat beer with hints of caramel and clove. After taste was a top feature for this beer. Very little head. Small amount of lace. Gorgeous cider color. Caramel was the dominant smell.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle with my favorite person Beyondbud Brandy. Small head, hazy orange color. Aroma is not very strong, wheat. Good taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. A very nicely done hefe. Very flavourful, medium-light bodied, with notes of sweet fruit and light citrus, light spices and bread. Light and refreshing, but still very tasty.

Bottle. Hazy amber liquid with medium white head. Aroma of clove, bread, banana, toast and light bubblegum. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of banana, clove and bread. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. A bit too sweet, but otherwise Ok.

On tap at local pizza joint in Pewaukee. Pours a hazy yellow orange with a white head. Aroma has light sweet fruits, some wheat and some spices. Taste is of wheat, lemony fruit and cloves. Light to medium bodied. Finishes quickly. It is what it is, probably lightly refreshing in the summertime.

Aroma: light malt smell with citrus notes

Taste: german sweet wheat tastes quite smooth, clove and citrus flavors

Appearance: Cloudy light orange body

Typical hefe weisse. If you like the style you will like this one. Hazy orange with a subtle flavor of bread and yeast with a nice tart finish.

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy light orange with large white head that quickly collapses to a thin layer with lacing on the sides or the glass. Aroma is, cereal and spice. Taste is thin spice that changes to slightly sour. Not an overly impressive brew.
UPDATED: DEC 4, 2013 blonde bouteille 500ml. arome fleural et notes d?agrume au gout assez léger mais agréable. très accessible pour tous comme bière

Bière couleur de miel, voilée et coiffée dun beau col bien mousseux laissant au verre une dentelle souple. Des arômes fruités de pâte à pain, de banane. Elle est peu amère et peu sucrée. Elle est crémeuse, de corps léger, bien effervescente et se termine sur une fin honnête et aromatique.

A well balanced, refreshing Hefe. I could appreciate more explosive flavors.
Olfactif: Les premiers arômes sont très bananes avec des notes de cannelle et de gomme baloune. Un nez assez fruité dont la levure domine.
Visuel: Dorée, tirant sur le ambré; floue avec une mousse très épaisse (2 doigts), dense, crémeuse et à très longue persistance. Jattendais une belle dentelle qui nest jamais venue.
Gustatif: Lattaque est marquée par leffervescence en bouche. Les sucres sont actifs avec des notes de banane, de cannelle et une très légère acidité. Très équilibrée en bouche, elle est marquée par son effervescence soutenue, la rendant très rafraichissante. Sa texture est moyenne et présente une bonne rondeur. On voudrait cependant que ses saveurs soient plus élaborées.

The first time, I hate a HefeWeizen...
There is no lot of taste and an unpleasant "water" taste
Never more!

Nice aroma of sweet sugar, some hints of bubble gum, and spices. Nice dark golden color with a white thick head that. Sweet up front. Notes of citrus, bubble gum, Sweetness is well balanced with a nice bitterness. Light texture, great beer.

500ml bottle into an English pint. Pours a hazy orange colour with a fluffy, creamy white head, some lacing. Grassy malt and loads of banana on the nose. Light and refreshing citrus flavour with a hint of sourness. Slick on the palate. The girlfriend claims that "it tastes like something that turned.................", but Im fond of it. Crisp and refreshing.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Taste banana and clove. I loved this. I would definitely drink this again.

Bottle into glass, cloudy orange pour with white head, aroma of orange spice, and some wheat, taste is similar, creamy and smooth, love it for its style
Nice light cloudy amber color, with a light yellow head. Really nice light sweet fruity flavor, smooth and creamy, and a great finish no bad after taste
Pours a nice cloudy amber...thick head which is oh so smooth...palate is cloudy till the bitter end...a great weisse...truly enjoyed it!

Bottled, 0.50l. Hazy orange golden color with large creamy off-white head, nice lacing and sparkling pperance. Aroma of moderate grainy malt, light herbal hops, banana and coriander. Taste starts with grainy and mild citric acidity,with mild spicy yeast in the mouthfeel, while finished with very light bitterness. Medium body, slick texture and soft natural carbonation in palate. Its a bit disappointing, because I expected perfect weizen. It lacks richness, surprisingly plain mouthfeel, otherwise very drinkable...
Appearance: Opaque&amber in colour, lacing is goodAroma: CaramelTaste: Citrusy and refreshing

Aromas of banana, caramel, sour yeast
