Spicy, slightly fruity aroma. Flavor is sweet with banana and spice. Not my favorite style, but this is a very good beer.

Excellent Weizen. Formidable cloudy dark golden appearance, with a thick, creamy, everlasting head. Loads of cloves, bananas and allspice on the aroma and flavour. Taste somewhat resembling of mulled wines, glögg...
Very hazy golden amber, almost orange color. Crisp, clean aroma. Excellent tasting wheat beer with a citrus finish.
Hazy light orange colour with really thick, fluffy head. Aroma has nice balance of malt, citrus and yeast. The light, fine carbonation makes for a pleasantly smooth, creamy texture. Low sweetness.

On tap at the Euston Tap. A bright orange colour, not super cloudy, not much head despite quite high carbonation. Quite a sweet fruit wheat beer, almost some orange flavour over and above the usual tastes. Quenching.

Nice cloudy, musky orange color. Smells of citrus, mainly
Orange. Tastes the same way. Pleasant palate. Very creamy.
500ml bottle. Dark color with thick, lasting off-white head. Fresh fruity taste. Nice carbonation, short lasting aftertaste. Good Weizen.
500 ml bottle.hazy golden, thin head. Aroma of bananas,orange,malts and yeast. Taste of malts, balanced yeast and banana.
A very nice hefe, lots of fruit (esp. orange) flavor with a wheaty, sticky aftertaste. Tried in Munich in 2013.

Keg at earl of Essex. Cloudy orange colour with a thin white head
 Orange and banana aeona. Wheat a little stale. Chalky

AROMA: oranges, citrus, dough, bread, 
APPEARANCE: pale, hazy, frothy, white foam, 
TASTE: light sweetness, heavily sour, lightly bitter, 
PALATE: medium body, thin feel, lively, astringent, long finish, 
OVERALL: nice oranges in the aroma, bit too sour for me given the sweetness, quite a yeasty set of aromas too it; interesting.

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from Total Wine Sterling. It pours a cloudy gold color with a lasting white head. The nose is heavy banana with a bit of spicy. A little dense on the tongue with more banana, heavy wheat, yeast, and a bit of sweetness. Classic for the style.
Nice, not much of an aroma, very, very thick wheat without an overly wheaty flavor. Mild banana, cloves, touch of coffee flavor. Excellent wheat beer, you should drink this.

Pours sunburst orange with a two finger cap. Aroma is over ripe bananas. Taste is balanced yeast, banana & candied bananas. A fantastic Hefe. Stolen sample from Dieters bottle on a cloudy & raining cabin fever day up north.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2015 Appearance with golden color, cloudy liquid and nice head.
Medium aroma... Typical of Weissbier: banana and clove.
On the palate, it is a bit acid and very refreshing!
Very good weiss!

How have I not rated this yet? Hazy straw gold. Nice spice, clove, light banana, and faint vanilla. Flavor is proto-German hefe with smooth, spicy yeast character, mild to moderate fruity banana, and light salty wheat and vanilla. Crisp carbonation. Clean, refreshing. A very nice weiss!

Bottle. Pours hazy rich yellow with stable off-white head. Clear aroma of malt, yeast and banana with subtle notes of hops. Bitter, hoppy flavour, giving way to sweetish, estery and malty notes, as well as subtle citric touches. Ends with a mixture of hops and banana. High but not excessive carbonation. A very good German Hefeweizen!
Very refreshing German hefeweizen. One of my favorite beers while visiting Munich. Medium bodied
The first good beer i ever had and still one of my favorites. This is the benchmark all other hefeweisen will be judgen by.
Bottle. Hazy golden colour. Aroma banana, vanilla. Stable white head. Taste is mostly malty, with light bitterness. Vanilla, spicy. Mediocre hefe weiss. Drinkable though.
Bottle. Pours hazy golden, white head. Aroma of banana, citrus, yeasty. Taste is sourish, wheat, banana. Banana aftertaste.
Bottled. Many thanks to Rado. Overall a nice weissbier. Refreshing, weizen malt, nice vanilla aroma. The body is a bit low for a weizen.
Medium golden body, medium-sized white head, soapy lacing. Shows wheat, some citrus, and a dose of yeasty spice. Medium to light bodied, moderate carbonation, refreshing finish that lingers.

11.2oz bottle. Totally hazy darker orange color. Nice one-finger thick white head, with decent retention. Leaves decent lace. Nice citrus, banana nose. Light spice, nice yeast character in the flavor profile. Moderate sweet taste, lightly spicy. Light bit of tart. Medium body. Lightly sticky texture, dry in the finish. Stronger, kind of pronounced carbonation, lightly soft. Solid hefeweizen overall. Good authentic German flavor to it.

Bouteille de 500ml acheté à la SAQ. Au verre, la bière est légèrement ambrée et coiffée dune mousse abondante mais qui saffaisse rapidement. Les arômes de levure, de banane et de clou de girofle sont frappantes. Les odeurs dépice à citrouille complète le nez. Le goût est assez similaire au nez et se termine par une légère amertume qui nous invite à reprendre rapidement une autre gorgée. Excellente weisse bien balancée.

50cl fliptop, local Edeka. Medium-full mf, spicy taste of clove, ripe apple (compote) and stalish peppery hops (shame about the extract.) Traces of (open fermentation?) citric/wheat acidity. Rich and traditional Bavarian breakfast-Weisse.
Hazy orange colour with a frothy white head. Aroma is fruity, wheat, a bit soapy. Taste is sweet with a sour, light salty finish. Oily texture with a medium carbonation. OK.

50cl bottle from Tengelmann in Munich. Pours a cloudy orange colored body with an inch thick, foamy and frothy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is lightly sweetened wheats and a touch of caramel with a nice banana and smooth clove note. Flavor is similar. A light caramel goes nicely with a lightly sweetened wheat malt backing. A good amount of banana esters, a nice clove spice, and a light yeast note before this finishes clean and very lightly bitter before leaving a fairly lengthy aftertaste. Medium, smooth body and a soft, moderately active carbonation. Overall, a solid hefe. Clean, flavorful, and balanced. Good one.
Apply more than cloves, its ok, a bit sour but that could be the age, time to give it sec

added lemon, pours hazy gold, light head, some lacing. Obviously wheat flavor, but some underlying clove and banana a bit of funk at end. Maybe the keg got a bit funky or the other beers we had were messing with our palates.

The "Summer of Weiss" continues. Pours a caramel with a fluffy white head. Nose is earthy, herbal, somewhat strange and less estery than many others. Mouth is some sweeter malts and banana, but lots of dry earthy flavors through the palate. I just realized its not a true wheat beer, and I get it. Light bitter, herbal, finish. Soft, pleasant feel. Sentence summing it up.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a pale orange color with a off white foamy head that leaves some lacing. Aroma has yeast bread and lemon. Taste is bready yeast some orange peel and lemon zest. Palate is thin and full carbonation with a chalky dry finish. Nice wheat beer.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange colour with a thin white head, wheat aroma, the taste is soft with wheat and a dry finish.
Hacker-Pschorr (Hefe) Weisseeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee good bee

Hazy light brown with decent head.
Aroma of wheat, spicy yeast and bit of banana

I poured two 11.2oz bottles into a weizen glass. They had a best before date of September 2012. A six-pack cost me $10.99 which means each bottle cost about $1.83 ($0.16 per ounce).

Appearance: Pours to a very murky rusty orange/brown hue. Only slightly translucent, though carbonation bubbles are easily visible. Forms a rather small, off white, foamy head which never completely dissipates but leaves on minor lacing on the glass.

Smell: All the usual suspects found in a German hefeweizen: banana, clove, cinnamon bread. There is a slight sourness but thats almost assuredly due to the age of the bottles.

Taste: I should disclaim this review by acknowledging the fact its based on bottles that are about nine months past their freshness date. However, I have had Hacker-Pschorr Weisse many times and Ive found it to be one of the better German hefeweizens (though I like Schneider and Weihenstephaner much more). For bottles that are quite possibly a year old they have held up rather well. 

There isnt much to say about the palette here that hasnt already been said about others of the style. You get the classic banana, clove and bready flavors you want in a beer of the style. Though theyre noticeably mild here (probably due to the age). There is still plenty of sweetness on the back end, which is pleasant. Theres some bubblegum flavors as well, especially at warmer temperatures. A fresh bottle would probably garner a higher rating from me, but even these old bottles are still quite enjoyable.

Drinkability: I think hefeweizen is a great style to introduce people to craft beer and Hacker-Pschorr Weisse might be the ideal of the ideal. The mild but flavorful palette is gentle on the tongue. The mouthfeel is soft and comfortable with enough effervescent to give it some zip. It finishes clean and is quite refreshing while in the mouth. At 5.5% ABV its about average in weight for the style, though something a little lighter would be preferable.

Pours a nice hazy amber orange with a beige head. Strong malt with some fruitiness on the nose. Good flavor into the mouth and through the swallow. Very consistent and a bit stronger overall than some of the other HWs Ive tasted. Very good and would recommend heartily. Very refreshing on a warm summer day.
Bottle from TWM Chantilly- catching up on old ratings from Oct/Nov 2012 timeframe. Will add a review, eventually, though this is one of the better Hefes Ive tried.

Well, because spring has finally sprung, I decided that I should sit down and review some lighter fare in anticipation of summer.  While Im not really much of a wheat beer drinker anymore, I do appreciate the light body and gentle flavor of a hefeweizen or witbier on a hot day, and this one doesnt disappoint.Appearance: The beer looks very standard to style.  It poured a nice pumpkin orange-to-amber color with a cloud of almost 2 fingers of foamy white head.  Its very hazy, as is to be expected of the style, and it looks enticing in my weizen glass.

Aroma: The smell is spot on for hefe, too.  I get a bit whiff of that banana/ester note with a background of clove, some phenol spiciness, and pure yeast.  It is definitely bready and perfect for a wheat beer.

Taste: This beer has a nice balance of the wheat beer banana and clove (although the clove is much less present in the mouth) from the yeast and wheat and some caramel and toffee sweetness from the malt.  One thing I noticed is that for as complex as the flavors in this beer are, theyre equally gentle, to the point where Id call this beer delicate.  Unfortunately, that means that you really need optimal palate conditions to get all of the complexity; absent this, the beer would be tasty, but it wouldnt come off as nearly as complex.

Mouthfeel: It has a gentle carbonation, and it goes down nice and smooth.

Overall: This is a very nice example of the style.  While I think the Weihenstephaner is a superior beer, Id probably give this beer the silver medal, and thats mainly because of how delicate the flavor is here.  The Weihenstephaner is bold enough to stand up to conditions where your palate might be messed up from a spicy or bold meal, and this beer seems like it would crumble under the weight of garlic or onion.  Honestly, though, I think that the flavors here are excellent, and I can definitely forsee situations where this is the beer Id buy instead of the Weihenstephaner.  (Obviously, you cant go wrong in either situation reallyif you like hefeweizens, that is.) 

Score: 8/10

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur dorée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (agrumes sucrées, moyen de bananes) et épicées (clou de girofle, léger de coriandre), de blé, léger de pain, avec des notes de gomme balloune et de houblon herbeux. Moyenne-mince en bouche avec un pétillement plutôt fort et croustillant ainsi quune texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût de levures fruitées aux petites notes acides (agrumes, léger de bananes) et moyennement épicées (clou de girofle, léger de coriandre)  avec des notes de gomme balloune lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de pain et de blé puis en finale, lon retrouve une très légère amertume de houblon herbeux ainsi que des petites notes épicées (poivre doux). Post-goût moyen et aux notes sèches, composé de levures fruitées (zeste dagrumes, pelures de bananes) aux notes épicées et très légèrement amer de houblon herbeux.

Trouble, couleur abricot, avec un mince filet de mousse invitant. Notes rafraîchissantes citronnées dans les narines, avec des pointes florales et un feeling de tarte aux pommes (juré!). En bouche, des agrumes et du citron avec des relents de gomme Double Bubble. Très pétillante. Ensuite, lécorce dorange et les épices nous abandonnent dans un «fade out» évocateur. Bon équilibre entre lacidité, lamertume et le sucre.

500 ml bottle into weizen glass, best before 1/2013.  Pours very hazy golden amber color with a nice 2 finger dense off white head with incredible retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts.  Nice soapy lacing clings to the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation.  Aromas of big orange, lemon, banana, pear, clove, pepper, wheat, earth, herbal, light bubblegum, and yeast spiciness.  Fantastic aromas with great balance, strength, and complexity.  Taste of banana, orange, clove, wheat, pear, bread, pepper, earth, herbal, light bubblegum, and yeast spiciness.  Lingering notes of citrus, banana, clove, wheat, bread, earth, and yeast spiciness on the finish for a good bit.  Great flavor balance and complexity; nice amount of flavors without being watery; no cloying on the finish at all.  Medium-high carbonation and medium body; with a fairly creamy, chalky, and lightly foamy mouthfeel that is very nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an awesome hefeweizen.  Great flavor balance and complexity; extremely smooth to drink.  One of the better ones in the style I have ever had for sure.

On tap at Bavarian Brathaus, at a calamitous but ultimately rather entertaining Oktoberfest. Surprised to see that I hadnt ticked this yet, as it was one of the very first Weisse beers I got into many, many years ago. Slightly murky deep orange pour, with a nice frothy head. None of the cloying esters and bananas that you sometimes get, but instead a fresh, ripe strap of yeast with some dry notes closing things out in tasty fashion. Still a good one.

330 ml. Best before may 2012. Poured into a Hefe glass. 

A: Pours a very hazy mixture of orange and yellow hes. Nice 3 finger white head, looking like a bubbly marshmallow. Wonderful retention and solid splotchy lace down the glass. 

S: Great funky yeast with some light fruit esters and light hop, pine. 

T: Great banana yeast up front, loving the fruity tartness of this brew.  Nice smooth malty character with just a touch of hoppy spark at the end. Light bubble gum yeast. 

M: Medium bodied, with a nice crisp, but subtly thick feel. Allows for great drinkability and a nice little bubbly gum yeast to be left on the palate. 

O: Ive had this many a time and Im glad I finally took the time to review this brew and enjoy every nuance of this wondefully crafted hefe. This beer started it all for me and Im glad I came back to revisit it with more appreciation. 

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-01-2011

On tap in Munich. Very anonymous. Nothing extra att all. Can not separate all this German beers.

500ml bottle
Aroma: it has a nice floral bouquet with notes of citrus and hints of yeast. Appearance: a nice robe, cloudy and white as you would expect. Taste: a bit sweet, not overpowered. Palate: feels light bodied, with a think texture, fairly lively and feels astringent on the finish. Very refreshing in summer. Overall: Excellent hefeweizen as well. Great summer!
Bottle from Alko. Thick orange color, white head. Bitter sweet taste with wheat, fruits, citrus and grass. Fruity finish. Very nice weiss.

Bottle at Tekehtopa. Cloudy light golden body, big white head that fades quickly. Aroma of banana, wheat and german hops. Sweet taste of wheat, banana, malts, maybe a bit too sweet. Saved by some distinct spice taste. Good refreshener though.

Aroma is fresh and has citrus, banana, pineapple. Hazy copper, big creamy head for quite long. Taste has aromas elements and bit whaet, malting more on top, medium body, mild carbonation, bit crisp. Ok hefe, nothing specialo but ok.

#800, it was nice to celebrate with a light offering - and a good example of why I started this hobby. The pour was cloudy and with a soft, creamy head, looked like watered down orange juice. Aromas were fruity and fresh, like produce in a store. For a hefe, the taste was a very fruity beer; lots of tangerine, pear, banana, spices and hints of yeast make for a most satisfying brew. Cheers!!!
Very good Beer had it on draft Sweet and smooth. Wiesse another word for good white beers.

Cloudy orange with a yellow sheen, white head that diminishes, but leaevas a bubbly film. Nose has wheat, banana-apple notes, some citrus, spice, dough. Taste is slightly spicy, wheaty, more apple and citrus. Wheaty finish, slightly dry. Creamy mouthfeel, medium body. Smooth, rich, easy to drink.

7/VIII/2012 - on tap @ Hacker-Pschorr Bavaria Bräu (München) - BB: n/a - (2012-850) 
Cloudy orange to beige beer, small creamy off-white head, unstable, little adhesive. Aroma: lots of banana, sweet, some bubble gum, almonds, banana candy. MF: good carbon, medium body. Taste: some banana, wheat sourness, little citrus, yeast, cookie dough, bitter touch. Aftertaste: banana, some marzipan, little citrus, little bitter, mainly sweet ripe banana.
Beautiful white foamy head. Gorgeous banana aromas on the nose. Incredibly smooth and very easy to drink. Really enjoyable.

Poured into a weizen glass. Pours a cloudy yellow orange with a 2 finger white head. Aroma is lemon, orange, dough, and spices. Taste is oranges, lemons, a bit of yeasty bread, and spices, possibly coriander. Mouthfeel is light and well carbonated. Pretty damn good beer.

Orange/Amber and opaque with a frothy head. Moderately sweet with clove and not very yeasty.  Light/medium body and lightly fizzy without much aftertaste. My nose is blocked at the moment so I dont think Im getting the full experience here.

One of the Munich masters. Had this plenty of times; just havent reviewed it. From bottle (330 ml) into a small hefe glass. Got a great pour from the bottle using the "yeast-swirl" technique. Head is cream-colored with a bit of yellow; huge and sticks for over 5 minutes. Beer color is like a Texas burnt orange bordering on light brown. Actually quite close to opaque--the yeast haze really clouded it, but pretty evenly. Aroma has a bit of the expected banana, but not much clove, and actually more like tropical fruits, in my opinion (mango or pineapple). Flavor is pretty clean; maybe a little stale, but Im not sure how fresh this bottle is. Palate is pretty rich and creamy. Overall, its your nice, refreshing, balanced, drinkable, German hefeweizen. Personally I think Ayinger is the best and Weihenstephaner is a close second, but you could never call Hacker a--well, a hacker--at making hefeweizen.

Cloudy golden amber with a big fluffy off-white head. Aroma of banana, caramel, wheat, and sweet citrus notes. The taste is really malty and yeasty; sweet, and slightly bitter. Lively carbonation, medium body. There are just a lot better ones out there.
Hazy golden pour on draft.  Nice head with the aroma of bananas.  Taste has huge banana and wheat, but not overly sweet like some hefes.  Some close.  Very easy drinking and very refreshing.
0,5l bottle. Hazy orange color. Firm white head appears, stays. Floral, sweet, wheat, malty aroma. Really mellow aroma. Mild sweet, wheat, honey in flavor. Very easy to drink.

Bottle. Cloudy golden brown color. Small off-white foamy head. Aroma of vanilla, banana, and clove. Flavor similiar. Some malty tones. Medium to light carbonation. Very nice and tasty. This is what I look for in a hefe. Something that is both refreshing yet solid enough to make you remember you had a hefe and not just any wheat bier.
Hazy yellow body. Fruity banana, nut, lemon aroma. Lemon, nut banana flavor. Long bitter aftertaste.

Color hazy golden. Aroma sour, sharp. Taste mild, banana, some bitter, some sour. Palate thin, some sour. Overall easy going.

Pours a deep cloudy amber, almost on the red side, with a small white head that dissipates quickly with minimal lacing. Smells of hopps, yeast, with a little bit of orange coming through. The taste is hopps with some mild fruity notes on the end, with a good balance of bitterness. Palate is a little syrupy but overall drinks well. Very well brewed german beer.
On tap at Ventis South. Solid Hefeweizen. Lemon citrus and spice. Crisp and refreshing.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a medium, off-white head and thick lacing. The aroma is bread dough, lemons, wheat, and light spices. The flavor is citrus sweetness and a little bitter and tart. The palate is medium, acidic, and smooth. Overall, this is a little heavy for a hefeweizen, but tasty and refreshing.
Nice overall quality, perhaps lacking the level of the other well-known german hefeweizens, but a good taste without too much sweetness
From tap. Hazy orange colour with medium head. Aroma is yeast, wheat, sour. Flavour is sour, bitter, wheat and yeast.
Very good Hefeweizen. Nice thick texture with a strong aroma of banana and orange. Very good one!
12 oz bottle. Im not a big hefeweizen guy but I really enjoyed this. Dirty blonde in color. Sweet aroma and taste. Could see it paired with German food.
bottle. Pours cloudy dark orange, large head. Aroma of citrus, spice, yeast, clove. A little flat; bad pour or bad bottle maybe? Taste is classic hefe, on the sweeter side. Good refreshing beer.
Cloudy color reminds me of summer. I prefer to drink with lemon slice to enhance drinkability. Nice aftertaste.
Copper colour, great frothy white head. Medium carbonation. Clove banana aroma. Pleasant beer. Malt clove flavour. Lovely refreshing beer.

June 16, 2012; 5.5% abv; 500mL bottle, BBD: 01/13; refrigerated; weizen.  Aroma is fruity with banana and bubble gum. Also some clove notes in there. Pours a cloudy orange, sort of a bright sunny colour with big foamy white head. Tastes as it smells: Banana and fruit esters still dominates but clove, spice, light alcohol and wheat are evident.   Very refreshing and light. Sweet, Slightly cloying finish with some nice carbonation.  As a refreshing yet maybe a but too sweet. Still a most excellent brew which is easily enjoyed on a hot day.
UPDATED: JUN 19, 2013 (bottle) A yellow-orange beer with a dense white head. Aroma is malty, banana, yeast. Very refreshing and balanced (sweet-sour).  The end is slight bitter. A nice Hefe.

Bottle. Banana, orange, and wheat aroma.  Cloudy golden with a large off-white head. Citrus, banana, and wheat malt flavor. Very slight clove in the finish. Medium creamy body, dry finish. Very enjoyable.

Pours a hazy amber color with a generous off- white head. Minimal lacing noted. The fragrance is grain and some yeast. The taste upfront is somewhat sweet and then the wheat kicks in. I noted just a hint of sourness. There is medium grain aftertaste. The mouthfeel is medium and smoothe. I really enjoyed this beer. Would buy again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0.5l bottle. Nice orange color with a beige head that disappears quickly. Fruity,yeasty aroma. Medium bodied, sweet, fruity, yeasty flavor. Very refreshing, very nice.
caramel, bread, hay, floral, citrus, herbs, orange, hazy, rocky head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,
Cloudy orange gold. Nose of banana and orange zest. Medium bodied with a sweet mid palate. Grainy with banana and pineapple on the finish.
Bottle at Next Door Pub in Lake Geneva.  Pours a cloudy unfiltered orange...strong wheat / weisse nose a be taste...mild but flavorful.

Copper color with thick, creamy head.  Cloudy and much darker than typical trigo de aleman.  Aroma is cookie dough at first but you can poke through and get some dried orange, pear, and apricot.  The typical hefe-weizen banana scent is a no-show.  A good gulp will give you a burst of sweetness with, but a security patrol of hops will hover around your tongue to ensure you wont ever call this beer a "sweet one".  Very creamy mouthfeel and low carbonation.  Overall it sets itself apart from classic hefe-weizen.  Fans of Chimay will find this as an inexpensive alterative if they can do with the slightest of hop bitterness.
Bottle from Alko. Beautiful hazy orange color with big foamy head. Fresh and tasty fruity taste, not only the typical banana. A bit light body but that only makes this more refreshing in my opinion.
Bottle shared with the in-laws. I like hefes... Thats all I have to say on that subject...

A fairly typical Hefe, a hazy orangish yellow body with a medium head and decent lacing. The aroma is a spicy citrus, almost nutmeg. Taste is slightly sweet, similar to the aroma; spicy citrus. Finishes fairly clean. Not bad.

500 ml bottle. Pours a foggy orange with a thick, creamy and very resilient white head. Tastes sweet, like bread, wheat and ripe pear. Bit of bitterness in the finish. Light bodied, creamy mouthfeel. Nice, but I may have been expecting too much from it?

Bottle. Pours with a mildly hazy golden hued body with a very large white head that leaves good retention and lace. The head has a fluffy texture. Moderate haze, no particles, good lace. Aromas are bready, lots of wheat malt character, lightly citrusy yeast nose, medium isoamyl acetate, moderate vanilla and bubblegum characters. Low yeast based phenols (clove is nearly absent), very light grassy character present. Malt character is strong and in nice balance with the yeast esters. Flavors show grainy/bready/wheat malt as the foreground character. Bready, wheaty, biscuity. Light lemony component. Medium banana esters, no hop character. Medium dry with lower than expected phenols. Bitterness is low with a malty balance. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel with a medium body, moderate carbonation (I was expecting a little bit stronger). Lingering bready warmth on the palate. Pretty good.

A classic German Hefeweizen with a very nice steady head. There is a lot of yeast in the bottle. The color is golden but quite dark for a "blond" German Hefeweizen. Aroma is slightly fruity (citrus), very yeasty, hay and grass. The taste is a little bit sweet but not sour or bitter. The beer fells very good on the gongue. It has a nice full body, is creamy and has a nice finish. Over all a very good German Hefeweizen!

500 mL bottle. Medium butterscotch, pleasantly cloudy, thick pristine white head, lacing galore. Coriander, lemon, fresh cut grass and yeast on the nose. Almost too easy to drink, a touch of sweetness, a little sour on the finish. Easy on the palate, nice clean mouth feel, lots of carbonation.  Wheat beers tend to be hit or miss with me, this was a hit.

500ml bottle. Haze orange colour, so typical to good German whites, looks like an orange without the peel in my round glass. Big yellowish head, with good retention and nice lacing. Aroma is hoppier than in any wheat I tried so far, yeast is also present, rye bread, coriander, citrus. Taste: first there is the hops bitterness, then the bread, astringent in the middle with a soft and balanced finish. Pleasant, but not the best.

Strong aroma and taste of banana. Some bubblegum taste as well. Nice and refreshing. Very good.....

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

pours hazy dark amber colour, nice long-lasting head, aroma is wheaat and yeast, dough, the taste is nicve hefe-weizen, not as good as Pszeniczniak from Browar Amber but also well balanced and full-bodied

This is one of my favorite hefeweizens.   

Aroma is heavy on clove and banana with some citrus thrown in for good measure.  Also has an almost oatmeal cookie aroma as well.

Appearance is a hazy dark yellow that starts with a big fluffy white head with moderate lacing.  After a minute its reduced by half, but still prevalent.  

Taste is where this hefe really shines.  Love the banana bread, clove and oatmeal flavors that seep through and mirror the aroma.  Very little bitterness and the beer holds up all the way through until the last sip.  Its a bit more on the bread and yeast side but I enjoy it.

Overall, one of my favorite beers to drink on a regular basis.  Goes down smooth but you know youre drinking a well made and constructed hefewizen.
using top fermenting yeast, it is then slowly lagered and remains unfiltered throughout the finish.
Bottle, 5,5% Cloudy dark golden with small off-white head. Aroma is wheat, fruit, yeast and banana. Flavour is wheat, medium sweet, yeast, clove, hops, banana and a little hop.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, banana, wheat malt, fruits and hops.
Citrus undertone with more hoppy flavor and aroma. Smooth yet slightly bitter, overall very good

Tall, flip-top half litre bottle, best before 03/2012, poured into a Franziskaner Weissbier glass in Oct 2011.

Only got three quarters of the bottle into the glass, so huge was the head (and how I poured it I suppose). The body is a moody, dull, murky dishwater brown, the head as already stated was huge and creamy.

The usual Hefeweizen smells, but subdued not in your face vanilla, bananas or explosions of yeast from this beer, a gentler aroma comes out.

The taste is also subdued compared to a lot of the Hefeweizen Ive encounted over the years. Its fine, but lacks anything to take it above the stand out ones and is just an average brew in my eyes.
Cloudy golden color, perfect hefe light faint citrusy flavor. Perfect brew for the start of bbq season.
Golden cloudy pour. Medium body. Lively carbonation. Wheat and yeast with flavours of citrus and banana. I agree with others, I enjoy it better in the summer.
As cloudy as a weissbier should be. Less of a yeasty taste than its German counterparts. Good smell. Tastes good as well. Could retain the head better though.
Hazy golden colour. Typical hefeweizen aromas and flavour... banana, bubblegum, citrus.

Light brown/cooper cloudy colour, a bit darker than hefe weisse beers are. Big off white head, that goes half way down quickly, lively carbonation. Aroma of cookies, grain, banana, vanilla, caramel and some citrus (orange). A bit grainy at the end of the tongue, otherwise bitter. Oily structure.

Pours an expected straw cloudy yellow with thick white head, decent lacing.  
Aroma obvious of wheat, straw, spices, and yeast.  Flavor matches well and is a very solidly drinkable hefe.

Golden haze color, with the regular weisse foam.
Nico yeast aromas, Banana and citrus are very strong in the aroma.
Same at taste,with an earthy tone. Nice sharp aftertaste.
Very good hefe weisse.

Im not a huge fan of this style, but it seemed pretty fresh and well made to me.  Yeasty, with some banana notes.  Bready with clean finish.  Is quite enjoyable with Bavarian style pretzels and horseradish honey mustard.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2012 50cl bottle with BB date of 07/12 to Erdinger hefe glass!

Aroma: Strong penicillin/banana aroma, quite floral, peaches, cream, light toffee, bubblegum...I could go on. Complexity is pretty high. 

Appearance: A hazy bronze color with a huge, fluffy white head that leaves plenty of lacing. Very appetizing looking beer. I hope Im not disappointed like I was the first time I tried it a year ago.

Taste: Sweet malts and banana. The flavour carries the aroma quite well and its very tasty.

Palate: On the thin side but the flavour components are very well balanced...just a slight sour finish. The CO2 is extremely fine and is hard to detect, but its there. 

Overall: I remember when I first tried this beer I hated it...too bitter and weird I said. How time changes things; this beer is pretty impressive. I like it more than the Schneider, but they are both solid beers.
Clean, fresh flavour with a hint of honey. Best served as a Stein. Subtle floral smell combines to make a highly drinkable beer.

Pours a bright golden with a full white head.  Aroma is wheat, orange, spices, and perhaps some banana.  Fruity taste, lots of citrus, orange, with a crisp sweet aftertaste.  More of a summer beer in my opinion.

No, I cant pronounce it either. But its a 5.5% German wheat beer, and it tastesyes, like wheat! Its a very sweet and powerful concoction, but is surprisingly drinkable. Or maybe its because I started with the 8% Faxe and Im drunk. Either way, its the kind of snobby wheat beer you can drink to impress people without feeling like youve bitten into a dry piece of shredded wheat. Bottoms up.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2017 
50 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 12.04.2011
Aroma is fresh with banana, wheat and some bubblegum. Flavour is refreshing. It has some banana, bubblegum, wheat and yeast notes. Good and typical weizen, but slightly too flat and straightforward.

50 cl bottle @ home, BBE 01/2018
Short rerate.. surprisingly sweet & malty and thus not that refreshing. Harsh score estimate: 3.3.

This is a pretty standard hefe--not that thats a bad thing, esp. on this warm March afternoon. Its cloudy orange w/ a medium size and long lasting head of fine white bubbles. Nose has some bright clovey spicy notes and a deeper banana character. Taste is in about the same range but w/ more focus on spice and perhaps a slightly over-strong bitterness in the finish. The nice, creamy but light texture does make this one drink quite nicely though. Right about now, Im into it.

On tap @ Saltys. Pour is hazy orange-gold with a white head. Aroma shows wheat, banana, clove, and light citrus. Flavor is bready and slightly spicy. Overall body is moderate, soft, and finishes lightly bitter.

The Beer Store, Toronto 500ml ($3.50ish): Although I had this beer a while ago, it was under conditions that did not let me really taste or remember it, so here it goes again. Pours a golden color that is slightly hazy with a nice white head. Aroma is excellent. It is a combination of banana, wheat, spice, and fruitiness. Taste is perfectly balanced. Mouthfeel is ridiculously smooth and creamy. Slight tingling sensation takes place on your tounge. It is sweet, but not as sweet as some other Hefes. Overall, top-notch wheat beer. Im glad i decided to try it again.

One of my favs drank this back in the late 80s in Chicago. Still tastes great. Nice head going for it lacing around the glass, Cloudy appearance. Smoky flavor, clove, bannana perhaps.Always a favorite. The best Weisse I have had and I tried quite  a few back in the day. So good it makes you want to have another which back in the day I did as well.

Bottle.  Forgive me, but my memory may be a little off due to the 7 of them i drank last night.  Big white head that lasts throughout.  So cloudy that you cant see your fingers through the glass.  Smells of banana, as everybody else has been saying.  Little more to the taste than the aroma suggested, which was a lot.  By this, I mean that I was reminded of banana bread, which may not seem like a big difference but it was a pleasant surprise.  Top notch Hefe-weisen.

Currently drinking while typing. A lovely prominent aroma after pouring this beer, instantly you are hit with banana, sweet yoghurt, wheat, apricot, toffee apples, vanilla and a gentle booze note. Pours nicely with a well sustained creamy white head and a murky orangey brown vessel underneath it. Tastes amazing, full of wheat, barley, banana, cereals, apricot, subtle citrus initially which fades into ice-creams and eventually a light hop taste in the back of the clean short lived aftertaste. A clean fresh palate, thin but creamy feel with a medium body and a gentle but adequate carbonation. Really good German Hefeweizen, possibly among my favourite of the style so far, though I still have a LOT more of them to try. Definitely worth seeking out, especially for a hot summers day!

Somehow havent rated this..my got to work shift session beer.  Quite murky orange tan.  Big, steady, creamy head.  Perfect banana clove aroma.  Mellow light to medium bodied, very refreshing and sessionable.  No real bitterness or hop balance, some clove.  Fresh, doughy, well done.  Straightforward, down the middle, a little more depth than typical though.  Quality.
barnyard, spruce, roasty, banana, vanilla, orange, cloudy, white foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

This is from memory but Ive had it a few times, so here goes. Hazy pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is of cloves, nutmeg, orange and banana. More of that spiciness in the taste, as well as some of the banana and a nice bit of hops. Medium bodied but never heavy. This is one of my standbys.

I keep finding lists of beers I have drunk during vacations, trips, a.o.
I found out that I have tasted these brews about 10 years ago, I most likely tasted more, but these were the ones I found on the list and of course that was all I found. I made no notes about the beer but only about the amount of different beers (like names, breweries and bottles).
Now this rating, is nothing more than: "I have tasted this beer and I can get it stored here (Ratebeer)" (for my own (in)complete list).
I do vaguely remember some things and hence the scores differ.        
So untill I drink this beer again, thats when I can re-write this rating.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: On tap and bottle. Hazy golden colour with a huge white head. Moderate banana nose with some fruity notes. Maximum tasty stuff, lots of banana, some yeast, fruity, a solid malt background. A beer sent from heaven.
Pours a cloudy golden body with a thin but lasting white head. Bananas, wheat, spices, dry finish.

in bottle at the RockBottom, Halifax. cloudy orange colour. big belgian yeast aroma with esters, bannana and a hint of vanilla. has an orange peel flavour, yeasty and lees aged. very classic style. tasty.
Dont know how the hell I hadnt rated this one.  Pours cloudy gold with a white head.  Aroma of citrus, banana, wheat, touch of spice.  Classic.
Pours a hazy coopy with a fairly big, white head for a wheat beer. Citrus aroma followed by a typical wheat beer taste and quick finish. A decent, well-made beer, but a little thin.

Hazy light golden color, with persistent white head.  Fruity flavor and aroma, especially bananas.  Some spiciness is present as well. Taste is sweet, but not overpowering. Medium body, lively carbonation.  Dry finish.

Simple and very satisfying, Hefeweizen at its best.
By Far my favorite beer!!! alcohol, alcohol, alcohol, alcohol,
Smell of banana and apples. Hazy peach colour with thick creamy head. A bit watery at least to start with. Fruity aroma. Medium sweet, fresh. A hint of vanilla.

12oz bottle from Picks poured into a shaker. Bottle says best before 4/11 so its about 9 months expired.  Pours a cloudy dark orange with a thin bit of white head. Strong aroma of over-ripe banana and clove with a little wheat. Taste is light sweet. Loads of banana and a small bit of clove. Medium bodied with a somewhat thin texture. Fizzy carbonation and a somewhat abrupt finish. Overall, its pretty good. Id like to try a fresh one and re-rate it though.

On Tap- Served a hazy golden color with a good head and some lacing.
 Aroma of banana and clove with a bit of citrus. Flavor fruity with banana and spice. A mixture of sweetness and tart with a bit of grainy. Has a clean finish. Medium body, smooth and quite refreshing. Very nice balance. This is a well crafted beer. Not my favorite style but did enjoy this one.

500 ml swingtop bottle. Hazy orangey yellow with a big frothy white head.
Citrusy, yeasty wheat malt aroma. Clove, corriander, lemon and yeasty wheat taste. Refreshing and effervescent. Smooth dry finish. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)
draft at oktoberfest at beer stand. pours a merky orange with cloud like white head. aroma of clove and orange. taste of banana and bubble gum
pours hazy, pale golden. nice white head. great retention. nose of apples, lemon, honey, wheat. banana, wheat, honey, esters prominent with medium mouthfeel. nice, long finish. solid Hefeweizen.
Really nice beer really refreshing cool bottle good taste nice head and good smell

Pours a hazy golden color with a nice white head. Nose is stonrg notes of Banana, cloves and some citrus on the nose and wheat. Taste is mostly sweet but not overly done. A little bitteness also in the taste. Banana lingers after the drink! Very good!

Belle couleur brune pâle, trouble, rapelle un peu la gomme balloune ou la banane  tant dans larôme que dans le goût avec un peu de vanille. Mousse généreuse et compacte.  Peu astringeante malgré quau premier abord elle semble lourde.  Une bière qui descend surprenament bien et qui est chaleureuse.

500ml flip top bottle. Cloudy orangey/yellow pour with average white head that sticks nicely. Banana and cloves on the nose with a smoky/sugary edge. Big banana (haha) on the palate with some spice across the middle. Generally uninteresting in the mouth with the spice flowing into the finish.

Do Germans make ipas? To me this is more like a wheat beer flavoured ipa from german. I am exspecting one thing cus of all the other german wheat beers i had b4 and get something totaly different. dont really get much banna and cloves and cant fully enjoy them cus the hips makit so over powered and heavy onn the belly. then side of my mouth lemon/citurs like it seems. its not groos tasting but i dont like it.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2012 (Just Weisse on bottle (Not Hefe Weisse)) Great beer. Aroma is yeast / bread, some banana and fruit come thru but not as much as the yeast. the appearance is true to style. Moderately light with dense white head that clings to everything. Tastes great; minimal fruit -banana (Over ripened as opposed to a sharp under ripe)- but a great breadiness and yeast character. Palate is phenomenal. I usually refrain from highly carbonated beer but this is an exception. It is a fine, champagne like carbonation and leaves a slight fresh bread sweetness on the palate. Overall, exceptionally drinkable!

Pours hazy golden with a lively, foamy, big white head.  Not a lot of aroma - banana, a little clove, maybe a light citrus on the nose.  Taste is sublime - banana, clove, a hint of lemon/citrus.  Finishes a tad bitter but very clean.   Taste lingers.  Moderate carbonation, a tad fizzy.  Very refreshing and easy to drink.  Can easily drink a lot of these - really quenches your thirst.  Very good.

In bottle at The Caley. Pours a cloudy light golden colour with a thick white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, lemon and wheat. Similar flavours of banana, blueberry and wheat. Mildly bitter with moderate carbonation and CO2 prickle. Quite tasty but a bit too fizzy for me. Nice lingering banana flavour.
Pours cloudy light golden with a small head, just like almost every other wheat out there. Aroma wheat, some barley. A somewhat typical hefeweizen. Not Bad, but just barely.
Very good hefeweisen. Not much smell, but a very thick pour, and a taste of honey and Casaba melon. Very refreshing.

Another in a long list of classic German beers Ive yet to rate - cloudy gold - surprisingly poor head retention for a hefe, but a nice lace left - nose is heavy on clove and peppery phenols - dry and spicy aroma, with just a ligh banana sweetness underneath - a bit of citrus - soft carbonation - creamy texture - medium dry and somewhat spicy - moderate clove - melon rind - finish is lightly tropical - lingering tanginess - quite good, but lacks the complexity of some of the better German examples.
On tap.  Comes a hazy gold with a large white head.  Aroma of yeast, wheat, malt, bananas and cloves.  Taste is wheat, banana, malt and spices.  A bit sweet.  Very drinkable and enjoyable.

(Flasche in Glas) Das schöne naturtrübe Weißbier hat eine dunkelgelbe bis orangene Farbe und eine feine weiße Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist stark hefig. Der Geschmack ist vollmundig, kaum süß und nur ein bisschen hefig. Der Abgang ist ebenfalls sehr schlank, aber stärker hefig. Im Ganzen ein sehr angenehmes Weißbier aber nichts besonders aufregendes

I cant say Im crazy about this hefe.  The smell is good, tbut their isnt much of a follow through.  Just a bit of a soda water kind of crispness.  A bit of the wheaty hefe taste but overall its fairly light in taste.
Bottle. Mild aroma of malt, banana and vanilla. Short yeasty and malty after taste. Average carbonation
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Cloudy yellow colour with big foamy head. Mild wheaty banana aroma. Sweet grainy banana flavour. watery texture, sweet aftertaste. A decent wheat beer.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2012 Bottle from Lukas Liquors in St Louis, Missouri, USA, mine was labelled Weiss throughout (no mention of "Hefe", but its clearly the same thing.) Poured into weiss glass. Opaque, golden-amber color, with extremely long-lasting white foam. The beer was darker than I expected, much darker than American microbrew imitations, perhaps as a result of traditional decoction mashing? There was definitely a yeast haze, but it was much less cloudy, estery, and phenol-y than American versions as well. The head never went away. I had to keep refilling the glass through the foam, and it persisted at least 15 minutes after the beer was gone! Very neutral aroma, perhaps some grass and very distant clove. Flavor was very neutral as well, malt and hops completely cancelled each other. Soft, mellow mouthfeel of wheat. Slightly citrusy, but no banana or other fruit. Sparkling bottle fermentation. Nothing really stands out, which must be the point. Perhaps the most obvious thing is the total lack of faults. Overall, Id have to say it was the most refined, harmonious wheat beer Ive tasted.

Pours a full frothy head, golden yellowish color.  Aroma of some banana, bread, yeast, lemon/orange.   Medium sweetness.  Ends dry.  Light bodied.  Creamy texture and also slicker.  Ave to softer carbonation.  This is nice tasting hefeweizen.  Goes down great, smooth dry finish with some sweetness up front.  Well done.

Enjoyed in bottle form at a place called Shotzees in Niles, IL while hanging out with some co-workers.  Appearance is a slightly darkish caramel (darker than I imagined for the style) with a rich white head, served with lemon garnish.  Aroma mostly of lemon, bit of banana, very slight pepper/clove.  Taste went down smooth, didnt take tasting notes but I remember this being pretty good even though it may have been an old bottle considering the other tap beer I had (Guinness) tasted horrid.  Would gladly enjoy again.

Pours orange and hazy with a good lacing white head.  Nose is some banana but largely clove and various phenolic dominate with an oxidized belgian tripel character.  Seems like more of a traditional belgain ale and not really a hefe but whatever.  Its not a bad beer.  This one isnt all that fresh.
Bottle. Hazy dark yellow, medium head. Sweet yeasty aroma. Kind of typical and clean taste, only the palate is a bit too thin. Good but unexciting.
Pours hazy orange-gold with a medium white head. Aromas of citrus, banana and clove. Taste has a hint of pepper, wheat and lots of fruity goodness.
Hazy golden with a nice head. Nose is dominated by banana with hints of citrus and cloves. Flavor is also banana, citrus and yeast. Delicious weisse

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Summit Weizen/Pint hybrid.

Appearance: Very cloudy light orange with a moderate white head that lasts awhile. Nice lacing.

Aroma: Cloves, slightly tart wheat, and mild banana.

Taste: Major cloves upfront, with wheat malt and a touch of banana - slightly tart overall. The cloves carry through to the end of each sip and beyond, with pepper and lemon as well.

Palate: Moderately high carbonation, light to medium body, exceedingly dry.

Overall: Great German Hefeweizen that is very dry and just tart enough to be extra refreshing. This has to be one of the ideal lawnmower beers.

Bottle @ Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Clear light orange color, thick white head. Smell malts, grains, sweet, bitter and light fruity. Taste butter, malts, grains, and sweet. Sticky texture, medium body, low carbo. Above average weizen.
On tap in Munich. A good quality hefeweizen. Wish I could get this here in Canada.

Bottle enjoyed at the outdoors bar, Schouskjelleren, Oslo. A dense creamy blond foam, upon a cloudy orange colored body. Nose is sweet citrus and faint banana. Flavor is quite sweet and fruity. Soft wheaty, with a clean and fresh sweetness, though. Mild spicy phenols. Mellow in the mouth. Medium full. Finishes drier and more citrussy than the initial taste. A rock solid Hefeweizen.

Bottle - Finally try this classic. Pours hazy golden amber with a huge foamy white head. Nose is fruity, with bubble gum and just a hint of spicy clove. The taste highlights the clove a little more, but is still dominated by the sweet banana/bubble gum wheat goodness. Pretty thick and slick in the mouth, with nice carbonation. Fantastic.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2011 ( Swing Top Bottle) If aliens came down from Uranus and were interested in seeing what a Hefewizen should look like, show them this ...if they wanted to get shitfaced on a Hef , this would be adequate.  A rich banana and clove texture , somewhat dry and vanillary .   Tangy .  This is most drinkable and good enough for our alien friends should they visit.
Decent light beer. Seemed well-balanced. Got more of the hefe in the aroma with just a light flavor. Not bad.

Biggish offwhite head.  Hazy opaque orange body.  Musty yeasty
herbal aroma with mealy fruity notes.  Dry-sweet fruity bananaish
taste with mealy oily notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft mouthfeel.
Clean and fresh.  Dryish milky wheaty aftertaste with earthy
citric notes. Nice, and highly drinkable, but could perhaps use a bit
more character. (0.5l bottle, gift from family.)
Hazy yellow with a big white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana and yeasty. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet and light acidic finish. Soft. 110711

Bottle 50 cl, Alko Loimaa. Pours hazy amber with a huge steady longlasting head leaving lacing. Sweet, yeasty, grainy, fruity, spicy, sour and fruity aroma. Flavor is acidy, like aroma, a bit pungeant, cloves and tart. Finishes with wgeaty, yeasty and tart aftertaste.
Hazy dark gold pour with a huge thick white head. Wheaty malt and banana esters in the aroma. Smooth wheat malt body with just a hint of banana. Solid brew.
500ml bottle.  Great pourer, light spicy, heavy fruity taste.  A quality fruity number.

0.5L bottle. Deep hazed orange color, quite dark, rich head. Nose of fruits, foam is sourish and grassy. Classic hefeweizen. Fruity taste, some banana, malts and some citrus in the finish. And yeast, of course.
Medium body, low carbonation for the style, very smooth texture. 
Sweet with a spicy finish. Good one.

Gut anzuschauendes Hefeweizen. Stark bananig ausgeprägter Geruch liegt über dem Glas, mit Spuren von Metall. 
Antrunk und Mittelteil präsentieren sich hefe-fruchtig, kribbelig auf der Zunge. Im Abgang erfolgt dann verstärkt ein Aufleuchten von Malzigkeit. 
Schön gemachte Hefe-Weisse. Angenehm fruchtig und frisch.Test vom 13.3.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche
500ml bottle. Unfiltered wheat beer, rich colour and head. Sweet and fruity flavour. Crisp body.

A pleasant surprise. after overlooking this one for years.  $2.99 500ml bottle poured with a considerable light head.  Aroma first hit me as grassy, but has some sweet banana smell.  This has a nice medium texture and is more complex than I expected.  The sweet banana flavor is tempered by tartness and does not overpower (unlike several bubblegum beers Ive tried).  I enjoyed this more as it warmed up.  Will definitely return to this one.
Tutto classicamente hefe-weizen di stampo teutonico, sono anche stufo di scriverlo...

500mL bottle, BB 07/11.  Poured cloudy medium golden with a tall, sticky whitish head.  The aroma picked up sweet banana, tart lemon, and grassy notes.. the tartness was more pervasive than Id like, but it was aiight.  The flavor found semi-sweet banana and bready malts at the core, with tart lemon and cloves laced throughout.. refreshingly tart on the finish, but still a bit too sweet.  Medium-bodied, and again a little too sweet on the palate.. very drinkable stuff.

bottle in a weizen glass - pours clear at first and then turns into a darker hazy orange with rich white head.  aroma is simple and nothing special stands out.  Taste is light sweetness.  Aftertaste is oily and refreshing.  Overall, Im surprised this beer gets high ratings, but I still like it because its not overpowering but has enough flavor.

Pours cloudy golden from bottle. About half an inch of white foam results. There are some estery notes on the nose. The banana and clove flavors you expect were muted on the tongue though it finishes clean.
Bottle. Deep golden/orange colour with a medium-sized white head. Aroma is wheat, malt, banana and yeast. Wheat, banana, bubblegum, spices and yeast. Quite good hefeweizen.
Cloudy deep blonde with a good head. Subtile aroma of fruity malt. Great malty taste.

Pours out the normal hazy gold with big white head you should expect from a German hefe.  Smelled of bubblegum, banana, and a touch of hops.  Taste was nearly the same; boring wheat with bubblegum/banana tones, ending in a slightly hop-bitter end.  Crisp and refreshing, but boring.

Reviewing from Notes. I had this beer at the brewery during Oktoberfest 2010. An amazing experience. This was my first beer of the trip.

A - A nice golden and hazy color with a slightly darker tint then most within this same style. A huge, white and fluffy head.

S - Lots of strong yeast and slight citrus. As a home brewer, I was surprised at how much yeast I picked up on the nose. It smelt almost as if it wasnt ready yet.

T - More the same yeast with clove and banana. I couldnt get over how fresh this beer was. Id love to ask but given the size of the operation and the madness that had already ensued I didnt want to bother the staff. Also, I speak zero German so...

M - Perfect. Not too thin and with the perfect amount of carbonation for my taste. Less is more with me.

D - Great. The low abv and fresh aspects make this one a great one to drink in the summer.

Serving type: on-tap

500ml bottle from LCBO. Hazy yellow with a huge off white almost cloudy head...dissipates very slowly. Yeast, banana and bread but nice and refreshing, sweet with a slight bitterness at the end and some hops to dry things out a bit. Good summer and wheat beer.
This brew is interesting because it has a nice set up but a very mild taste. It is very clean, but why would I continue to get this? Ok but not mind blowing.
Bottle 50cl, a cloudy amber beer with good head. Nose is classic on yeast and fruit. Aroma is malty and bread, quite creamy, some toasted notes, not too astringent, pleasant.
UPDATED: SEP 23, 2012 Aroma is bananas, fruit/lemons and wheat.  The flavor is bananas, mild sweetness and a tangy/tart finish.

Draft at Milltown. Hazy lemon rind pour with two fingers of creamy offwhite head. Nose is fine, a bit singular.  Bready with lots of banana and some clove with a mild sourness. Tad grainy. Flavor is the same, very straightforward and inoffensive hefeweissbier.
Aroma of yeast and wheat.  Pours murky with a frothy head.  A lot darker in hue than most heffeweissens.  Tastes sweet but all grains.  Very subdued and not at all sour.  Very easy to drink.

27 May 2011, bottle. slightly tan orange colour, very murky, frothy white head. spicy coriander  and yeasty, buttery banana. pretty nice. med body and fizzy. doesnt taste as good as it smells. there is an earthy, dry bark flavour along with the coriander. banana flavour is more like a banana juice that has been watered down significantly. it is only faintly there. im not a fan.
Bottle. Cloudy, deep golden color, white head. Fruity aroma. Bready flavor with banana. Medium-full body, medium-high carbonation. Pretty basic hefe.

Pours cloudy golden with a thick white head and a floral aroma. There is a robust wheat flavor bolstered with a heftier barley malt to produce a robuts balanced flavor with slight banana ester and a yeasty finish. A pretty good hefe.

Wenig süßer Hefeantrunk, sehr leicht herb. Schnell blechern werden, weiter etwas herb. Sehr mild, minimal würzig, deutlich zu gering. Die Hefe ist hier kaum noch präsent, dadurch ist das Bier auch kaum frisch. Zum Ende etwas hefig-würziger, gleichzeitig etwas trocken. Kein besonders gutes Weizen! 11/7/7/7/6/7

pours a beautiful, cloudy light amber with medium white head.  strong aromas of citrus, nuts and maybe some spice.  taste includes some orange, lemon and bubblegum.  Given the beautiful appearance and aroma, I found the taste a bit disappointing with thin mouthfeel (yet strong carbonation) and just a bit lacking in flavour.  no where near one of the top hefeweizens out there, but still a solid offering overall.

Very pleasant aroma of light banana and clove. Taste in mouth is of rich bready yeast and barley. Aftertaste is short lasting but with a lingering taste of wheat. A lovely wheat beer definitely worth a try!

Draft at St. Louis Microfest 2011. Nice to see this on tap in St. Louis, even if just at a festival. This was one of my go-to beers when I first got into this hobby back in Chicago a few years ago. Anyway, it pours a cloudy but bright gold color with a more orange hue in the middle and yellow around the edges with a big, foamy eggshell white head. Aroma of wheat, sweet and pale malts, banana, clove, and cream. Flavor of banana, sweet malts, wheat, buttered bread, cream, and clove. Medium-bodied, with a good amount of carbonation and a wheaty, bready mouthfeel. Nice, classic example of the style with a sweet, creamy twist.

Bottle. Pours a hazy amber with a large, pillowy head that unfortunately dissipates fairly quickly though leaves traces of itself on top and sides. Aroma is strongly of sour wheat and some clove. Taste is more cloves and yeast with some banana with the wheat coming in near the end. Aftertaste is wheat spiced with some orange zest and clove. Palate is medium with some carbonation.

Pours a light gold color with a white soapy head.The aroma is of light bananas.The flavor was a rather generic tasting wheat beer.The was body was too thin for my taste and there was almost on aftertaste.Overall it was okay at best.

50cl bottle. Pours a beautiful bright orange (almost brown) with some gold around the edges of the glass. There are steady bubbles and a good head. The nose is slightly elusive, with some barley and some delicate vanilla cream. The taste has creamy vanilla custard and a touch of malt at the end. The palate is well balanced with a fairly big structure, a creamy effervescent (say that when youve had 10) texture and a fresh finish. Overall, this is a good beer which leans a little more to the barley than the wheat and so is less traditional than expected.

Overall a nice German Hefe Weisse.  Pours orange cloudy, aroma of banana and fruits, smooth taste, light sweetness, smooth finish.  I havent bought a case of this in awhile; I think it might be time.

50cl bottle. Pours cloudy golden with a medium white head. Aroma is wheat, clove and banana, as you would expect. Some little spiciness and yeast resence. Taste is citrus, yeast, a bit tart with a nice cereals presence. Medium bodied.
Draft at a Bavarian Club occupied by Americans for 66 years.  Cloudy variegated gold color.  Aroma of bubblegum, taste has clove and a bit of light spice.  decent.

Orange yellow beer with a big and blond head. Aroma is strong, wheat and sour, some spicyness; typical aroma. Taste is wheatish, bananas, nice sourness and quite lot of sweetness. Nice to drink, slightly oily, good carbonation. What else I can say; good and nice basic hefe; tastefull.

0.5 l bottle from Alko. Hazy yellow brown color. The aromas of clove, pepper and vanilla. Clovey, peppery and grainy taste with vanilla. Full body yet dryish. Nice refreshing weizen leaning more to spiciness than fruitiness. There is some tart fruitiness and banana but its rather restrained.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2011 Bottle. Golden, cloudy, small to average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate malty - wheaty and sweetish aroma, fruitiness, some banana and yeast. Body is medium, malty - wheaty, and lightly sweetish, banana, some fruitiness and yeast. Finish is average, malty - wheaty and dryish, some banana. OK dryish hefeweizen - although not very special.

Bottle served in a flare pilsner. Pours hazy light orange with a massive creamy white head. Good retention and sticky lace. Bright aroma of spice, pepper, yeast, and wheat. Sweet malty flavor. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture, and a semi-sweet, light bitter finish.

50cl bottle from Alko. Poured hazy orange with a perfect frothy white head, nice lacing. Aroma is wheat and spices, slightly peppery. Flavor is citrus or lemon notes, wheat and some sweetness. Crisp and fresh taste, short but fruity finish. One of the better hefeweizens I have tried in a while.

500 ml bottle. Hazy orange-yellow colour, thick and creamy white head. Aroma of wheat, citrus, banana and spices. The flavour is malty and wheaty, with fruity notes and a mildly hoppy and spicy finish. Smooth but a little thin on the palate. OK, but plenty of room for improvement.

500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a hazy golden orange with good-sized, lasting white head.  Aroma has banana and lemony citrus with a light spiciness.  Taste is wheaty with same fruity notes and some light clove.  Gentle carbonation.  Nice.

A: The pour is the typically turbid golden orange color with a two finger head that dissipates somewhat quickly.

S: Lots of banana on the nose along with wheat and a lot of bready notes. There is a touch of lemon and citrus zest. Cloves are present, but not overly intense. There is a little bit of white pepper, too.

T: Not quite as good of a flavor. Sweet bread and wheat are dominant. The banana is somewhat subdued and there is only a little bit of clove. Some light citrus is also present.

M: Medium in both body and carbonation.

O: Good hefeweizen, but I think their Oktoberfest is better.

500 ml bottle.
Pours a hazy orange colour with a small but thick white head. Classic but beautiful Hefe-look. Aroma of strong wheat, malts and citrus. Flavour of sweet fruits, wheat, citrus and some malts to balance the taste. Finish of wheat, mild sweet fruits and yeast. Medium bodied with a slick mouthfeel. Tasty Hefeweizen.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2013 50 cl, bottled. Pours hazy orange beer with a massive irregular head. Aroma: Banana, resin, citrus. Barley malt, wheat. Taste: Moderate sweetness. Mild acidic wheat bite. Note: I guess it is barley with wheat that gives the beer a mild sweaty sock kind of flavour - it is not really a bad one, but rather interesting one. Banana flavour. Palate: Soft bodied, a bit thin texture, average carbonation. Balanced hefe. (O-2.)

Tästä oluesta on muistoja. Amerikkalaisen ex-tyttöystävän kanssa tuli nautittua tätä aikoinaan muutamaan otteeseen. Olikin mukava nähdä tämän saapuneen Alkon valikoimaan. Ulkonäöltään Hacker-Pschorrin Hefe weisse on oranssia ja samea. Sen vaahto on kohtalaisen runsas, valkoinen ja kestävä. Oluen tuoksu on tutun vehnäinen, hedelmäinen ja hieman savuarominen. Maku on hedelmäinen ja vehnäinen. Jälkimaku on melko lattea. Ei ihan yhtä hyvä kuin muisteloissani muistin. Pehmeä suutuntuma.

Pours a hazy golden straw, thick white head, good lacing.  Citrus and yeast aroma.  Spicy wheat flavor throughout, with the spice increasing at the end.  Thin mouthfeel.  Nice bite from the carbonation.  Very refreshing.

Darky orange cloudy looks with profuse white head. Fresh herbal aroma with hints of some fermented citric fruits. Refreshing taste, lightly sour, lightly bitter, citrus notes. It gets just a bit watery. Medium body, oily feel, average carbonation and a medium lasting after taste with herbal notes again and light bitterness. Good.

A cloudy orange pour with a fluffy white head.  It has a very nice aroma mixed with wheat, orange zest, and some faint lemon.  The taste is sweet with a light body and average carbonation.  The finish is also sweet and just slightly dry.

Bottle. Poured a hazy orange color with a two finger white head. Aroma was bread, bananas, and clovers. Flavor ginger, bananas, and yeast. Some floaters in the beer. A decent beer, not a huge fan of the style, but this one was above par in its style.

Ködös, sötét narancssárga színű búza a fajtájára jellemző hófehér, krémes habkoronával, amely ujjnyi vastagon megállapodik.
Édes-fanyar, frissítő és gyümölcsös aromája gabonás/kekszes, citrusos és finoman szegfűszeges, íze erjedt gyümölcsös (banán, körte), testessége nekem pont jó, nem túl híg és nem is túl csípős.
Befejezése fanyar citrusos, édeskés és fűszeres, amely után egy édes-gabonás utóíz marad meg a szájban.
Ez jó volt!

Bottle. Poured a cloudy light yellowish brown with an average sized creamy white head that lasted throughout and had excellent lacing. The aroma was of strawlike malts and an earthy yeast with citrus and banana undertones. It tasted mildly sweet with notes of citrus and a mild banana flavor in the beginning and stayed about the same throughout with the finish being very yeasty with the flavor lingering around for an average amount of time. Mouthfeel was light to medium in body and very creamy in texture with a nice soft carbonation. Overall a nice solid wheat beer, perfect with a slice of lemon.

Bottled from Aachen. Hazy amber color with a dense huge white head. Banana and wheat nose. Aroma is banana, phenolic tones and wheat with sour citrus. Flavour is about the same. Medium bodied, well-brewed hefe.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange color with a frothy white head. Aroma is of ripe banana, spices like clove, wheat and some orange zest. Flavor is of wheat, fruity esters from the yeast like the ripe banana, bubblegum, orange zest, subtle spice especially clove and some doughy and bready notes. The body is light to medium with a slightly dry mouthfeel. Overall a pretty nice Hefe, that would be great for the upcoming spring!

500ml bottle from BC Liquor store. Pours a hazy medium gold with a decent off white head. Aroma has clove undertones with a banana-like flavour and some bubble gum. Taste is much the same but with a very welcome wheat after taste. Very yeasty finish. Quite good.

12 oz. bottle poured into a shaker.
Aroma:  Slightly weak for a traditional hefe.   Very, very clovish.  Much more than what I expected.  Significant amounts of yeast present.

Appearance: Perfect appearance for a hefe.  Mid-orange color, very cloudy, nice amount of head.

Palate: nicely carbonated.  Medium-length, slightly bitter finish that was somewhat unexpected.

Overall:  An average or slighyly-below-average hefe, in my mind.  Somewhat disappointing.  Not as good as Paulaner, Franziskaner, etc.

Taste: More bitterness than I expected.
I keep trying all german made hefes, this one was pretty solid.  Appearance for style was perfect.
11.2oz bottle.  Aroma of wheat and light malts and very little hops.  Flavor the same.  Average texture.  A standard German weisse.

Pour hazy orange with great pillow top of white head. Aroma lemongrass, pepper,clove, banana, and yeast. Taste pepper, lemon, biscuit, yeast, clove. MF a little slick but also creamy and under carbed. Overall a decent wheat.
Deep golden hazy body and a nice creamy white head. Aroma of yeast, hay, white bread, banana. Medium sweet and slightly bitter. Refreshing.
very very light. even for a hefe. light sugary yeasty flavour but i couldnt really taste anything else. wouldnt buy again

Bottle. Cloudy ornage with a large white head that collapses to a cm. Very wheaty aroma with cloves and vanilla, a touch of lemon. Taste is quite spicy upfront with cloves and white pepper, then gentle bready sweetness with some wheaty sourness. A little drying bitterness at the end. I like the assertive spices but its otherwise just solid and refreshing.
It is a decent Hefeweizen, nothing more. It is super, super clovey which isnt the characteristic I look for most in this style.

bottle
clear golden , huge finesmooth head.
nice dry hefe aroma. wheat, yeast, only faint fruityness, mild aroma.
flavor is malty, sweet malty, smooth very faint fruity flavor from the wheat and yeast, somewhat drier than most wheat beers ive tasted.

pours cloudy yellow with a thich head, very good retention, lacing. wheat, hint of sweet malts although dry, citrusy, spicy yeast. great wheat body, still light but a nice density. classic and good hefeweizen!

500ml bottle sample purchased at the LCBO. Pours a cloudy gold, with a large fluffy white head that recedes to a small ring. Some nice lacing is left behind. Aroma is of hops and a little citrus. Taste is also of hops and citrus, a little bitter aftertaste.
Quite traditional weisse beer. Pours with plenty of bubbles, has citrus as aroma, is light and watery (in nice way). Yup. I like.

500 mL bottle from Noble Green Wines served in a pint glass at home.  Ooh, flip-top!  An impenetrable orange/amber wheat/barley beer with a head that blooms if you dont pour it carefully.  I didnt and it ended up looking like a cornetto - but then I do like to expel as much gas as possible.  A nice aroma, smells predominantly of wheat.  

This is very decent blend, the addition of the barley prevents the wheat taste from overpowering and it slips down nicely.  Unfortunately like a few Rheinheitsgebot beers it could do with a bit of x-factor (couldnt tell I used to live in Belgium could you.  A refreshing and welcome beer but Ill still be on the Hoegaarden if anyone says witbier to me - just dont let anyone put a slice of lime in it.
Cloudy pale golden colour with a big long-lasting white head. Aroma of yeast, cloves and citrus. Taste is full of bananas with a grainy wheat mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2011 Bottle @ home.  Light hazy, golden orange body with an orange cream colored head.  Yeast, lemon, and a bit of spiciness in the thick malty aroma.  Yeasty, semi-thick wheat malty body with a noted lemon citrus flavor.  Very smooth and a bit more citrusy than other German Hefeweizen.

Im glad this guy comes in a big bottle! Big and bold, even if thats not what you always expect from this type of beer. Great cloudiness, billowy head. Aroma - cloves, banana, spices. Great sweetness to it. If you can describe a beer as doughy then thats what this is. Light, smooth, awesome bitterness on the back end. This is pure gold!

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2017 0.5 l bottle bought at Orterer Getränkemarkt in Munich. Cloudy dark yellow with a rich head, fades rather quickly.  Very strong smell as well as the taste. Sweetness, flowery taste. Aftertaste lasts long. One of the best German wheat beers.

0.5 l bottle from Konzum Radnička. Hazy golden, lasting medium off-white head. Light fruity, mostly orange, also some banana or peach, some grain, light metallic. Sweet with light spice, light hops present. Medium body, medium carbonation, soft and creamy texture, light dry finish. Not bad, but not impressed as I used to be.

Swing-top bottle.  Rolled the bottle to rouse the yeast and it poured a gorgeous cloudy golden colour with a big, billowy, white head.  Aroma of clove and spicy phenolics, just a hint of banana.  First taste is sweet, yeasty, like fresh bread.  Then the spicy, slight tart flavours begin to accentuate themselves.  Light and lively on the tongue.  Finish reminiscent of banana loaf.  Hugely drinkable, a liquid banana sandwich.

0,5 l fliptop bottle, Sörspecialista.hu, Budapest.
Murky amber-caramel body with a huge froathy off white-tan head that dimishes slowly to a creamy-lacing one. Spicey-citrussy aroma with caramel, clove, vanilla and some cinnamon, lime-lemony notes. Medium body, citrusses lead the flavor profile, orange-lemon peel, some banana, caramel and the regular spicey character. Some hop in the finish, lemony-herbal aftertaste. Expected more.

12 ounce bottle from the Sharper Edge Brasserie. Pours a cloudy orange color with a large white head. A spicy banana and yeast nose. The flavor is rich smooth malts, banana esters, yeasty, rich, a nice full mouthfeel. Good.

Sörspecialista, Budapest.

Sötét borostyán sárga színű búza a szokásos szűretlen jellemzőkkel. Habja hatalmas, kemény, tömör, fehér és nagyon lassan olvad le, de nem nyom nélkül. Élesztős, citrusos, banános és igen malátás illata van. Ízében inkább a citrusos jegyek dominálnak, mint a banánosak. Szegfűszeg, sok búza maláta, kis fehér bors, koriander, friss élesztő, selyemcukor és egy kevés komló, amíg még érződnek benne. Sűrű, szinte harapható és igen szénsavas, ami mind jellemzőek a család finomabb tagjaira. Utóíze teás, grapefruitos, de elég gyorsan lecseng. Igen üdítő és könnyen iható búza, méltó a nagy múltú márkához.

Hazy blond color with a small persistent head, some lacing.  Wheat and touch of fruit aroma.  Taste starts with semi-sweet malt, constant through a medium mouthfeel to a slightly bitter finish.  Easy to drink, but nothing out of the ordinary.

50 cl flaske med patent prop. Gylden med diset krop og stort hvidt hoved. Aroma af hvede, banan og sød citron. Smag sødlig hvede og en smule citron. Blød gane. En forfriskende øl, en sommeraften. D-B-20,00

at same bar, some gulps from a friends glass who didnt like the beer that much. Typical witbier looks with small white head; Smell: some sweetness? Taste: very monotone and sugary taste. Not so special but has no negative taste within it.

Pours golden hue with a nice white fluffy head. Aroma is wheat, light fruitiness, and banana. Taste is same as aroma. Palate is light body and carbonation. Finish is light fruitiness, wheat, some slight nuttiness and banana ending. Overall a nice refreshing wheat ale.

Tap, 33 cl. Blond, hazy beer with medium white head. Aroma of barley and hops, or the typical Witbier-aroma without the citrus and the spices. Taste is hoppy and grainy, with a malty background and a yeasty aftertaste. Tastes like Witbier with something missing in it.

Smells sweet, citrusy and a tad floral.  Pours a hazy golden with a thick white head.  Tastes like a classic hefe, sweet, lighter build.  Very soft on the palate with a citrus finish and a decent fizziness.  Fantastic beer and easily a favorite.

Lagered wheat beer. On tap, hazy orange pour with white foamy head. Aroma of clove, lemon, fruity esters, touch of bread. Taste is nice and easy, with notes of esters, bread, touch of spice. Flavors a bit subdued, but normal for a lagered brew. Not bad, refreshing with a pile of wings.
"Wiessn mass". Light amber with a large white head. This must be late at night at the Octoberfest 2009 he he, short written. Aroma and flavor, malt and wheat.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazed yellow color with a nice 2 finger fluffy white head. Nice aroma of banana, clove, wheat, and slight malt. Slight grassy, sweet, clove, and banana taste. Lingering sweet biscuit flavor that carries on for a while. A very easy drinking beer but nothing overally special either. Medium mouthfeel.

Another solid German Hefe. Medium hazy orange brew with a wonderful banana and clove aroma. Flavor is sprite with fruit and spice. A bit fizzy though. Deduction on palate. Finish is clean with a dry breadiness.
Pours a murky dark yellow/amber with sumptuous, pillowy, lingering head.  Very aromatic this one.  Orange, clove, and especially banana.  Very bright flavours.  Finish is disappointingly short.
On tap at capitol ale house. Hazy gold color with a thick white head. Aroma of bananas and a general citrus air.  Very smooth and easy drinking  beer. Hefty citrus taste, banana. A

Again, not a wheat fan here, but this is probably the second best wheat Ive ever had.  Lemony, refreshing, enough bitterness for me.  Not as "sour" (to me) as other hefe weisse that Ive tried.  Ill have one every once in a while for a change of pace.

Nice Hefewiezen aroma, deep copper almost orange color, opaque and very soft looking.  Needs a lemon to help the taste - it is a bit clove heavy for me, I like the more banana ester flavor than the clove.  Great beer if you want a Hefe on tap at a bar not specializing in German beers - if you are looking for a good example of this style, you can do better.

Home refrig. 1 pint .9 oz. bottle poured to my 1/2 pint tasting glass with a hazed, orange/gold hue, creamy, off white head foam, and ribbons and spots of clingy lacing. The nose was light grain, fruit, banana, and spice as clove. The flavor was similar with medium to light body, lively carbonation. and a light sprizey and dry finish. Refreshing brew.
UPDATED: DEC 15, 2012 Bottle, pours a nice bright yellow, with a nice cloudy hazy, aroma is lots of bananas and a good sweet flavour with a nice finish, and its a good full bodied offering

Really satisfied with this one.  It tastes awesome, for me just the right amount of texture and flavor, along with a creaminess thats easy to drink and doesnt hang out on the palate like some.  Im not even a big HEFE fan but I really enjoyed this one, seems like Ive only tasted a handful of hefes I really liked but this one passed the test. Try it I recommend it.
On tap in Munich. Golden color with nice white head. Aroma, wheat and citrus. Taste, orange, bananas, cloves. Drinkable beer.

500 ml swingtop bottle, as Hacker-Pschorr Hefe Weisse, bought at Rewe Getränkemarkt, Erding. ABV is 5.5%. Cloudy orange-brownish-yellow colour, huge white head. Strong typical hefeweizen aroma of yeast, ripe bananas / banana candy and cloves. Spritzy mouthfeel. Refreshing flavour, banana and cloves again, hints of citrus, not too sweet. Minimal hops. Easy drinking.

On Tap @ Munich Haus year round, lucky me!! Aroma is floral with scent of bread and citrus. Nice, thick and sustained white head that laced the glass while drinking. Flavor is citrus with noticeable banana cloves and some other spices (cinnamon maybe?). The malt is also very noticeable. Overall, an excellent dunkle. I would drink this ANY day of the week!

Hazy orange with a large froth that fades.  nose of bubblegum, esters, yeast protein flakes, spoiled fruit. flavor shows dirty lemon water, messy malts, a little more rotten fruit.  Bland, watery finish.  Tasted okay when really cold right out of the fridge, but after an hour or so it had lost anything that was tasty or good about it.  The best beers taste good warm too, I think.
(bottle) cloudy golden orange with medium white head; aroma of caramel, cloves, bit metallic, balanced taste
nice weisse sporting a billowy frothy head, aroma of spice and grass-enjoyed this very much

50 cL bottle from the LCBO, served in a weizen glass. Pours hazy golden-orange with a tall, fluffy white head. The head has good retention and leaves a small amount of lace.
