On the nose, the dominant aromas are of clove, yeast and sweet malts, along with some citrus and flowers, and a hint of pepper and spice. The flavour is moderately sweet throughout; there is a hint of hops towards the finish, but these are not very bitter. The finish is moderate in length and malty, with a dose of citrus. On the palate, it is medium in body with a smooth, milky texture and average carbonation. On the whole, this is a decent hefeweizen but I would not put it alongside the very best. It has more citrus and less clove than some others, and I deem this a good thing. It is rather simple and a bit too sweet for my taste. 2010-08-29
Number two for the night, and apparently I enjoyed this one a little less than the first.

Very foamy head that does not go away. Nice golden color and cloudy. Nice subtle floral aroma. Very light and airy on the palate, which would be great on a hot summer day, but I prefer something with a bit more body. For this style, it has a great taste. This is a quality beer during the summer.
Traditional German light weisee with some unique special and pleasant spiciness and complexity; best German light weisse Ive had

Bottle: Pours a nice golden, with a nice yet typical fluffly head.  It had the typical clove, banana spice characteristics but what I noticed was that these features were more remote than some of the others Ive had, making this beer quite smooth and drinkable in comparison. I enjoyed it to be sure , but it wasnt one of my favorites.

Someone said at some point they started brewing this in the US and the recipe changed a bit and it wasnt as good as it used to be. I think Ill agree.  This beer used to be much more flavorful and now is little more watery. However it is still pretty good. Serving: Bottle and tap

My very first german hefeweizen and the standard that I compare all others too.  Nicely balanced with a thick head which releases hints of orange and bananas.  Gets better as it warms.  A true German Hefe Weisse

Very decent Hefeweizen. A little funky flavor and smell that some may prefer. Very good and very German. Full round hearty and natural flavor. Delicious. Not as good as Schneider or Ayinger but better than a lot of other highly rated German Hefes.

50cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. Hazy yellow orange colour, creamy pillowy white head. Aroma is almost Belgian Wit-like, with coreander, light clove, sweet wheat, very light papery sourness. Flavour is medium sweet, wheat, light papery, light banana, light coreander-like spiciness, light citrus and a bit of cardboard in the finish. Light to medium bodied, soft creamy mouthfeel. Decent and refreshing Weissbier.
Il faut rouler la bière sur la table pour bien mélanger la levure. Bon goût...cest ma blanche favorite!

Pour from a 0.5 L bottle. Cloudy light orange brew with a dense white head. Aroma of wheat with hints of banana. Fine complex flavor, somewhat restrained, with an excellent wheat backbone, yeasty overtone, even the hints of tutty fruity bubble gum. Add to that an almost creamy mouthfeel with excellent carbonation and this is one excellent brew.

Bottle. Hazy golden with handsome white head. Aroma of banana and clove. Flavors of banana, pepper, bubblegum and clove. Medium-thin body with soft, sparking carbonation and velvety mouthfeel. This beer is dying to be put in your mouth, and you oblige.

Bottle at KrahKrah, Vienna. Pours hazy weak orange with a big creamy white head. Aroma of cloves and banana. Tastewise it is much of the same with a nice banana and cloves paired with a nice bitterness. Medium bodied. Finishes off fruity and dry, a really good hefeweizen.

(500 ml bottle) This is a beautiful beer in appearance. Unfiltered and golden in color with a rich white head and decent lacing. The aroma is lightly floral with cut grass and clover. The taste is refreshing and very clean with semi-sweet maltiness. A very good traditional Weisse. This site needs to be corrected, the label appears to be out of date, causing confusion and the brewer is defiantly Hacker-Pschorr, not Paulaner.
500 ml bottle a orange yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts banana spices taste spices malts banana and hops

12 oz bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours a murky amber with big frothy off-white head.  Aroma overwhelmingly of banana esters, with some citrus and wheat.  Taste is lemon, spice, wheat, slightly sweet and lightly bitter.  Very crisp and carbonated light/medium mouthfeel.  A very quenching hefe weizen, nice!

Spectacular fruity weisse aroma.  Looks great, nice light body with a foamy head.  Taste is not as strong as the aroma, actually kind of mild.  Of course Ive had Hacker-Pschorr before.  I wonder if somethings wrong with my tongue, like maybe its numb.  Maybe I shouldnt ratebeer today.

Cloudy orange pour, fluffy white head.  Yeast, wheat aroma not a lot of spice.  Flavors are slight banana and tangy citrus.  Finish is subtle, the flavor ends quickly.  Very good beer, Id just like a little more out of the finish.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy pale yellow with a huge thick long lasting white head. It has a wonderful yeast and fruit aroma.  It tastes of cereal, clove, vanilla, banana and bread.  This is a damn good beer. I would consider drinking this on a regular basis if I could find it more easily.
50 cl bottle in München, summer 2009. Colour is a blend of golden and brown. Taste of citrus and yeast is fruity and smooth too. Refreshing and very enjoyable.

500ml bottle from the LCBO.  I love this beer.  Pours a cloudy deep golden orange color with a small dense head, showing some carbonation.  Medium/Full bodied. The aroma is of citrus, spice, wheat, what you would expect in a hefe.  Tastes of some fruits and spice again, it has a good long finish and is not overly bitter but very crisp..  Super refreshing, could drink this stuff all day.  Goes great with food too.  Will buy again and again!

500ml bottle purchased at Vingos in Whiting, NJ.

Pours a slightly hazy golden orange color with pale yellowish orange hues when held to a light source and a frothy, pillowy two finger soapy white head. Excellent retention, only slowly fading into a lasting cap that leaves streaks of soapy lacig behind.

Slightly spicy aroma with a prominent clove presence along with some peppery zest. Strong bready yeast character with a lot of light/citrus fruit in the nose. Hints of banana, apple and lemon peel. This beetle smells awesome and I wish that more American interretations of the style aimed for this kind of nose.

Medium body thats on the fuller end of the spectrum with a lot of bready yeast adding complexity and thickness to the body. The flavor is very similar to the aroma with prominent spicy clove and peppery zest character wuichnis balanced out by crisp light and citrus fruit. The spicy cloves up front are quickly countered by the bready yeast as well as hints of banan and citrus peel, giving this beer a slightly tart dry finish. Very refreshing and extremely quaffable, especially in the warmer months.
Provad på Brogatan på Maltes tipsrunda 2010. Väldigt mycket skumbanan med lite potatismjölkänsla, torr och söt på samma gång. Typisk och bra för sin genre.
A hazy amber gold pour with a medium white head. Scent of wheat and banana and citrus. Taste is sweet also, this is not my style but can bang em out anyway!

500ml bottle.  Pours a hazy orange with a thick off-white head.  Aromas of yeast, lemon, banana, caramel, spice, and water (I know it seems a strange thing to note, but seriously, there is a heavy scent of water.)  The taste is initial banana, pink bubblegum, orange, faint nuttiness, with banana and citrus bitterness in the finish.  A little thin on flavour compared to some, but nothing to complain about.  Excellent.
Good hefe weiss bier.

(12 oz bottle).  Pours dark hazy yellow with tall chunky off-white head.  Aroma of dough, banana, clove.  Taste is sweet with a quick hit of hops.  quite carbonated.  Finish is medium bodied and somewhat heavy for a hefe-.  Very smooth and refreshing.  My standby for hefe-weizens.

bottle poured into my hobgoblin tall glass.  It has been in the upper 70s and low 80s here in New England for a while now, and I have been loving the German hefes this spring.  This has an attractive yellow-orange pour.  The aroma is banana and a little fresh bread.  The first sip is crisp, with citrus and banana flavors dominating.  The mouth feel is light and this is an overall refreshing beer for a hot Sunday afternoon.  I cant wait to go to Germany and get some fresh stuff!!

Pale golden pour white creamy head .... light banana and clove with some wheat in the aroma ..... taste is creamy and smooth banana, clove (yeast) and wheat .... little bubblegum taste .... pretty sweet brew and a little heavy but overall very smooth and enjoyable
Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange / amber with billowy slightly off white head. Big wheaty aromas with plenty of banana yeast and spice. Flavours are a tart  with plenty of wheat malt. Good beer
Quality all around wheat. Pours cloudy golden. Nose is floral fruits. Taste is much the same. Slight lemons. Rated 1/3/2000
500 ml bottle from the LCBO.  A great Hefe-weisse!  Pours hazy/thick, pale amber in colour, huge white head.  Aroma is banana and wheat, similar taste.  Really good!
Pours cloudy orange with a nice white head. The aroma is banana, clove, and bubblegum. The flavor is wheaty, spicy clove, banana, and bubblegum. Very nice on the palate, and big flavor.
19 ounce bottle-blond pour-white head-aroma and taste of  dough, clove, spice,-somewhat smooth carbonated finish
Hazy honey color with very thick, fluffy white head, foamy lacing.  Wheat and clove aromas.  Barley provides a slight twist to typical hefeweizen taste, though still good.  Creamy and medium-bodied.
A nice beer. Love the citric aroma and the spicy citrus flavor. DONT FUIT YOUR BEER.
I had this as a draft at the Wrigleyville Rooftops during a Cubs game.  Dark.  Strong aftertaste that I wasnt fond of.  very fruity

Hacker-Pschorr Brauerei Munich--Weisse--1998 16.9 oz. Bottle. 5.00% ABV.  (3.75 / 5.0)  Hefeweizen.  Big head-highly carbonated.  Hazy golden orange color.  Starts with strong citrus fruit aroma matching wheaty body.  Pellicle rounds out malt base, mellows citrus flavor, and makes for a nice brew.  Sampled 3/12/1999.

Hacker-Pschorr Brauerei Munich--Weisse--1999 12 oz. Bottle.  5.00% ABV  (3.25 / 5.0)  Very hazy dark golden color with brown tint.  Light citrus wheat front with hint of Bavarian flavor.  Malty wheat body has citrus flavor and minimal spiciness.  Ends mild.  Big sediment, Light lace.  Sampled 5/21/2000.

Hacker-Pschorr Weisse Traditional Wheat--2006 16.9 oz.	 Bottle.  5.50% ABV.  15 IBUs?  (4.0 / 5.0)  Hefeweizen--Tight sediment.  Foamy mild lace head.  Cloudy bright lemon orange color.  Mild Bavarian banana ester wheat front.  Creamy mellow tangy Bavarian mild sweet fruit ester wheat body.  Fresh clean mild citrus end.  Sampled 1/30/2006.

German beer..is there any other? Beautiful deep honey colouring, with frothy off white 2 inch head(when poured properly). My absolute favourite beer. This one turned me on to weizen bier. Firstly you have to get all of the yeast out by swirling a centimeter of beer in the bottom of the glass with a quick poor to evenly distribute the yeast. Out of a 500ml bottle in a weizen glass in Baden-Württemberg; the head is a lemon grass with heavy yeast flavour, full of aroma. Leaves a pleasant tangy aftertaste. A nice beer bottle flavour starting with a sour tinge leading to a full mouth of yeast filled enjoyment. The yeast/wheat lingers in your mouth for a while after the swallow. The best bit is opening another bottle!

500ml bottle from the LCBO.  Hazy yellow, with a pillar of white head typical for the style.  Lots of clove and spice in the nose.  Flavours of banana, bubble gum, spice.  High carbonation makes it quite filling though, hard to drink more than one.

this is a great hefe weizen

A-cloudy pale yellow with thick white head.

S- fruit, wheat, yeast and spices. magnificant.

T- citrus, clove, corriander, yeast, yeast sweet aftertaste.

P-great. light carbonation and light body.

O- I can drink this all day great session beer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-16-2007 20:49:47

Im pretty sure the bottle I got ahold of was old, so Im not going to leave a full rating.  It definitely tasted like it could have had some potential, but it had that "skunked" aroma and flavor throughout the entire experience, and Im pretty sure this brew isnt Canadian. ;-)
Bottle. Pours amber orange with a white head. Wheaty and sweet aroma, with light spices. The flavor has fruity banana notes, with some wheat and spices. Nice.

Bottle.  Pours copper with thick, fluffy white head.  Aroma of yeast, cloves, and wheat.  Taste of caramel malt, yeast and bananas.  Thick, creamy mouthfeel.  Was just trying to clean out the fridge and this ended up being pretty good.

Aroma of cooked rice and fresh herbs. Amber body thats not too fizzy and has a white moderate head. Medium bitterness and quite heavy on sourness. Looks are good, taste a little disappointing compared to the great German hefeweizen available. May suit you, though.

pours a hazy yellow/orange, the head is white. The aroma consists of yeast, some spice and sweet hints.  The beer is creamy in texture and has an average carbonation. The finish lingers. Light sweet, medium bitter, very light sour.
Solid Hefeweizen, but its a bit light on the flavor....head is thin, as is the mouthfeel. But still quite, quite good

Tap at Millers Pub in Chicago.  Pours a very hazy yellow orange color with a good two fingers of off-white head.  Smells of orange and lemon zest with floral notes.  A nice smoothness accented by sweet sugary tones.  Lingering in the background is a hint of sourness.  This is medium to full-bodied with a good clean and relaxing finish.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2010 Refrigerated bottle pours into a short weizen glass.  Pours a hazy golden with nice head and good lacing.  Taste is not light wheat and light citrus.  Taste is much lighter than the better hefeweizens.

500m swing-top bottle from BeersofEurope. Smoky bubblegum. Cloudy. Natural carbonation. Soft mouthfeel. Some faint apple. The main attraction is the smokey bubblegum aroma and the natural carbonation. Its clearly a wheat beer, and its quite drinkable, but theres not a huge amount of interest or pleasure. Some faint astringency. Its OK.
Pours cloudy piss yellow with off-white head. Sweet aroma. Pleasant enough to drink, but not a beer Id buy twice.
Nowheres near as strong and bold in scent or taste as other hefeweizens Ive had, but still a quality beer.
On Tap. Very orange, small head thats loose for a Hefe. Rather weak tasting, not much wheat coming through. Pleasent, but there are many, many better examples of the style.

12 oz. bottle.  Purs a slightly cloudy orange/yellow color with a huge foam-capped white head.  Vibrant aroma of yeast, wheat, clove, and other spices.  Nice mixture of flavors that include wheat and banana.  Creamy texture with soft carbonation and a tasty finish.  A nice hefeweizen.

355ml bottle into a pilsner glass.  Pours with a TON of cloudy head.  Head never totally dissipates and doesnt leave much lacing at all.  Aroma is of tart banana with a hint of alcohol and clove.  Mouthfeel is spot on for a wizen, thick and creamy but slightly less than I expected.  Tastes of banana and clove and a bit of cardamom.  However, the flavor is where this beer falls flat.  It didnt really do anything for me.  All the flavors are too mild and left the beer tasting kind of watered down.  Its easy drinking with a good aroma but I cant say much else good about this.  One possible issue is that the bottle was almost a year old, that could have caused the subdued flavors.  If I ever find a fresh bottle (a big IF, in the States) Ill re-rate.  Otherwise, I was unimpressed.
A fantastic wheat beer that pours a cloudy yellow.  This was the first hefe weisse that I noticed.  I had drank other ones, but this one tasted great.  I have to thank this beer for opening my eyes.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2010 500ml bottle from SAQ. poured into weizen. a gorgeous cloudy pale orange with a huge creamy white frothy head, loads of lacing. aroma is banana and a bit of yeast. herbs and spices, wheat and a mild hops finish. feels thick on the palate. this is my favorite hefeweizen.

Pours a hazy yellowish gold with a nice off white frothy head that slowly dissipates.  A light aroma with a light sweet taste to start and a nice finish with noticeable carbonation.  Overall a very nice smooth drinking beer
Tap. Hazy yellow-orange pour, white head. Citrus, spice, and wheat aroma and taste. Somewhat carbonated. Enjoyable brew.

Pours a hazy orange (apricot) colour white a frothy with head. The aroma is a little malty with a bit of yeast and some fruitiness, banana mostly. In the taste there is also some banana and there are herbs and spice too, it is more sweet than anything. This beer feels thick on the palate and has an abrupt finish which is actually quite nice. Overall a very good beer.

Bottle.  Poured cloudy yellow orange with thick white head.  Full aroma of cloves,herb and citrus.  Well balanced flavour, wheat and barley malt, with spicy notes.  Lasting spice and hop finish.  I formerly did not drink wheat beers, but this is one of the best.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text:
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2010 (drought at Hollerbachs in Sanford FL)

hzy-gl, thin-wh-head, med-body, ^co2.

tart-wheat §biscuit §alchl aroma and flavor.

 banana, clove, and bubblegum complexity in yeast aroma and flavor.
In bottle; good hefe weisse. Subtle spice, and banana/citrus notes. I would still rather have Ayinger or Paulaner, but a good overall beer.

bottle thanks to swalden28.  poured yellow with a white head that lasted the life of the beer.  aroma was banana and citrus.  flavor was citrus, banana, and a nice lingering bitter.  body was medium with high carbonation.  a good hefe!!
A very good weisse beer. Notes of bananna were overwhelming for me but i was drinking a few heavier beers before i got to this one. Standard German Heffe.
golden- orange colour with a white head. Aroma is orange, citrus, wheat, banana. Flavour is orange, citrus, wheat, banana, grain . Easy drinkable nice beer.

50cl bottle poured into a stein. Served a little warm but still very tasty. Nice pale foamy head which subsided slowly but left a nice lacing on the way down. Yeast and friut aroma, palate was sublime and not bitter or hoppy. A style I really enjoy and wish there was more variety available in Quebec.

This beer is creamy, slightly fruity, and a little spicy with strong notes of yeast and wheat. Overall a very elegant balanced Hefeweizen. The carbonation is subtle and pleasant, and some good malt flavor is present. Crisp finish without much bitterness. An very pleasant beer.

Tap. Moderate grain and hay notes for the malt, faint citrus for the hops, light dough for the yeast, and background aromas of banana and clove. Head is average size, creamy, white with fair lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is hazy yellow/tan. Flavor starts lightly sweet and acidic, then finishes moderately acidic and bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery yet a little slick, with a lively carbonation. A really good example of a German Hefeweizen.

Ive had this on tap and bottle many times, now Im finally rating it. Pours cloudy orange with thick white head. Bannana, yeasty nose. Taste more of the same, citrus and spices. Creamy body. Clean finish.
Tap-Bottle.  Great wheat beer.  Has a sweet and spice flavor.  Appearance is cloudy and golden.  Lively palate. Drink with an orange.
banana and spice on the nose. banana and bread on the palate and throughout. very good weisse. great mouthfeel great palate. beautiful light orange pour.

bottle - Poured a hazy light gold, fizzy-frothy head that disappeared rather quickly. Very yeasty and malty nose could detect only the faintest hint of fruit, almost hidden. I felt something was missing as I tasted, much maltier than most weizen, the fruit is overpowered by the malt.

The smell tingles my nose, smells like a weiss beer, perfect smell. Reminds me of Germany.
The color is very cloudy golden bronze, light head very good taste; not quite excellent. Very thick yeast and wheat taste, very good
tingles the palate, citrus fruity
Very Good, definitely a must buy
(NOTE: rated on 11-11-2008)

I scooped up a bottle of this at the local beer store. Aroma of citrus and clove. Poured a slightly hazy translucent golden color with great lacing and head retention. The flavor, which is the most important part, however wasnt near as good. Slight notes of banana, yeast, and wheat, but is watered down way too much. This is a decent hefeweizen, and there are way better ones out there.
Golden pour with white head. I am not big on wheat beers, but I do like this one.

Pours a milky-golden color (almost bright orange) with a creamy white head. Decent retention and lacing. Strong citrus aroma with a hint of bubble-gum and spice. 

Unfortunately, the taste didnt "sing" and was fairly unremarkable. Decent mouthfeel, with a slightly spicy finish.

500mL bottle - pours an opaque golden/orange colour with a quickly-dissipating bubbly head. Aroma is lemon, banana and yeast. Taste is similar, with a solid spice. Very clean and easy to drink. Great wheat beer.

500ml Bottle. 5.5%. Pours a hazy, golden orange colour with a frothy, bubbly white head that fades fairly quickly to a foamy ring. Aroma is lemon, banana, and a yeasty kick. Taste is very much a bready, banana flavour with a very spicy hint in the mouthfeel, coriander for sure, maybe mild ginger. Mouthfeel is clean and superb however. Delicious.

Hefes are mostly "as expected" and this one is not an exception although very fulfulling and top notch quality. The smell is of banana, lemon, and wheat. The taste also has notes of sour apples along with the bread, citrus, and banana. The mouthfeel is very creamy and satisfying. If this was the only hefe I could every drink for the rest of my life.....Id be o.k. with that.

(Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 26 Sep 2009) Cloudy pale amber colour with frothy, off-white head. Fruity, malty nose with citrus, banana and slightly sourish wheat hints. Fruity, wheaty taste with notes of citrus, banana and clove. Sweet-and-sour wheat character. Medium body, some sweetness. Refreshing and decent hefeweizen. Very much in line with what was expected.
Bottle from Gall & Gall. Hazy yellow body with medium head. Nice floral head with notes of orange. Taste of bananas and citrus. Dry finish. Nice one.

Poured into a weizen glass.  Hazy yellowish gold with a thick, dense white head.  Aroma is fresh bread, bananas, citrus and clove.  Flavor is bananas and lighter citrus with a wheaty twang, vanilla, and clove.  Mouthfeel is a little thinner than the best hefeweizens.  Nice depth, easy to drink.  Good beer.
Pours golden yellow with a thich white head.  Smells quite fruity with nice citrus notes.  Has a dusty taste backed by fruit, but the palate is a bit watery.
Smells of rotten fruit, color like orange juice with mustard, if there is a taste its covered up by the awful aroma
This ranks more in the lower end of the Bavarian hefes for me.  Clove and banana flavors are present, but not profound.  Lightly watery.  Still a good beer.

Bottle. Beautiful yellow pour with perfect creamy looking head. Very wheaty aroma, fresh bread, banana, yeast and orange here. Taste is mellow, solid carbonation yeasty, lots of orange and clove here. Good mouthfeel. The perfect litre after litre beer.

500ml bottle poured into a Weizen glass. Poured a cloudy deep gold-orange color with a puffy 2" head which slowly dissipated. Very good lacing. Looks very appealing. Aroma of bananas, sugar and fresh baked bread with a little spice & citrus in the background. Flavor of malt sweetness, some citrus sourness, a bit of spiciness and a hint of hop bitterness. Good balance of flavors. Mouthfeel os smooth & creamy with tangy carbonation. Very drinkable and quite satisfying. One of my favorite Hefeweizens.

Bottle.  Pours an opaque honey color with a pretty decent off-white head.  Aromas of clove, banana, and malts and similar taste.  A hint of bitterness on the finish.  Medium bodied.  An enjoyable brew.
Excellent nose. Nice fruity spiciness that blends in harmony with the subtle malt character. The flavor is nearly identical to the nose. Simply splendid.
Bottle. 12 oz. Pours light yellowish gold, with a thick white head. Aroma of wheat, hay, and citrus. Body is medium, with a decent finish, Interesting brew.

Bottle, Carringtons, Chorlton. Poured a slightly hazy darkish yellow colour with a large dissipating rocky head. Aroma as anticipated was wheat, yeast, banana and a touch of clove. Clean, gently sweet flavour with more of the same elements of the aroma and some  restrained spice and citrus . A very tidy exponent of the genre.

BPW #59
On tap at HopCat. Appearance is a pale hue leaning towards a straw. The aromas and flavors are very bready with some malt backing and coriander notes.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 Bottle. Pours a hazy orangey-gold. Small frothy head. Sharp, heavily citrus aroma. Carbonated citrus that disappears a little quickly. A bit of hops and barley at the start, but not really present throughout. Mainly citrus, orange, coriander, and a touch of spice. Missing the banana hint I like to find. Not bad, though it seems a little one (er, two?) dimensional for my taste in hefeweizens. Pretty disappointing to me. Re-rate: I was a bit too harsh on this one, up a few points.
Bottle. Pours a golden brownish hazy color. Pleasant aroma of citrus and barley. Tastes of citrus and some hints of barley and wheat. Good beer. Recommended.

Poured into a hazy golden brown beer with somewhat of a thick head. Aromas a yeast and wheat were prominent. The initial flavor was excellent with refreshing orange zest taste. The ending is a little disaapointing though, lack taste and bitterness.

Bottle: A very solid hefeweizen. Pours a proper cloudy amber with no head. Arouma is yeasty and bready. Taste is cinnamon spice sweet and malty, with a light bitter finish. Light body. I never taste the banana esters in these hefeweizen that everyone seems to find, but maybe thats just me.
A nice brew with strong flavors characteristic of the yeast involved.  Good stuff.

Sample from Tap at Shallos. Pours Hazy yellow with bubbly white head. Strong wheat aroma. Banana, clove, wheat, nutmeg flavor. Mild carbonation. Very pleasant wheat style. Somewhat sweet (which is good), but slightly watery taste which I think distracts from what is nearly a quality brew, but all together very light crisp and refreshing!

Cloudy gold pour with a lasting white head...Bubblegum, banana, wheaty aroma...Light body, crisp carbonation...Smooth, light vanilla and banana flavor...A bit bland for a German Heffe...Worthy of three stars...

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2009 500 ml bottle.  What a great Hefe!  Its been awhile since I had an authentic German Hefeweizen and Im reminded once again how a good German version of the style blows away 99% of American versions (and Im a fan of most of these Hefes). This is an easy drinking beer.  Good stuff.
500ml bottle. Cloudy golden beer with good head that quickly dissipates. Nice banana aroma. Taste is also of bananas and cloves. Sparkly carbonation. Very good hefeweizen.
deep yellow/orange - really a dark color for the style. Nose is bready bananas. Flavor is solid - spicy cloves and wheat, some really nice bitterness to finish. Good bordering on very good.
12 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $1.79 Excellent.
This pours not as cloudy as most wheats, but still maintains a nice hazy sunset color. It has a strong, but pure wheat flavor in the German tradition of weisse beers.

Hazy gold, huge fluffy head that never dies.  Nose of bananas, bread, citrus, clove, fresh.  very good flavours, not too sweet, not too bitter, same as aroma, balances very nicely. This is a delicious beer.

Radegast: weizen: My first go at a German Hefe... pours very heavy dirty yellow leaving a thick dry head.  The nose is of bananas and cloves, expected. The flavor had more bitters and sourness than I expected, balanced by the usual wheats, bananas and cloves.  Nice.

I really liked this one, perhaps the finest German wheat beer Ive yet had.  From the hazy, almost orange colour, the abundant head, and the complex and intriguing aroma, this cant wait to be drunk.  I found the taste phenominal.  So delicate, almost sweet, yet smooth and refreshing.  Delicious.

ahh a very pleasant brew, Nice golden hazy pour and even though I held on to this bottle for longer than I should have I was still able to pick up strong banana and clove flavors, a much enjoyed brew.
Clouded mustard gold. No light gets through yet its light in body. Nice banana profile. Bit of a spicy kick, with some fruity elements. Not bad but something about this keeps it from excelling.
"Smell of wheat and some spices. Pour is a thick cloudy orange/yellow with abig thick head. Flavor of banana and spice with wheat at the end. A very enjoyable beer!"

500 ml produced 01/09. Looks like a hefe should, hazy with fluffy head. Light touch on the carbonation. Not too light in body. Slightly fruity taste, with spicy bite to it. A little bubblegum or banana at the end, but not too much. One of the better hefes.

330ml bottle.  pours clear orange / golden color.  Big aromas of banana and bubblegum.  Nice wheat, lemon, and clove.  Flavor of lemons, bananas, and clove.  Sweet, well balalnced.  Finishes with a light hop.  very refreshing.  Perfect.
hazy orange with a small white head. Weak yeasty aroma, with banana and clove. Sweetish yeasty flavour.
50cl bottle, hazy orange colour, huge white head, mostly yeast aroma, banana and spices notes, sweet flavor, medium body, finish with hops and soap hints

Bottle. Cloudy golden with a huge off white head. Classic German Hef banana/clove aroma with wheat bread and light spiciness. Big bready malt flavor with a yeasty sourness and a light hop bitterness. Smooth, soft mouth feel, almost creamy. Each drink makes you want more. This is an excellent German Hef, cant really see any way to improve this one.
Hazy light amber color with a viscous tan head. Aromas of clove, banana, peppercorn. Smooth medium body. Nice tart wheat flavors with strong banana and clove. Good hefe here.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: This is the Hefeweizen that made me fall in love with this style. Strong banana/yeast aroma with a hint of citrus that becomes very noticeable when it is tasted. Appearence is very typical of all Hefeweizens but where it distinguishes itself from others is the flavor and palate. The citrus/banana mix is perfect and really compliments the strong yeast aroma. It has a frizzy texture because of the carbonation but finishes smooth. Theres a lot going on very subtlety and it leads to a great experience.  My favorite Hefeweizen.
Multiple tastings. A benchmark wheat beer if there ever was one. Have tasted many of these and, although not my favorite style, have always enjoyed.
Light but great.  Great gold color with a white head.  Very drinkable at the garden/
Nice and light, straw colored body.  Fruity notes, wheat.  Clean finish.  Overall very drinkable and pleasant.
bottle, thanks john!, nice drinking hefeweizen. not my fav style, but this is one hell of a nice beer.

Overall Impression: 
This is a pretty tasty Hefe, they did a nice job here of meshing the flavors together, and this one drinks really nicely as well.

I will forever compare any weissbier to Denisons, which is sad, because none will ever match it. This is the beer that has came closest. The palate is GREAT! It rolls your tongue like a great weiss does, but doesnt contain the depth of flavour that a brew such as denisons does.

Bottle. Hazy golden with a nice head. Nose is dominated by banana with hints of citrus and cloves. Flavor is also banana, citrus and yeast.  Ive never tried this beer before, because   Im not a big fan of wheats. 
But I was really impressed by this one.
Pours cloudy yellow orange with a foamy white head. Sour funky yeast and wheat aroma. Taste is muted wheat, and funky tart yeast. I think the bottle is old.

Poured out a coudy hazy orange brown brew with lots of thick white head, good retention with some messy lacing. The aroma is dry with well defined wheat smell, warm bananas and some spice (cloves? nutmeg? I dunno). I was suprised to find a chocolate / biscuit malt taste with some soft, light banana, wheat and the same spice that is found in the aroma. The mouthfeel is smooth and drying with appealing bitterness, I can also notice the alcohol when I breate in deep. A nice beer indeed.

Bottle. Hazy yellow with a huge foamy head. Great retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is bready with banana esters, cloves and yeast. Very classic Hefeweizen aroma. Flavor is also bready with banaa, yeast and cloves, but very slightly metallic. Medium body with fizzy carbonation.
(330 ml bottle, labeled simple Weisse) Aroma of yeast and citrus. Flavor is light wheat, lemon. Refreshing.

500mL bottle poured into a weizen glass. Golden apricot color with a thick, foamy off-white head. Aroma of yeasty bread and plantains. Taste is of spicy banana, cloves and sweet sourdough. Mouthfeel is smooth and lightly effervescent with a lingering, pleasant aftertaste. An excellent hefeweizen.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a semi-clear (but definitely not cloudy) golden with a medium white head and an aroma of yeast, banana and wheat. The flavour is sweet, with a soft, velvetty mouthfeel. Flavour has notes of banana, honey, wheat and hops. Sweet finish.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a fizzy white head. Sweet, bready aromas of pineapple and yeast. The flavor is very full and represents the wheat category well. The sweet orange and pineapple fruitiness compliments the bready yeast flavors very well. The body is full from the wheat but has a nice carbonation. Delicious and refreshing beer.

Aroma has some banana, sour apple and cloves. Translucent gold with a big creamy head. Flavor had much more clove than expected, sour apples and bananas. Palate was bubbly and slightly lively. A good hefe, but nothing outstanding here.

This brew pours a honey brown with a nice thick white head, its a touch to dark for a hefe. The sent was of apple, some banana and was very tangy and slightly sour. There was a very pronounced lemon flavor with a touch of banana, the main body of the taste was grassy malts. The beer was tasting noticeably sour and left a sweet after taste. I think might have got a old bottle ( cant find date on it any where ) I remember this tasting a whole lot better, but it was still drinkable.

Bottle. Pretty golden yellow color, with a thick white head that quickly dissipates. Classic hefe-weisse armoas of banana,coriander, orange, with some notes of saaz here as well. Also a distinct cornflakes aroma, which I find distacting. Palate is clean and refreshing, with wheat, clove and plenty more bananas. I was hoping for a bit less fruit and a bit more spice from this offering, but over all, a solid effort.
Colore arancione opaco,schiuma bianca,spessa,molto alta.Forte aroma di banana.In bocca arancia,banana e malto.Molto piacevole con questo caldo anticipato di questi giorni.

Poured from draft with a very large, frothy, white head.  A hazy yellow body with some light cloudy particulate in the beer.  Aroma is very bready, lots of wheat, lemon, strong coriander and clove presence with a heavy doughy, sweet yeast presence.  Flavor is very full and lasting with wheat, coriander and clove dominating.  The flavor is very smooth with a great density for a hefe, long lasting flavor and a creamy feeling. Overall the beer has a very good spicy flavor to it and I prefer it much more from the tap than from the bottle.

Draft at some "Irish" bar in Bloomington, IN. Pours a hazy orange yellow with a white head. Strong banana clove esters. Medium to light bodied with a nice refreshing mouth feel. Flavor of wheat malts, orange, banana, and clove. Yeasty finish with a slight tang. Typical hefe, but rock solid.

500 ml bottle. From Germany.
Clear golden orange colour with medium creamy head. Banana, wheat and caramel in aroma. Flavour is wheaty with some bitterness and hints of citrus and banana.
Bottle- Tatars.  Happy Memorial Day.  Crisp, tart, good wheat, banana notes.  Rich flavor- nice beer.  Liked a bit better than the Franziskaner from the other day.

My favorite beer, hands down.  Beautiful coloring with a remarkable flavor.

Im still new to the tasting lingo.
Pours a cloudy orange lemon with thick white head. Aroma is mainly grassy wheat. Falvor is wheat with mild banana flavors. Body is med/light wyet creamy with high carbonation.

50 cl bottle in hacker glass. Pours a cloudy orange with a beautiful soapy white  head that lasts forever. Aroma of wheat,  bread, yeast, clove, and banana hints. Flavor is smooth with dark wheat maltiness, and a nice spice, banana finish. Mouthfeel is creamy and refreshing. One of my favorite hefes.

Pours beautifully with a rocky meringue-like head, and very cloudy off-golden color down below.  Nose is assertive like fresh bread right out of the oven with pleasant esters, banana, and light clove.  Palate is wheat malt focused for sure, moreso than most Weissbiers that Im accustomed to lately.  Easy drinking.

12 oz bottle.  Pours hazy copper in color with a creamy white head.  Smells of wheat, banana, and seosoning.  Tastes of banana, coriander, wheat, and nice hop balance.  Nice mouthfeel and texture.  Pretty nice stuff.
Bottle poured a white head with a hazy gold body.  Smells of yeast and dirt.  Flavor is yeast, dough, tart.  Some fruit and spice on the finish.
Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a frothy white head. Aroma and flavour of wheat, banana and citrus. Medium bodied with banana and spice in the finish. Pleasant beer.
Bottle from The Beer Authority, bright aroma and pours a hazy golden color with a medium fizzy head.  Classic weisse beer taste with a tartness and clove notes.  Pleasent beer for a sunny day.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy light amber with a one finger white head.  The nose is wheat and grainy grass.  The taste is light spice, wheat and grain.  Medium prickly mouthfeel.  Interesting hefe in both taste and appearance.  Not bad though.

Had in a 0.5L bottle from Coop Liquor Calgary, AB. A classic German hefe. Pour of hazy golden orange with a medium sized foamy white head. Aroma is fruity with hints of banana and some spiciness. The taste is rather uneventful, but there is mild spiciness and nice refreshing wheat beer flavour. Overall, very impressive and drinkable beer.

Funny, before I actually tried any German beer I always had the impression it would be dark, strong and harsh. But now I know better, and Ive come to understand the festive nature of a good German beer. This medium-full bodied brew comes off like a celebration of a good harvest and the anticipation of another fine year. Its made me listen to polka music in an entirely different way.

Hazy light gold color, with a white head that lasts throughout the drinking experience. Taste is rather boring and uneventful - yeast, wheat, some spiciness. Drinkable, but not particularly enjoyable. Forgettable.
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Starts strong, fine fruity, notes of banana. The finish a bit weaker, a bit dry. Still a good hefeweizen!

Bottle.  Poured a hazy golden color with a frothy white head.  The aroma and flavor are both full of clove, banana, and spices.  The beer has a medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, and a nice long finish.  Overall, I absolutely love this beer.  I really like the spicy aroma and taste.  This beer also tastes great with a lemon slice in it.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy dark golden color with a nice full white head.  Aroma of clove, grain and banana. Taste of cloves banana, yeast and light citrus.Has a very nice semi sweet smooth finish. Enjoyable brew!
rocky white foam, hazy, good ballanced, light bitter, light sweet, medium bitter, fizzy,
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: bottle, pours very hazy orange with a tall off white head.  Wonderful banana, clove and slight bubblegum aroma.  Wheaty flavors and a sweet malt with a hint of orange or lemon round out the mouth.  Stays creamy and ends with a lingering sweet carmel flavor.  Wonderful weissen.

Pretty nice hefeweizen.  Hazy orangish color with a nice white head.  Fruity esters and wheat on the aroma.  Flavor is wheat, pale malt, banana/clove, and a little yeast.  Pretty average palate for the style.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2009 500 mL Bottle. Like any wheat beer it pours a cloudy deep gold with a 3-finger white head that immediately settles to a 1-finger fluffy layer. This beer has an intriguing aroma of grains, banana, pineapple, an innuendo or orange rind, and a very faint innuendo of cloves; actually very delightful. A layer of sediment at the bottom of the bottle tells me this beer is likely bottle-conditioned and not filtered and pasteurized. The taste doesnt seem to titillate the senses the way the aroma does: grainy-wheaty with an aftertaste of bananas with a hint of pineapple and a slight note of butterscotch in the finish. There is a heavy cloyingness that I find hurts the flavor some. It is a distinct palate that Ill be the first to say is not the ideal of every beer drinker but for one who likes wheat beer, it could be very likeable. Smooth carbonation. It is the aroma alone that boosts whatever rating here, but Ive had better-tasting Heffes.

This beer smells way better than it tastes- smells of flowers, fruits, bananas and caramels. Unfortunately, it tastes of water trying desperately to not be water. Akin to an American Macrobrew. Im happier with Tucher- it is cheaper and has somewhat more flavor than this.$7 on tap, .5 liter at Abraxas on Miami Beach.
(bottle) pours a hazy golden-orange colour with a tall white head. aroma of heavy clove, wheat and a light touch of burnt wood, flavour is the same. medium body with smooth carbonation.

12 oz bottle purchased from the Beer Run in Chattanooga.  Poured a cloudy yellow/orange color with a two finger, fluffy white head.  The aroma was citrus, lemons, bananas and clove, with notes of yeast.  The flavor was wheaty, with banana and cloves present in the middle and a citrus, orangey finish.  This was an excellent Hefe.

Bottle.  Pours an orangish amber in color with a pure white, fluffy head.  The aroma is extremely sweet and fruity.  It has strong hints of banana, pinapple, and lemony citrus.  The flavor is lightly spicey, some notes of pepper and corriander with some clove.  It has a bready, yeasty quality, a medium light body, and a smooth, sweet, lightly sweet finish.  I could definitely drink quite a lot of this.

No 686
Rated: 05.02.2009
Bottle brown, 500 ml, 12.5 P
Appearance: Pours orangy, carrot like, slightly metalic, honey colour of the body is yeasty - murky, very cloudy, carbonation of the body is visually moderate, unfiltered, only natural saturation, head is initially huge, very slowly decreasing to medium, gives nice lacing.
Aroma: Very fresh, juicy, orange, carrot, banana, clove, yeasts, very honest wheaty background, some barley grains too, strong and very exposed aroma in general, really impressive, additionally a sweet, flowery hoppyness scents on top, white chockolate, some herbal accents, hoppy accents, cookie, dough.
Flavour: Front is soft, juicy, fresh with predominating notes of wheat, yeast, carrot, banana, malty, slightly toasted barley, saltyness, well carbonated body, beautiful nose, flowery hoppyness being sweet oriented, slightly spicy and herbal, gentle notes of alcohol spicing up the flavour, strongly expossed flavour, the fruits, grains and yeasts are so lively even as if coming out of the glass, finish duration is very long.
Palate: Body is medium, texture is wattery to creamy, carbonation on palate is moderate, finish feel is highly aromatic, fruity, flowery.
Bottle.  Cloudy yellow with a thick head and Aroma: citrus, pineapple) and banana. Flavor: neutral flavour, light citrusy finish

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2009 500ml bottle, Pours light orange, big white head. Aroma of yeast and orange, coriander and spices. Finish is a bit dry. Quite drinkable. Taste is wheat, spices, lemon. Ive had better weisse. Rating no 13, 080209.. Re-rate 090905. Aroma 6 to 7, Flavor 6 to 7.
Cloudy yellow/orange with dense white head.  Lemony and clove in the nose.  Very light, slightly citrus weisse,  Not as sweet/fruity/banana flavor as some Bavarian weisses.
Golden yellow in color with an average head.  Slightly fruity aroma and taste.
smells like cloves and bananas. it is a thick opaque goldy orange and tastes like bananas and citrus. an amazing session beer...
A very nice quality true german hefe. Thick white head and a little cloudy. A well made brew.
A fruity aroma and flavour, smells a bit of cinnamon and tastes a bit of nutmeg. Its taste is not as strong as the smell but comes on slowly until you swallow and then you get the full effect.

From 500ml bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a thick white head. The aroma is very complex, lots of spices and citrus fruit. The flavor is great, well balanced, lots of orange, cloves, banana and spices. This is s great hefe wiesen.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange golden color with a large frothy white head that lasts awhile. The aroma is a strong clove, banana and citrus. Good sticky lacing on the glass. The taste is similar to the aroma with a nice dry finish. Easy to drink a good hefe from Paulaner.
Bottle. Mild fruity aroma. Cloudy orange body, white head. Flavor also is mild and fruity, then finishes with a little tang and spiciness.

Pours a hazy yellow with little head. Aroma of manderin oranges cloves, exotic fruits, and yeast. Tastes of oranges, cloves, soft fruits and a finish of bready yeast. Mouth feel is very nice, fairly carbonated... but a soft carbonation. Nice hefe.
Lovely cloudy golden body with a thick white foamy head, notes of citrus and a creamy flavor, well balanced, clean finish.  Super.

500ml glass at a München schnitzel restaurant. It is dark gold and cloudy in appearance, with a large, yet fading head. The carbonation is mild, as is the bitterness. There is a lasting mild and sweet flavour, with a hint of strawberries. A very pleasant brew.
12 oz. bottle.  Poured hazy orange with a ring of white head.  Scant lacing.  Flavor of bananas with some oranges and citrus fruit poking through.  Very dry finish.

Dark brownish orange with a big creamy off white head.  Grainy light spicy aroma, big wheat smoothness.  Light oranges and other citrus fruit.  Taste is big citrus, lemon, oranges, then some banana, and a dry finishing spiciness.
Bottle.  Mild fruity aroma.  Cloudy orange body, white head.   Flavor also is mild and fruity, then finishes with a little tang and spiciness.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2009 I consider this the standard for comparing all other hefeweizens. It may not be the most rare or complex wheat beer in the world, but it is exactly what a hefe should be. Good from the bottle, but significantly better on tap.
Drinkable hefe tried on new years eve 08. Good size white head that lasted well on a orangey golden body. Flavours of clove and banana in the aroma and the taste with neither standing out too much.
A nice hefe smelling of spices, citrus and spices. The taste is banana, citrus, cinnamon, cardamon, and yeasty bread.

50cl bottle.   Opaque gold-orange with an everlasting, frothy white head.   Pretty standard aroma for style:   spicy and fruity with banana being a strong component, and a bit of citrus.   The flavor is moderately sweet with a low bitterness and the banana and spice showing up over a slightly grainy wheat flavor.   medium-light bodied with a smooth, creamy texture that has a bit lower carbonation than seems standard.   Solid overall, but nothing distinctive about it, it really just blends in with the other good, if monotonous, Bavarian weissebiers that we get over here
0,5 liter beugelfles. Ik denk een goede weizen en als ik de algemene rating zie dan denk ik zit ik er dan zo naast? Maar ik volg toch maar mijn eigen ratingsgevoel.
500ml bottle: Pours golden with a soft white head. Aroma of sweet clove slight honey and malt. Clove on the nose, latent banana, nice medium body heft from the wheat. Balanced.
This is a good Hefe, like bananas and the wheat, then you are in.  This is a good color and good aroma.

Bottle: My sample said only Weisse on the labeI assume its the same as the Hefe Weise. On the label there is a 05.05 hope its not the expiration date... that would be the second flop from Keg & Bottle in San Diego but it would explain the low rating.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2011 On tap in Germany at Brasserie am Schleiferplatz in Idar-Oberstein. Never disappoints. Exactly what a nice hefe-weizen should be! Best in the summer time but any time is OK. Delicate and sometimes a very banana day.
Pours a darker pale color.  The aroma is what sells the beer.  Strong clove taste.  Great hefeweizen.   Very traditional.

Large head,carbonation will last a while,a misty orange weizen.Aroma perfumed wheat,maltiness and yeast,coriander note.Flavour smooth malt and clove,fruit spice,has a mild sharpness like mint but probably strong clove.Finish smooth malty,spicy.

swing top bottle (500ml). -Cloudy orange coloured, huge white head, estery fruity nose. Yeasty, wheaty and fruity taste with typical pleasant banana touch. Moderate sweet bubble gum finish. Refreshing and enjoyable weisse.
bottle. has an aroma of grass and wheat. pours a thick,cloudy yellow with a thick head. tastes of wheat and lemon with and apple aftertste. not bad at all.

Bottle 50cl. @ TFODRBSG 2008, Ulfborg, DenmarkUnclear hazy light to medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, moderate yeasty, banana. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. (230808)

Bottle From the LCBO
Very nice wheat beer
A little heavy on the cabonation
Bottle.  Pours an orange body with a white head.   Sweet malty with light ester fruits bubble gum, banana, berries.  Bready with no etoh.  Decent brew.
At an trinkgut in koln germany, golden, medium lasting head, some yeast andbasement aromas, banana, cheese, little citrus

Pours cloudy burnt orange with a 2 finger that fades quickly to a .5 finger and lasts. Aroma is yeast, banana, clove, lemon and a little wheaty/bready and sweet malt. Flavor is lots of sweet citrus, at first, a little pineapple, banana, spicy hops, and a little sweet bread. FInish is clean, with some cloves, wheatberry bread, and a little citrus. Body is medium with what is probably too much carbonation. Overall one of the best hefe’s though not my favorite style.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a cloudy gold, with a thin white head.  No lacing.  Aroma is light with a strong clove profile.  A bit of banana and wheat.  Flavor is a bit more pronounced with some grapefruit and lemon/lime finish.   Palate is a bit fizzy, but heavier than I expected.  Overall a very good Hefe.

Bottle, shared by MissDolle. A hazy, orange beer with a white head. Banana and cloves in the aroma, with grains in the background. The aroma is much the same banana, cloves and grains, but also has a nice bitterness. Medium full, effervescent and dry. Cloves, fruit and bitterness in the finish. A really well-crafted hefeweizen, easy to drink, and refreshing. (080823)

muddy orange hazyness white head dissapears with a medium speed
smells of yeast clove and banana
tasts of yeast clove and banana
aftertaste bittersweet ,clove ,banana, a hint of fresh bread

Does not get better than this. Fantastic banana and bubble gum aroma. Orange color is beautiful to gaze at.  Pours like no other. Wonderful head and lacing that never ends. Bananas,oranges, hops greet the palate. Silky smooth finish. Aftertaste is yet to be matched. Kudos. This is the world champion imho.

Bottle at home. September 2008. Nice refreshing Heffe-weisse. Cloudy and orange with a nice frothy head up front that sadly and quickly vanished. Aromas of bananas and citrus fruit. Initial impression is full and sweet. Finishes on the bitter side (lemon makes a late appearance).
Botella. Unclear golden. aroma of wheat with some fruit. Good mouthfeel. The flavour has pleasant fruity wheat with banana and some mild bitterness.
Very enjoyable hefe. Cloudy bright orange yellow with a lasting head. Aroma of bananas and cloves. Sweet bananas with a crisp wheaty finish. Delicious.
Very sweet flavor of fruits esp. banana. Head was white and noticably foamy to go with the yellow cloudy body. A good choice for my 100th beer.
From bottle.   August Dayton Beer Tasting event - Favorite Summer Brews.  Pours a cloudy orange with thick foam.  Classic German wheat with banana and wheat flavors.
Hazy, pale yellow with a thick white head. Banana, fruity and malty tones. Malt, spices and fruit. Medium body with a dry aftertaste.
500ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy orange with a thick foamy head.  Flavor:  Hints of yeast and citrus.  A great wheat beer.
quality.  Great lace, body, longevity.  dry finish and mouthfeel.  Smooth however.  good stuff.  taste like a wheat beer

Bottle, Shoeless Joe’s in Chicago.  Poured very well with good head.  However it was the flavor that was the big surpirse on this one; has to be one of the worst beer’s I’ve ever had.  Best description is a buttery flavor.  Did not finish the beer, will not order again!
Poured from bottle. Hazy golden color. Aromas of sweet bananas and grass. Flavor was oranges and bananas.

Bottle at the Mermaid Inn, NYC--poured into small frosted water glass (uggh) but thankfully with no lemon garnish. Cloudy yellow with a frothy white head.  Clean wheaty aroma with some mild banana and lemon essence.  Clean wheat flavor, bright and lemony, with no heavy cloviness.  Refreshing and quite good with my mediocre fish.
Bottle at Ulfborg RB tasting. Thanks a lot Missdolle. Poured hazy orange golden with a creamy head. Wheaty aroma with bubblegum notes and banana. I flavour clove, banana and wheat. Bit thin palate.

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2008 500ml bottle, bought in Toronto. Dark gold, slightly orange, darker than usual for the style, with a middling head. Fruity, spicy aroma of banana, clove, a hint of lemon and honey. Very rich. Has a rich, sweet, flavor, with lots of fruit and spice. Sweetish-style, not too sour at all, though not quite cake-like. Very well balanced and flavorful. One of the better ones, I think, and this in the bottle! Traveled well.

Date: 08/27.08
Aroma - Pungent clove, banana more subtle, toffee in the background, nice hefe aromas
Appearance - Cloudy tawny orange body under a voluminous, creamy white head that lasts nicely, and leaves some thick islands of lace
Flavor - Solid light malty sweetness initially, then a thirst quenching wheaty tartness comes into play, and just the softest of hop bitterness at the very end. 
Palate - Medium body and carbonation, silky smooth, clean and dry on the finish. 
Overall - A classic, well done hefeweizen in every regard.

Bottle @ TFODRBSG, Ulfborg, 2008.
[thank you, MissDolle]
Pours muddy yellow with a small, creamy, white head. Aroma is sweet, grainy and clear banana notes. Fine mouthfeel, okay balance. Sweet banana hits me first, then a serious maltiness and nice citric hoppy finish. Is there more?

(Bottle) Pours hazy yellow to light golden with a creamy white head. The aroma is sweet floral and wheaty with clear notes of banana. The flavour is of banana, wheat and flowers alongside a salty sting. The mouthfeel is soft and creamy. Light bitter and dry. Medium bodied.

Bottle.  (Simply "Hacker-Pschorr Weisse" on the label.)  Pour is a fizzy gold with a massive head.  Aromas are heavy with bananas and cloves with a touch of lemon peel.  Flavor is a nice combination of clove and banana driven wheatiness with some perceptible yeast and grass undercurrents and a bit of a citrus tanginess.  Very nicely done beer.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: As far as southern German weizen goes, this is a good one.  Pours golden with a big white fluffy head.  On tap at the Stadium Club at the White Sox U.S. Cellular Field.  Smells of bananas, bubblegum, noble hops.  Very nice example of the style.
Pours a cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma of banana, citrus, wheat, spices. Flavor is banana, citrus, wheat, spices, a little sweet but not cloying. Nice Brew.
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2016 hazy dark blond coloured little sparkling body with a white head a spicy fruity aroma a spicy fruity sweet taste with a spicy bitter finish
Cloudy orange, Banana and Citris notes while slightly tart.  Refreshing German wheat on a hot summer day.

I recently tried this at a bar in a Milwaukee hotel. From what I can recall it was an average/decent weisse but there was nothing that stood out from other weisses. Tasted highly of banana’s and with a zesty spiciness and some citrus.

(7/3/08) Draught at Der Pschorr in Munich. Cloudy orange with a big white head. Aroma of banana and some spiciness. Sweet fruity flavor with banana, a bit of clove and maybe light citrus notes and slight tartness. Medium-bodied.
Bottled 50cl. Pleasant taste. Quite a lot of cloves showing up. Good mouthfeel. Citrussy. Nicely balanced. Dry finish with hints of cloves. A good Hefeweizen.

(50 cl bottle at Haket, Göteborg) On Auust 6, 2008Cloudy orange color, big stable white head. Estery banana and phenolic spicy scent. MAlty sweet and a bit banana taste. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness.
Hazy orange coloured beer with small white head and lots of carbonation. Yeasty aroma a bit spicy. Full sparkling palate. Finish is yeasty and slightly bitter.

hazy darker blond coloured beer with lots of carbonation and an average creamy head. Light fruity wheat aroma with some little sweeter touches. Full creamy palate. Finish is light fruity, yeasty touched with some herby accents. Not bad.

White thick full lasting head. Cloudy orange colour. Aroma is moderately malty with fruity (apple, pear, citrus) and light spicy notes. Flavor is moderately malty with pear tones, ending in a moderately malty finish. Light bodied.

8/5/08: Bottle  Opaque burnt-orange body with a spongy white head. Some lace.  Full wheat nose with hints of citrus.  Flavor has lots of wheat with citrus (orange peel) and clove.  Nice and refreshing.
Bottle.  Pours a golden cloudy, with a white head.  Aroma is fruity, but not overly so.  Taste has classic hefeweizen, dry finish.  Good stuff.
Bottle (50 cl) at Haket, Göteborg, Sweden. Cloudy golden, large fluffy white head. Quite typical albeit slightly weak Hefeweissen, some banana and spicy notes. Quite dry.

On tap. Cloudy orange with a fluffy white head.  Aroma dominated by clove and banana, but also exhibited some grassy barnyard notes. Taste follows the nose, with lots of spice, banana, yeast, and lemongrass.  Dry, refreshing finish.  Awesome summer beer, and always a reliable choice at the neighborhood chain restaurant.

6-pack from Queen Six-Pack, Lancaster, PA...bottle pours golden yellow, white head...smell of clove, spice, bit of a musty floral essence...flavor is much of the same with a touch of honey also detected...one of the better I’ve tasted of this style.
Orange cloudy hue, white creamy head, nicely spiced  clove through wheat, medium body, hints of banana bread.

Cloudy, yellow/gold appearance with a large, dense white head and decent lacing.  Aroma is right on target for the style, with the yeasty esters front and center.  Smooth, palate pleasing texture.  Wheaty, yeasty, malty, mildly spiced taste.  Well rounded mouthfeel with good carbonation and a long lasting finish.  Just about everything you want in a traditional hefe.

([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */’s, Helsinki) Opaque orange with a smallish, quickly fading - although partly lasting - head. Slightly sour-bready, banana-fruity aroma with grassy and spicy hints. Orange-banana-fruity flavor with some sourness. Medium-bodied with slightly fizzy carbonation, leaves some stickiness. A refreshing and reasonably bodied Weizen, but nothing that special.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2009 Keg (Kittys, Helsinki)
Pale hazy orange, tiny head. Orangy citrus and banana aroma, quite
subtle. Lively carbonation on the tongue, but feels a tad watery. Big
banana taste at first, but that thins to just a few esters with a
watery backdrop before long. A bit of toffee too. Pretty OK quaffer,
but not full enough to excel.
Rerate: 500ml bottle. Yeasty, otherwise a little dull and flat. Not
enough esters or hops. Toffeeness quite high.

(Draught at Kaisla on 2008-07-14) Orange and cloudy. Big white head that disappeared quickly. Banana, malts and hops in nose. Medium palate with quite large amount of carbonation. Banana, bitterness, bit of fruitiness and  sweetness in taste. Surpringly bitter aftertaste.
Super nice hefe.  Clean wheat flavor with waves of classic banana and clove.  Perfect summmer beer.
Aroma is full of banana and orange.  appearance is cloudy orande (swirled and poured bottle conditioning into glass).  Flavor is like it smells, very smooth.  Overall a very good hefe.

Bottle dated 07/07. Cloudy orange color with a finger-sized head and yeast sediment floating near the bottom. Nose of mild banana and graham. The flavor was balanced with a muted taste of creamy banana that was more prominent when the beer warmed up a few degrees from the original refridgerator temperature.
short notes from old tasting. cloudy orange pour with medium thin head. yeasty banana spices, very smooth.

50cl bottle @ quality-supermarket, Manerba, Italy. Pours hazy orange with fine white head. Aroma is yeast, wheat & fruits - banana & orange. Great balance between sweet & sour. Lots of citrus. refreshing. Smooth mouthfeel. Nice!
Bottle from BTB in Vancouver, WA--Poured a deep golden-orange hue with a small fluffy head.  Nose of banana-clove and sweet oranges.  Yeasty esters with a smooth wheaten finish.  Very nice.

16.9 OZ at John’s Spirits.  Traditional dark golden weisse with its hints of banana, clove, and citrus.  Nice pour with a thick, white head, banana on the nose, and a spicy, dry, banana, yeast palate.  Flat finish.  Will buy it again, what a deal!

Dark, amber cloudy beer that even has a good head of froth on top from the bottle; you really get the wheatiness about it, almost a golden sweetness about it; quite a light bitterness at first that gives way to an all enveloping classic wheat-beer taste, plenty of fizz at just the right amounts, generous amounts of bitterness

Bottle proued to glass.  A nice,deep, golden yellow brew with a large 3 fingered creamy white head that smelt of wheat and cereal like.  Excellent lacing.  A very prominate sour, or acidic taste to it , however it is very well balanced.  A pretty good brew.

draught at Kittys Helsinki 270608 as beer of the month.
color: hazy dark yellow nice head
taste:nice easy banana aroma some citrus and bit yeast
Nice cloudy banana ester beer. Smooth wheat character. Drinkable with a mild malt, crisp finish. Oily. OK

500 ml bottle from LCBO, served cool in a Weizen glass. JN17/08.
App.:  Cloudy orange-golden with a nice white head that sits proud of the glass.
  
Aroma:  Lots of yeast, banana and clove esters, light lemony spiciness.
  
Palate:  Medium body, moderately soft effervescence, slightly syrupy.
  
Flav.:  Another big does of yeast and bread dough, banana esters, light clove and very light lemony spice; off-dry with a clean banana bread finish.

A lovely example of the style.
I first had this beer in Bavaria with a plate of sausage, kraut and pretzles. It brings me back to that time and place and is an easy drinking beer with a fresh flavor.

Had it on tap at Fiddlers Green in Winter Park, FL.  It poured a hazy golden orange-yellow color and had an aroma of banana, citrus, and clove: taste was the same flavor with a bit of a pepper (?) in the finish.  Good beer.

Had this in the bottle at Hatchys bar in Utica, MI. It poured a dark golden with a huge foamy head. It had lots of citrus on the nose, and a classic hefeweizen taste. creamy banana and hints of clove. Im not typically a wheat beer fan, but I would gladly get this again.

Im a sucker for a good Hefeweizen.  Had this one in Rothernburg Germany and brought the glass home as a souvenir.  Had it with a plate of weinershnitzel with an appetizer of escargot.  Incredible combination of flavors for the whole meal.
Pour was cloudy golden with a fluffy white head.  Had a very floral and citrusy aroma.  good Wheat taste as well.  Nice brew.  Would buy again.

bottle at Market Cross, Shippensburg: pours typical cloudy with fluffy white head that stays well.  aroma is quity wheaty and remincent of whole wheat bread to me.  also a prominent clove aroma and subdued banana.  flavor is bready and yeasty with some clove flavor.  well carbonated and creamy in the mouth.  good weise

On tap at The Spotted Hog in New Hope PA. Nice hazy pour with a decent size foamy head. Great aroma of wheat and a few other things including banana and clove. Taste is of wheat, citrus a bit of lemon. Really good Hefe. Very refreshing. Would like to try it again in the bottle to see if I truely do like this beer. But on tap at this place it was great.

hazy orange hue with a medium sozed white head, which had mild retention.  Aroma was a mix of bread notes and some fruit notes.  Flavor was very lemony almost too sour at times,  some nice bread notes though but not enough.
Had numerous times. Pours hazy golden with fluffy white head. Aroma is bready and wheat. Flavor is bready with hits of citrus and spices. Not a big fan of hefewizens but this one is pretty good.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2008 next to franziskaner, my #1 session beer. reeks of typical weizen aromas.  i feel my low rating is unfair considering how much of this i drink, but im trying to keep it all in perspective. far from the worlds greatest weizen, but one of the best available mainstream in america.

Pours super foamy white head and clear orange color.  Very very doughy aroma and taste.  Some banana and lemon zest as well.  Had this and paulaner weise within a day of one another and paulaner was much much better.  If you have the similar choice, pass on this one.
Cloudy gold with very good, foamy white head / Light nose of citrus and spice / Medium body, watery, with fast fading finish / Weak flavors of orange, banana, and spice / Mediocre.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2008 Before trying this beer, Franziskaner was probably my favorite wheat beer. The Hacker-Pschorr poured cloudy orange with a thick, white head. Super flowery-sweet aroma with a hint of tropical fruits that really gets me excited to taste this beer. The flavor lives up to the aromas billing- fabulous, complex and fruity, I tasted some trace apple along with the strong banana/lemon flavor that dominates the beer. This is probably the best hefeweizen Ive ever had, the more I drink it the more it grows on me. Update (06.28.08) - Really fantastic, satisfying brew. Anybody asking for a summer beer? This is your beverage. Far and away the best hefeweizen Ive ever had- the little things raise it above and beyond Paulaner. Try it
Pours a hazey orange body with a huge white head. sweet fruity aromas of bannana peaches and honey. a well carbonated mouthfeel which is very plesent.

This hefe has too little orange and coriander, and too much sugar and alcohol in the aroma. Nice cloudy orange color.  Big white frothy head. The start shows a lot of promise but as I drink I feel like the deep complex hefeweizen flavor is missing. The finish is the same way. Just a little lacking. Still not a bad beer. Id just choose a different one, like Franziskaner, if I had the choice.
12oz bottle; pours a cloudy tan color, taste of wheat, barley and perhaps some apples, very good

Smells a bit coppery, with a bit of yeast and citrus aromas. Huge white rocky head that significantly diminishes but stays tight on top of the beer throughout the glass and leaving a little lace. The beer is a hazy yellow, much like the typical hefe. Taste is a little different from the typical hefe, there is certinally some clove & spice flavors but the bananna is not really very present. This has a light but livley hop character with some citrus flavors.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow-orange with a large diminishing frothy white head. Aroma and flavour of banana, citrus and more fruit, yeast, wheat and light spices. Light bitter finish. Both aroma and flavour are mild. Average bodied. Nothing amazing or anything, just a simple pleasant Hefe.
Smell is somthing musty that begs to be laundered.  Palate is good but somewhat thick/clingy.
excellent brew.  a nice summer beer.  Pours hazy and golden has that classic banana smell and a clean refreshing flavor.  a nice change of pace
Bottle ... Very hazy yellow orange ... big foam head ... banana banana  banana  and i aint even tried to smell it. big wheaty buble gum and banana.

Bottle. Fruity sweet nose, buttery and floral with grape notes. Cloudy pale gold with  huge white head, frothy leaving nice lacing. Robust grassy sweetness with a tangy sweet and sour finish. Good buttery palate. Clean and easy drinking.
Mild clove and bannana character....creamy mouthfeel and fine large head....good retention...balanced...but missing something that would make it great!

Pours a hazy dark orange color with a moderate sized off white head. I just had the Paulaner the other day and this has several similarities (although Id prefer the Paulaner). Sweet citrus aroma with a hint of banana and spices. Quite refreshing and very smooth. Very nice for a warm day. Flavor is a lot like others Ive tried in the same category recently. Sweet (not too sweet though), with some vanilla, banana and citrus notes in there. All very well balanced.
One of the best wheat beers I have drinked. Even I dont like wheat beers so much as they are too watery, I was content with this one.

...great wheat, nice mouth feel, and quite refreshing.  Very similar to the Paulaner Hefe.  Very good fruitiness, with a nice head, and decent aroma, signature of a great wheat beer.  Tried it last weekend in the bottle and was very impressed, tryi it if you love a good Hefe, this is right up there.

Bottle - LCBO-  Nicely carbonated, hazy orange with a frothy cartoon like white head. Orange aroma with yeast coming through too, pepper there also. Surprisingly mild but refreshing lemon-yeast flavour. A mildly tangy finish makes this a very enjoyable Weizen, perfect for a summers day.
Some sentimental value, because it was probably the best beer I had on draft iduring my trip to Germany. Its everything one would want in this style as it is fruity, refreshing, and extremely smooth.

Bottle from The Bottle Stop in Bramhall. So its a hefe right? I like, not sure if this is a good example as I know nish, just drink beer. Very nice indeed. Cloudy orange gold with a nice white head. Nice malty citrusy orangey bananay flavoury. Bingo, ticked my box while I was waiting for the missu.

Cloudy amber with large white head.  Banana bread dough complete with wheat & yeast dominate the aroma.  Tastes of wheat, lemon and banana with a light dry finish with next to no bitterness.  A solid effort for a hefeweizen.

Wow cant believ i hadnt rated this one, kinda cloady orange color with decent white foam, nose is Banana and wheat maybe a touch of citrus. Flavor is big on the wheat and Banana and cloves in there as well, nice refresher in the summer.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow-gold with a large white head. Aroma is banana, spice, bubblegum. Flavor is same, slightly sweet with a bit of spice. Slightly thin mouthfeel. A pretty good example, on the estery and slightly thin but refreshing side of the spectrum.

On tap at Six N Save.  A hazy golden color with a rich creamy off-white head.  Nose of coriander, banana, and lots of fruity esters.  A bit of spice flavor.  Coriander, apple, and some chalky pepper.  A great deal of sweetness in the flavor.  Pretty thin mouthfeel, but would probably be very refreshing in the summer.

Pours a golden, orange hue with the typical banana and citrus hefe aroma. Very crisp and refreshing.  This is similar in taste to the Paulaner Hefeweizen, and, in fact,  ive been told by a bar owner in Milwaukee, its probably the same beer as the Paulaner.  Im not sure, but I think the Paulaner and the Hacker- Pschorr use different yeast strains. Ok, I digress...nice Hefe.
Good beer.  Tastes a lot like paulaner.  Some difference not much though.  Brewed in the same place maybe the same beer, who knows

Bottled. Pours out in a cloudy dark yellow/pale orange colour with a rich creamy and lasting white foam. Banana, wheat, cloves and mandarin and lemon-peels in the spicy aroma. Medium-bodied with rounded flavours of banana, cloves, oranges, all-spice with mild notes of apricots and vanilla. Creamy mouthfeel despite the lively carbonation. Cloves, bananas, tangerines, lemon-peels and peaches in long fruity and juicy aftertaste.  One of the better wheat beers Ive sampled.
One of the first hefe weisse beers I ever tried. I think it is very nice.  Very yeasty and minimal hops on the finish.  Good brew.

12 oz. bottle, pours a hazy and cloudy dark gold with a good bit of effervescence, some amber hues in the center, initially this has a large white foamy head and then deflates after a few moments to a 1/4" thick covering, this beer left some bubbly lacing on the glass, has a nice ripe banana and wheat malt aromas with cloves, fragrances of malt and fruit sweetness, flavors of wheat and malt with some fruit sweetness, has a tart citrus bite at the finish to provide a dry finish with a faint taste of lemon, not much hop bitterness but the citrus clears the tongue well, feels light on the palate with some fluffiness, this was better then what I expected, I recommend trying.

500ml bottle from my bestest friend kathi. Bittersweet in aroma and almost like milk in appearance, with an orange hint that is :-). big creamy head. hops, lemon, clove and a bit of banana in flavour. but i found it very short and watery. i had better
Nice beer. Really tasty witbier nice mouthfeel on iPod so cant be wordy with this rating go by numbers. Solid overall

500ml brown bottle

bought at the SAQ

A: nice milky wheat color, nice head, lots of foam, good carbonation
S: natural wheat smell, some banana ester, 
T: good classic taste, nice yeasty taste.
M: good medium body
D: nice complex but easy drinking white beer.
Pours a hazy gold, nice creamy white head. Aroma is yeast, banana, & some spice.  Flavor is more of the same, with some citrus, very smooth.  Not one of my favorite styles, but not bad.

bottle courtesy of BeerGestapo. thanks Mike. pours a very hazy amber color with a huge 3" head. nose is a blend of banana, lemon peel, and a touch of clove. very mild chewy wheat and yeast flavor and a bit of fruitiness.. was expecting a bit more with the somewhat impressive smell. palate is also unexpected, very soft and smooth, not fuzzy and carbonated as the appearance seems to predict. would be an amazing summertime cookout beer.
Golden yellow in color with an pretty good white head.  Slightly fruity aroma and taste. Banana and clove in there.  Light fruitiness in the taste.

From the swingtop bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with a tall white fluffy head. Banana yeast nose, sweet and wheaty. Very smooth on the palate letting the wheat flavors coat and saturate. Big estery finish, lots of banana and a light clove character.

Bottle. I know its unconventional to give hefeweizens a 5 for appearance, but it was just so gorgeously goldenly hazy with a perfect creamy head. Aroma starts off strong with banana, evolves into citrus and wheat as well. Flavor is exploding with juicy (not "juice-like," more along the lines of "exploding-with-lusciousness) fruit characteristics. My rating might be a tad on the high side in the grand spectrum of beer, but who cares, it was great stuff.
Draft. Creamy straw with proper thick white head. Spicy citrus aroma. Nice proper weiss taste slightly spicy. Perfect.

Bottle.  Poured a pretty deep yellow with a thick white head.  Aroma of yeast, banana, citrus.  Tastes of light fruits with some spices in the swallow.  Pretty carbonated.  Very smooth, very refreshing, yum!

Draft at a local Irish pub while watching Man United in champions league. I was perplexed at first by the intense, sharp, wheaty aroma. The appearance was golden tan and typical of a light beer. I felt the flavor was nice and pungent with strong fruity character but the palate wasnt very smooth. I enjoyed this beer but it might be a little too tart to make a habit of drinking.

Pours with a nice large white, bubbly head and hazy yellow body.  The aroma has a bit of a lemony scent, which I dont think Ive noticed in Hefes before.  Of course, I also pick up the hint of banana there too.  The flavor has a yeasty note and it finishes rather dry.  Its a pretty good Hefe.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2008 (GERMAN)  Hazy Yellow color with  Med-White Head. Had a  Banana Malt Aroma with a mild Spicy taste, Good Palate. Had this Brew with the  Knights....... I dont drink many Wheat beers, But i like this one!!!!
Pours a cloudy golden color with a chunky brilliant white head.  Aroma of lemon and banana with grain and yeast.  Nice smooth palate.  Yeasty citrus flavor.  Very drinkable and delicious.

Bottle-Decent enough for a wheat beer.  Im note a huge wheat beer fan but this was an exceptional Weisse and a 60-40 balance. Cloudy gold and yeasty.  Wheat and barley flavors with a good carbonation crisp taste.  This is a good choice for heavy German food.  Smooth, lightly sweet and pleasant.
Cloudy beer with a thick white head.  Nice citrus aroma.  Very smooth citrusy and floral taste.

Pours murky yellow with nice billowy head. Good lacing. Notes of cloves, mild banana, some pepper, something somewhat doughy. Flavor is citrus (lemony) sweet, spices (cloves, maybe nutmeg) Finish is bready, citrusand banana. A classic that everyone can enjoy.

murky orange pour with a large 2 finger white head that dissipates pretty fast.  lots of citrus and floral notes with hints of coriander or something.  unique taste of wheat and random spices that i cant name.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2016 500 ml Bottle: Cloudy orange with dense medium head.  Wheat is dominant in the nose  along with nice notes of banana and clove.  Good yeast balance with a dash of spice.  Smooth and creamy with a delightfully sweet finish. Excellent.
tastes like a hefeweizen, but since im not usually a fan of them, i rated this one low, ive had much better ones before
