very cloudy is the first thing you notice orange in color with smells of bananas and mallts never been a fan of this style but real is what it is, smooth drinking

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2009 Bottle.  Poured a hazy orange color with a moderate off-white head.  Aroma is dominated by wheat, banana and yeast.  Flavor really exemplifies what I believe a hefeweizen should be: nice malty entry with fruity flavors (banana and a hint of citrus) with a nice compliment of spiciness and yeast appearing on the finish.  Smooth and easy drinking, much like most German beers I have encountered.  I like this, partially because I feel like it is my roots.
Pressão. Tomada em Munique (ALE), em novembro de 2007. Coloração âmbar turva, com creme razoável. Notas de cravo, laranja. Frutada. Nutritiva. Carbonatação média/alta. Típica weiss.

Pours a cloudy golden orange color with a thick white head.  Has a sweet malty banana aroma and flavor, with a spice presence  showing through in the latter.  Has a bit of a heavier feel to it than other hefeweizens.
It had a hazy yellow body, with out much head at all.  It had a citrus aroma and flavor.

500 ml bottle.  Pours yellow-orange with particulates.  Not much head, almost no visible carbonation, and goes down pretty watery... maybe I got a bad bottle.  Smells of citrus, wheat, yeast, and perhaps some other fruit notes.  Tastes first of fruity citrus then finishes with a more dry, wheat flavor.  Not my favorite of this style, its not bad either.  Would like to try this on tap.
500 ml bottle. pours hazy yellow with a big white head. spicy aromas, cloves, wheaty and yeasty. flavours are clovey banana, with yeast. enjoyable but not my fav in this style.

Its a hazy, golden beer with a huge, nice head. The aroma has nice notes of wheat, banana, light citrus, some yeast and spice. The flavour has a suitable sweetness, notes of wheat, banana but not as much spice/clove as I prefer. I do however find light notes of oranges. Its uncomplicated, charming and easy to drink!

I wish they would eliminate the ability to review if you havent had this beer on tap.  The strong banana and honey flavors treat your mouth to an overwhelmingly wonderful experience.  A true mouthful of hefe that is delightful down to the last sip!  Beautiful golden color that you couldnt even dream of seeing through.  Overall a must if you have the opportunity.  If I go back to Germany I am not going to drink anything else.  (None of this can be said for the bottled version, watery and disappointing!)

Mostly wheat aroma with some citrus and spices. Pours very nice golden orange with good head.  Flavor and palate are not as good as expected from the scent but still better than most. Probably my least favorite style of beer, but a good representation of the style none the less.
Citrus and wheat aroma.  Cloudy, golden-orange with thick, lasting head.  Wheat, spices, and sweet citrus flavours.  Watery / bland palate.
UPDATED: APR 2, 2008 Yeasty, citrusy, carbonated, delicious. A real simple review, a straight forward beer, sometimes simple just works.

50 cL bottle. 
Light, yeasty, somewhat spicy aroma. Small head. Pours a slightly hazy golden colour. Palate is very fluffy and was the first thing I noticed. Flavour is initially sweet and yeasty, but fades to a pleasant soft acidity and dryness that lingers for a good time.
Pretty robust and gritty for a Hefe, I would have thought I would have rated this higher.  Maybe when i grab a hefe I am aiming for something softer.  It is what it is, nothing more but nothing less.
Bottle 50cl. Typical Colour, smell. Very well balanced, long aftertaste, refreshing, that´s what a Hefeweizen should be. A very pleasant Beer.
Tried this with the hoegaarden, actually like this better, seems to have more flavor smaller head , good hazy color and lots of clove and yeast, very nice hefe
Bottle. Hazy amber with slight head. Aroma is bready with hints of fresh yeast. Flavor is very mild, light sourness, citric fruitiness and hints of dusty yeast. Full, textured mouthfeel.

1-15-08 tap 
Thick yellow orange color with little to no head at all.  Has a light Hefeweizen aroma - Belgium yeast is there as well as the cloves too.  Has an obvious, but again slightly muted, hefe flavor.  Smooth palate and decent finish.  I dont like hefeweizens but this one isnt horrible.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2009 Glowing orange color with very little head on tap.  Smell is a bit fruity, with wheat and spiced clove yeast very evident.  Taste is wheaty, clovey, and the mouthfeel is quite smooth, creamy, rich, and with a bit of a crisp carbonation though.  Wheat in the finish, and this is a pretty nice summer beer.  One of the better hefeweizens for sure.
Hazy golden beer with a fruity aroma and a creamy white head; flavor is banana and clove with some malt; short finish is slightly sweet and fruity.

Very good weisse.  color is perfect golden, just right for the style.  aroma not overpowering, but complements the mild, fruity taste.  slightly acidic but settles into the finish with a great yeast taste and a hint of bitterness.

Bottle from the LCBO. Wonderful glowing gold liquid, but its frothy white head was not to last, which was disappointing. Scent is very mild and underplayed, but typical to the style once it emerges. Sweet banana and grain flavour, with a dose of citrus. Hmmph...I found the carbonation more aggressive than other reviewers, and a bit off-putting. Maybe just my bottle? Compared to other hefes Ive tried this beer seems to be a little subpar in every category.
cant add too much to what has aqlready been printed, although this hefe seems not to be as filling as others i have had, which means would make a great session beer

A tasty little hefe. Pours a cloudy gold with a decent rocky white head. yeasty grain aroma with a touch of banana and clove. Flavor is bready, yeasty and sweet with a touch of citrus and banana. Full mouthfeel, nice body. Overall, a very nice hefeweizen.

12 oz. bottle from 6 pack. Poured a hazy golden with a nice head. Aroma was sweet and mellow. Taste is very citrusy yet mild. A very smooth feel with light carbonation. More citrus, and not so much banana as I usually prefer my hefes. Finishes smooth but with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Overall, a good hefe.

100th rate!  
All I will say is that this is what a hefeweizen is supposed to taste like...  Yeasty, fruity, light but sweet.  Very good citrus notes in the nose and in the palate.  Mild carbonation, but not flat.  Delicious.

Bottle @ Ds Six Packs and Dogz.  Cloudy golden appearance with a light frothy white head that subsided quickly.  Aroma was sweet and yeasty.  Flavor was mostly sweet with a hint of bitterness.  Medium body with soft carbonation and lingering flavor.
Vibrant texture, smooth taste, clean finish. One of my personal favorites.

Bottle.  Poured to a cloudy cider color with a light white head that quickly disappeared.  Little to no fizz, light sryupy consistency, medium body.  Sweet aroma: honey, wheat pear.  Poppy beginning & long fizzy middle of wheat & hopps.  Quick aftertaste, sharp & stingy, slight linger of wheat and very slight bitternesses.  Clean, sharp and balanced.
Absolutely delicious weisse.  Crisp, clean, with vibrant flavors and a full body.  With a lemon or orange slice, this beer is nearly perfect.

[722-20070929] Tap @ Castros Lounge (Toronto, ON). Mild fruity yeast aroma. Murky, light brown orange body with a long-lasting creamy white head. Mostly yeast flavour has a little banana. Medium body. Nice mild weisse, otherwise a little uninteresting.
Pours a cloudy orange color.  Aroma is wheat, coriander, orange peel, and some citrus.  Taste is wheaty, with citrus and orange peel notes.  Sessionable and delicious.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2010 Pours a nice looking cloudy orange with some what creamy, large pillowy head. Aroma of light wheat maltiness, notes of banana and light citrus. Flavor is exactly the same. Mouth feel is light-medium body, soft texture, medium-high carbonation. Overall, not bad at all.
very easy to enjoy. Smooth and fragrent. Aroma is honey, wheat Slightly sweet orange
Bottled (Thanks DerDoppelbock). Hazy orange colour, mediumsized beige head. Aroma is honey, wheat and quite much bread. Also banana is present. Flavour is wheat, banana and slightly soapy notes.

Great spiced citrus aroma with notes of other fruit.  Flavor shows more of the spices and less of the fruit with some nice bitter orange peel notes.  Slightly sweet orange finish.  The fine carbonation rounds this one out nicely.  Definately a good german hefe.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2008 Beautiful mountainous small bubble foam head, awesome cloudy orage tinted color. Wonderful aroma thats very pure and refreshing alone and resembles pure, clean, light oranges. A lot of orange peel flavor. Fizzy consistency that is quick to lay down. Refreshing, light. Pretty damn good.

Bottled (BB 02/2008)
Orange color, a bit hazy, small white head. Sourish fruity aroma. Mango fruity, malty, a bit papery, propably the bottle is not too fresh. Potential hefeweizen, but needs rerating.
Great, really full bodied for a hefeweizen. Wheaty flavor with light citrus, yeast, and spice as well. Nice complexity. Highly drinkable. Lightly sweet finish.

Single from the local shop produced on "07.06" if that means what I think it means this has held up rather well. Fresh aroma of mild banana, wheat, and clove. Typical scent for the style and real nice. Cloudy orange pour with a medium sized white head and decent lacing. Cloudy beer from the yeast swirl, vibrant and bright when held to the light. Medium body, not as creamy as I like my hefes to be. Filling with a nice finish, very clean. Flavor mimics the aroma, solid wheat content dry and refreshing. Banana and spicy clove. Typical for the style, nice enjoyable beer here.
Not too heavy, not too light, excellent variation of flavors on the palate. Fruity, wheat, and spice. Very delicious. Nice and cloudy. Recommendable.

purchased at puget sound wine cellar in port orchard, washington.
pour is a cloudy golden-sunshine yellow with a three finger white head, bit of sediment swimming around in the pond also, head has good stamina, excellent lacing.
smell is wheat, yeast, touch of citrus, banana.
taste is banana, wheat, lemon, bread dough, touch of spice.
overall a really nice hefe.

Brought back from Germany and poured into a weizen glass on 08-11-07. A cloudy medium gold color with a 2 finger off white head. Coriander, clove, lemon, wheat, banana, and a grainy aroma at first at the nose. Banana, lemon, malt, a little clove, a little spice, and a big wheat note to the taste buds. Aftertaste has Wheat, very light citrus sweetness of orange, and light coriander. A smooth medium body and medium carbonation. A great hefe! This ranks up there with Weihenstephaner. Points for the flip top bottle. Not overly sweet like so many hefes that I tried with over in Europe.
Solid German hefe. Spring drinking at its best. It gets harder and harder to drink American wheats. The Germans stay true to the cause.

16.9 oz bottle. Pours a super hazy orange with an ample white frothy head that quickly rejuvinates with some agitation. Aroma of wheat grass, lemon, slight corriander and yeast. LIght body with a slight watery feel and for the ample head the carbonation is light. Citrus flavor with notes of wheat and grass. very pleasant and quaffable.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2008 On tap at the Sanctuary in Iowa City.I think I might have to try this beer another dozen times to be sure about my rating. Typical hefe in look, aroma and palate but the flavor is incredible. It tastes like a meadow on a beautiful spring day. Enough said.
Sour hoppy aroma. Citrusy flavor with mildly spice/clove finish and hint of banana bread. Creamy mouthfeel. Quite good.

Pours a cloudy orange with four fingers of white, lingering head.  Sediment in the bottle.    Odors of sweet cloves.  A very sweet taste, with a hint of citrus and cloves, with a general sense of creaminess.  A good, drinkable beer.
UPDATED: NOV 2, 2007 The head gets big and stays pretty big. I noticed the clovey taste the most. Slightly citrusy at the beginning but for me it turned very into a strong clove and banana flavor.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2009 Bottle pours a hazy orange.  Dense white head.  Carbonation is sparse yet head does not settle.  Aroma of limes and pine needles.  Body is sweet malts and a touch of toffee.  Finish is well rounded and smooth.  hardly a trace of hop.  Citrus bit is only present at first mouthfeel.  Malts overtake it  but do not dominate.  An all day drinker.  Tap last night at the Wurstfest in Albany.  A solid presentation. I would expect no less from the German-American Club: proper glassware and temperature.  No change in rate or score.

Yellow and orange pour lots of bubbles, very little cloudiness and a large white head.  Somewhat dusty wheat aroma.  flavor is light but very balanced.   Not too sweet, a little dry and some banana/clove in the finish.  Palate is very nice, pillowy, but the bubbles are a little too strong and fade quick leaving it strangely fluffy.  Bumped it up a point of two for being the  beer that turned me onto to quality brews in college.   Very drinkable.

Definitely another wonderful German style Hefeweizen.  Pours a wonderful cloudy, hazy, slightly carbonated copper color.  It performs well with nice head retention and good lacing.  The flavor is solid with wheat, banana, clove and a slight spicey character blended with a fruity twist.  Nicely done
A creamy, smooth, sweet beer with a hint of banana and clove.  Rich, golden pour includes a generous head that maintains throughout.  Very, very smooth refreshing finish.  My favorite hefe.

Pours a very hazy orange with a modest creamy white head and some lacing. Aroma of wheaty sweetness and pale sugar syrup - more sweet than spicy. Taste is to style - very creamy and typically sweet, crisp but subtle hops with a buttery, lightly spiced finish. Very creamy body with good carbonation that settles very quickly. This is a very good Hefe, but it doesnt exactly jump out at you. Drinkable, but Ive had much better locally.

Not overly sweet like some of its counterparts.  Nice fruit and spice characteristics.  Far better on tap than out of the bottle.  Its cheaper than many of the other Weisses in the area ($6.99/6-pack)

very gude hefe! its labeled just weisse here in the states for some reason. but looks beautiful, smells citrusy, and finishes well.

bottle at bevmo in sunnyvale, ca
Pours an almost orange colour.  Taste is of fruit.  Wheat taste hangs on the tongue after initial taste.  Very good hefe
Very good weisse, nicely carbonated. Has a orange haze, with nice hints of fruit.
Bottle:  One of the better Hefe Wiesse.  Generally anything German is good.  had a fruit essence, I did not place.  cloudy colour and medium body.
12oz bottle-An orange cloudy body with ahuge white head and an aroma of banana, clover, yeast, and wheat. Taste of the same with a great balance between all the flavors. Great hefe.
Smells and tastes of banana, orange, yeast.  Excellent Hefeweizen, cloudy yellow orange color, creamy head.  Very nice.

Bottle- Sampled @ Siebel during the German style tasting- Slightly hazy golden color, small white head. Nose is balanced between the traditional weiss beer noses. Cleaner than the previous, wheat and yeast, clean, not picking up anything bad.

0.5l bottle. Pours an opaque honey-golden brown. Solid head that lingers. Looks really good. Smells very fruity and sweet. Palate is quite smooth and feels very refreshing. Tastes strongly of cloves and bananas. Really nice.

500ml tap-beer and then 500ml on bottle. Hazy orange coloured under a filmy layer. Fragile aroma of clove and wheat. The taste is a blend of sappy oranges and sweet, overripe banana. Dry ending. One of the better weizen I have tasted, but still a bit too sweet (Trier, 13th and 15th September 07).

Tasted back to back with Weihenstephaner. Silky, steadily fizzing apricot trumpet with a nibble of grain. Stillish and smooth. Heady banana perfume, sourish wood and citrus. Thickly blanketed with persistent froth. Touches of cabbage and smoke in the aroma. Distant toffee apple fruitiness. Wheat and malt in unusually equal measure. Lovely, treacherously mellow Hefe.

500ml label Weisse; Nose of banana and wheatiness; hazy yellowish-copper with a medium white head; flavor of banana, clovey spices, and some sweetness; mouthfeel is tingly and body is medium. Good Hefe!

9/22/07 On draught at Barca, Seattle.  Aroma is classic for the style with clove notes forward.  Appearance is hazy yellow with a good white head.  Flavor is very light with a low sweet/sour wheat character defining; theres very low ester or phenol character here.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied with a creamy texture and low carb feel.  Overall, this is just a bit heavier and round than it should be, but seems to be the right flavor.

Tap - Barca - Seattle, WA
A hazy golden ale with a light head.  Served in a proper glass this was a great weisse beer.  Strong fruity essence and lots of wheat flavor.  This was bitter in the finish and the overall beer was very strong flavored.  Very earthy.  This was a decent beer not my fav.
Oktoberfest @ Coach & Horses, Greenwich from cask - fragrant nose, cloudy gold hue, light in body, no carbonation, sweet after taste with some bitterness. Nice.
A very smooth beer, some hint of fruitiness and clove, one of my favorites.
A smooth and refresshing drink, with no real bitterness. Some light fruity notes, a touch on the bland side but refreshing and solid none-the-less.
On tap at the Oasis.  Good citrus and spiciness with a hint of banana.  Good carbonation and classic taste.

orange gold with a medium dense fluffy head. aroma of yeast and citric cloves. smooth body and highly carbonated. light honeyed yeast flavor with apples and cloves, and a light bitterness. the beer has a slight bittersweet dry finish. good beer if you dont like lots of banana in your hefeweizens

12 ounce bottle in weizen glass.  Cloudy orange with dense off-white head and lace.  Aroma dominated by banana esters.  Very light flavor of wheat, grass, honey-orange.  Slight bitter aftertaste.  Not unpleasant at all, just not very flavorful.   Refreshing.

Bottle, born in Feb 2007 split with Tronraner in a blind hefeweizen tasting. Pours a rich orange with a decent head. Yeah, its pretty cloudy. Theres a bit less depth here than what I just experienced (turns out that was the Weihenstephaner), but its still aromatic. I picked up a bit more citrus here with less spices (except clove) and banana, though those were still definitely present. Clove is way up front in this one. This was a fairly juicy take on the style with hints of apples and a moderately dry finish. Not a huge amount of complexity here, but it is a solid representation of the style.
Solid weiss - yeasty, cloudy and a bit of spice.  Not as much spice as others, and maybe a bit thicker than some others. Drinkable and solid brew, just other better ones readily available.
Classic Weisse with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Beautiful gold color with a very thin off-white head that quickly disappears. Nice fruity taste.

Name: Weisse
Date: 03/13/2001
Mode: Draft
Source: Taco Mac, Sandy Springs

cloudy dark yellow, thin white head, slightly sweet malt aroma with a touch of sweetness, medium body, good mix of citrus with a touch of spicy hops, just the slightest hint of bitterness

Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 10/20
Rating: 2.6/5.0Score: *4
-------- />
The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2008 500 mL bottle. Pours a hazy orange. Aroma includes orange peel, lots of banana, and yeast. Flavour had a tart, citrusy character with banana and a few pangs of yeast. Top notch.

Aroma: 6 
Appearance: 4 
Flavour: 7 
Palate: 3 
Overall Impression: 14 

Rerate: March 27, 2008. 
Drank from the bottle. Aroma speaks of banana, pineapple, almonds and faint yeast. The flavour is also centred around the banana. This centrepiece gives way to a slightly bitter sodium-celery quality. While the beer is medium to heavy bodied, I cannot help but find it watery -- the taste is not nearly as full as the aroma. Sourdough bread was left on my breath after each sip. The aftertaste is short lived. An interesting beer, but the lack of power in its flavour is a tad frustrating. Appearance rating taken from my first crack at tasting this one.

Poured from a 500ml bottle into a tall weizen glass.  This hefeweizen poured a cloudy, dark yellow color with a foamy off-white head that slowly faded away.  Some faint lacing was left around the glass.  The aroma of this beer was made up of spicy yeast esthers, light citrus, banana, and some sour dough bread.  The flavor included banana, orange peel, clove, and bread notes.  The mouthfeel was medium-bodied and refreshing with average carbonation.  This beer is a fine example of a classic style.  Very enjoyable!!!

Dark yellow colored, medium sized yellow head. Rich banana in aroma with spices and obvious yeast. Medium bodied. Flavor is also nice with dominating banana, still some sour yeastiness and caramel also there. Aftertaste dries strongly.

Bevuta alla spina al Kapuziner di Arquata; hefe abbastanza convenzionale ma piuttosto godibile con toni molto bananosi e forte sentore di lievito. Piacevolissima destate da bere per scacciare la calura.

Bottle Beers of Europe I think  Poured hazy orange with large white head. Aroma yeasty, peppercorn, and banana. Taste very refreshing quite fruity, banana again noticable but also some lemon running through, nice beer.

12 oz bottle-cloudy yellow w/a moderate head. Sweet spiced aroma. Flavor of citrus, spice, yeast, banana, & wheat. Had a little bit of a "Belgian" flavor to it. This was quite good, Vrey smooth, easy drinking summer brew.

One of the best Hefes, especially on tap.  Pours a thick, cloudy pale yellow, with a substantial head and lacing.  Aroma is yeast and citrus (lemon?) and spice.  Taste is thick, and heavier than expected, but still refreshing.  Perhaps the ultimate summer brew!

12oz bottle.  Aroma of dried fruits and sweet malts.  Average sized white head that fully diminished and left no lace.  Golden hazy hue.  Lightly sweet flavor.  Palate is medium bodied.  Icky dried fruity belgium ale taste.  yucky brew
from a 12 oz. bottle, pours a cloudy, hazy, orange with a white head.  very nice hefe.  one of the best, but i still prefer paulaner.

One of my favorite wheat beers.  Nice, thick and sustained white head and rich golden color.  Flavor is citrus with noticable cloves and some other spices (cinnamon maybe?).  Overall, an excellent beer.  Much better on tap than in a bottle.
A very nice wheat beer, crisp and refreshing and not overly sweet, which is a plus.
Bottle. Slightly sweet aroma w/citrus smells. Thick head w/moderate carbonation. Full flavor of banana and orange, creamy feel on the way down. Very good beer.

Aroma was bananas and citrus. Cloudy gold color, beautiful milky white head. Flavour is complex with bananas, citrus (orange) and wheat. Hops are tough to pick out. Very nice beer, will be buying again
Bottle. Cloudy pale gold with a big, long-lasting white head. Aroma of yeast, cloves and citrus. Flavour was packed full of bananas with a grainy wheat mouth feel. Very good.
Golden cloudy yellow.  Sweet aroma with prominent bananas and cloves  Taste mirrors aroma with some other spices.  No hops

500 ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy yellow with a huge foamy white head.  Aroma of spices and banana.  Taste is clove, yeast, and a bit of banana.  I taste more clove and less banana in this beer than other German hefeweizens.  Great beer!

50 cL bottle as Weisse. Good old Deutshce banane aroma. God bless the Bavarians. Hazy peach color. Substantial white head that leaves lacy tatters. A bit thin bodied. Not so much banana as expected. Very clean. Near creamy. Banana in  the finish. Light notes of spice as well. Virtually no bitter. Really refreshing.

This beer pours a cloudy yellow with a large white head leaving some good lacing down the sides.  This has got to be one of the best weißbiers Ive ever had!  The banana and zest lemony aroma, with a nice mouthfeel and awesome taste!  What a great summer beer!  get one of these bad boys and enjoy...  Cheers!
I love a weißbier.  This isnt as good as it was fresh in Munich, but it is a nice summer beer.  It has the nice banana/clove flavor that is characteristic and it is widly available.
Typical hazy yellow weisse color with white head.  Compelx aroma of banana, yeast, barley....  Yeast, banana, spices comprise a balanced taste.  Not a weisse fan, but a good beer.
Biergarten of the Olympiapark, Munique. Weak, watery, nor she seems a  german weiss.............................Biergarten do Olympiapark, Munique. Fraca, aguada, nem parece uma weiss alemã.

bottle:  Thanks to Lord Beamish for this one.  If you like wheat beers with lots of yeasty, bready, fruity flavours than this is for you.  It felt like drinking a banana bread loaf, in a good way.  The head of this beer is a good indication of its high quality.  Loaded in flavour but smooth & quaffable.  Something different for a hot day.
The beer cafe. Aroma is super wheaty, banana, clove, spice combo. Taste is similar, loads of banana quite chewy almost.
Bottle, 5.5%. Hazy yellow colour. Big white head. Hint of banana aroma. Weak banana flavour, not too interesting. Very average Hefe.

Well, I tried this beer after some recommendations online, but was quiet disappointed.  It tasted and smelled like cooked ham.  I dont know how else to describe it, I pass this place out in the country on my way to work everyday and it has a big sign up saying "we roast pigs"  and you can smell the air around that place of roasting pigs i guess, and i swear i could taste that same smell when i drank this beer.  Bought two bottles of this stuff at the local beer store and just drank half of the second bottle, couldnt get myself to drink the rest.

I tried this beer on June 29, 2007 after purchasing it from my local LCBO store.  The aroma is slightly pungent with a wheaty punch.  The colour is a cloudy peachy colour.  The mouthfeel is thick and fuzzy to the cheeks with mild carbonation.  The taste is thick and wheaty as well.  Not a beer I will go out of my way to try again.
12 oz bottle. Only says "Weisse" on the bottle but I believe this is the same. Anyway, poured a hazy orange with barely any head. The aroma is clearly wheaty as is the taste. Nice solid hefe.

This is probably my most favorite of all hefe weisse beers. This one has no flaws for me.  It has a great wheat flavor without being overly tart or sour.  Excellent flavor and body with a  clean and simple palate. No overtones oor bas spices exist with this brew.

Draft at Black Forest Inn.  Unflitered orange/gold with plentiful frothy foam.  No complaints, a wonderful beer.  Havent had a beer this good since my first Leffe draft in London.  Fruity (banana more than lemon), spicy (some clove), creamy, wheaty, and refreshing.

Hazy pale orange with huge white foamy head.  Subdued sweet citrus-spice aroma.  Flavor is mostly cloves and banana.  A bit weak on the flavor, but this may have been an old bottle (looks like some date is "05.06").  Also kinda thin and a bit soapy, and none of the usual clean hefe finish.  Otherwise pretty standard though.
Bottle. Typical hefeweizen - hazy light orange, aroma of banana, spices and wheat. Flavor is wheaty malt and tart, ending dry.  Good mouth feel. This one is a little sweeter than others of the style.

500ml - Aroma of freshly baked wheat bread, clove and a touch of lemon.  Pours light orange with a big quickly fading head and great lacing.  Flavor is sweet yeast with a slight spicy zing, wheat and barley round it out.  Palate is creamy and smooth.  While theres nothing groundbreaking here, it is still a tasty and easy drinking brew on a hot summers day.
An absolutely wonderful drinking experience. Perfect for afternoon drink, or to compliment a meal. I would recommend this beer to anyone.

bottle: This one surprised me. Like most wheat beers, this one poured a cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Wheat comes through in the aroma. Light tasting and easy to coiffe. Very enjoyable. I will definately be buying this one again soon.

12 oz bottle. Typical wheat and yeast aromas right out of the bottle. Lots of fruit in the nose as well. Apricot, banana, and lemon being the most dominate. Medium in body with a nice crisp refreshing finish. Not a big fan of the style, but this one is pretty tasty.

Out of a 16oz bottle. When I poured a sample into a glass, the hue was orange/amber with a cloudy body. The head was quite white and billowy. The aroma reminded me of formaldehyde (spelling?), as is the case with all hefes that Ive tried. I also noticed a hint of orange blossom as well. The taste was definitely strange but also kind of refreshing. I tasted lots of wheat and some green olives. A very watery natural orange juice flavor soon arrived, and dominated the taste buds. Not bad when cold.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2008 500ml bottle. Pours a nice hazy orange colour with a lot of white head. Aroma of yeast, wheat, a tiny touch of citrus, malty. Tastes strongly of yeast/wheat, with some delicious malts. This is one of my go-to beers, and probably my favourite hefe thats readily available to me, but the only thing that I take away points for is the slight over-carbonation that distracts a little bit from the taste, and also makes the mouth-feel a little rougher. Other than that this is definitely an awesome brew!

Artificial bubblegum style banana on the nose. Looks delicious while and quickly after pouring with nice sparkling orangy body and yellowish pearly head, but quickly goes down to being just dirty and no head. Smooth and fruity. Im doing a head to head with alcoholfrei Erdinger and for some reason I prefer the Erdinger!

Bottle. Nice white head and nose typical of German weissbier. Smooth tasting and well-rounded example of the style. Cant really put my finger on any one outstanding characteristic but a good beer all the same.

I had just sat down into a deep leather couch with a the orange-amber H-P Weisse in 50cl glass and I just inhaled it for a moment. It resonated with banana and vanilla aromas, which I found to be normal for the kind of beer it is. The first taste was very memorable as the cream elements just came together with slight edges of hops to make them sparkle. Great beer.

I doubt I could tell the difference between this and Paulaner or Franiskaner, but I am left wondering, as usual, what its like on tap, and then dreaming about a cask.
Bottle. Orange blonde, cloudy. Banana and lemon in the aroma. Sweetish flavor with banana, lemon and yeast. Pleasant enough, without being spectacular.

5/22/2007:  Hacker-Pschorr Weisse pours a cloudy, deep golden color with a large, dense, creamy beige head that leave foamy, abstract lacing on the glass.  The aroma is primarily wheat.  The flavor is creamy butterscotch, wheat, banana, and a hint of caramel in the finish.  Medium-bodied and creamy.  Another nice German Hefeweizen.

12 oz bottle (L37153P; Produced on 11.05; 5.5% alc by vol) shared with Rob.
On draft at Maxs Allegheny Inn-Cloudy golden color with a decent head, aroma of sweet malts, sweet flavor of wheat without the estery fruity flavors like most weisse beers, very satisfying

Drank on tap from Phils in Saugatuck with an orange slice on the side of the glass. Poured a cloudy haze with a small head and smelled great. Great taste that I would expect from a wheat beer with some strong banana flavor. Refreshing and smooth, I thought that this was a great example of a hefeweizen and I would definitely drink it again if I had the opportunity.
Cloudy orange colour, head is persistant. Mostly yeast, wheat and banana. A bit of wheat acidity, somewhat metallic taste at first but it goes away after a few sips. Whole wheat bread finish.

on tap at the Oasis in Rockford.  a sweet flavor but one I didnt care for.  I kept wondering what the specific taste was.  Not one of my favorite wheats.  Leinenkugel sunset wheat and honey weisse are much better.

nice beer for the spring and fall. typical german style wheat beer with the clove taste. a bit overdone as the banana and lemon citrus attempt to invigorate. body could be better as you have the wheat from which to start. still thinnish and tinny. good weiss and ok beer. does not seem particlarly refreshing or particularly satisfying.
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2007 Slight, very orange, citrus smell. Light caramel color with no debris.  Smooth solid flavor with a trail of fruit. Very refreshing with a neat aftertaste, clean and smooth.
one of my fav german hefes. a joy to pour with the thick white head, amazing retention, love the BIG roma of banana and esters. flavour is crisp, one of my all time fav summer patio beers.

Bottle. Pours cloudy orange-gold with fizzy white head. The aroma is banana, zest, maybe some lemon cookies, and a little bit of butter. The flavor is identical to the aroma, no surprises here. Crisp finish, fruity aftertaste.
Tap.  Very full bodied, yeast, wheat and citrus.  Even a touch of sweet on the finish.  Great combination, and still one of my favorite Hefeweizen.

0.5L bottle from my sister that has Weisse and Traditional Wheat on the label. Pours classic hazy straw with pillowy bright white head. Aroma of wheat, yeasty banana and sweet sugary candy. Taste starts off smooth with wheat and malts. By midway the banana yeastiness kicks in full force with hints of bubble gum. Tasty refreshing brew that is exceedingly smooth.
bottle, poures a hazy golden with a medium head, very good example of a german weisse beer.

Bottle. Pours cloudy orange/gold with a medium sized white head. Aroma is bready and full of banana, fruits, and mild clove. Flavor is sweet and full of  wheat, banana, and spice that lingers for a while.

Pours a hazy golden yellow, with a about a cm of white creamy froathy head. Freshly poured the beer has a strong aroma of banana, as the beer settles the aroma gains strong notes of wheat.  The flavor is sweet, and spicy with notes of banana, the carbonation is good, medium bodied, with a creamy finish. A pretty decent beer.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2007 Bottle actually only says weisse. Pours a nice golden color with low carbonation and a nice think fluffy white head. Greaty wheaty taste that goes down smooth and has a medium finish. Overall very good for a hefeweizen but no hops and a bit watery.

Another weizen that advertises that it brews according to the Rheinheitsgebot, the Purity Law of 1516.  It pours a cloudy orange with a nice fluffy ivory colored head.  The carbonation was fairly light, and the nose was light to medium on the esters.  The taste was medium on the wheatiness and for the first time I noticed the clove taste I hear many raters talking about with weizenbiers.  This is another really good weizenbier from Bavaria where they know how to do it.

Bouteille. Couleur jaune-orangée voilée, avec une mince mousse qui persiste et colle au parois. Arôme de levure, de malt de blé, dagrumes. Goût légèrement acide. Bien agrumé et sucré. Finale en amertume. Équilibrée. Corps moyen et effervescence moyenne.
Pours nicely hazy amber colour with a large fluffy head. Strong wheaty aroma with citrus and yeast. Nicely balanced sweetness.

My most recent sample of  this beer came  on draught at Ludwigs Biergarten, in Philadelphia, PA. Pours to a hazy, deep golden color, with a tall, thick, rocky, white head, and a vibrant carbonation. The nose on this beer is excellent with aromas of spicy clove, grainy wheat, and fruity esters of bannana and pear. The palate is firm, with excellent, grainy and tart wheat malt flavor, paired with estery fruity flavors of green apple and pear. This beer finishes with more thirst quenching, tart wheat flavor up front, then ends with some spicy clove flavor that lingers. It is hard to go wrong with a classic German example of Bavarian hefeweizen, and this beer is a classic. A perfect match to a number of German dishes on Ludwigs menu. I enjoyed this one with a spicy cup of goulash, followed by an outstading meal of saurbraten, red cabbage, and spatezl.
500ml bottle. cloudy amber/orange with a nice big head. aroma of citrus, fruit and some banana. nice flavours of citrus and corriander. smooth and refreshing. good summer time beer.
Draft.  Pours cloudy amber with lots of head.  Aroma is citrussy, taste is not that acidic w/some coriander.

500mL bottle.  Pours a cloudy golden orange with a fine lacy white head.  Aroma is very fruity, with citrusy and banana elements.  Flavour is extremely sweet and fruity, in addition to the citrusy aromas, there appears to be a slightly sour strawberry-like taste.  Carbonation is light, with very little aftertaste, which makes it feel a bit thin.  Overall, a great refreshing beer that I would drink on a sunny, summer day.

Another fantastic hefe... Im beginning to think Im a tad bit biased towards hefes.  This hefe had a strong scent of bananas and grains.  A very smooth smell.  It was a cloudy/hazy golden color just like a good hefe should be.  It had a predominant taste of fruit (mostly lemons/oranges) with subtle hints of spices coming through.  Medium body with a creamy, smooth finish.  A good hefeweizen.  I found it to be much better served with a lemon, as opposed to straight.

Drank in a weizen glass.  Nice thick frothy off-white head with a murky dark orange poor.  Aromas of corn, lemon, coriander and a very discrete floral finish.  Again, little effervescence yet it has a nice light longlasting bitterness.  Nice and creamy on the palate with hints of bananas, other tropical fruits and coriander.
STRONG bannana taste immediatetly.  Leave a taste of strawberries? or other fruit after the banana.  Great weizen definetly of the bubblegum catergory

This is a great hefe. I am on week 2 of my hefeweizen phaze and this has been the best. Aroma was all banana and strong. Pour was a dark hazy gold with a thin white head. Taste was strong and "banana-y", wheat and a nice malt back bone with some bread in there as well. Citrus flavors shoot in and out and make me want to try a million more hefes!
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Draught Cloudy orange body with nice size head. Aromais of citrus - orange, yeast. Flavor is sweet dry crisp with slight yeast. Can be a little thin but with a smooth nice carbonation. This was very enjoyable.

Bottle poured a cloudy gold with a large lasting white head. Aromas of wheat, banana and a hint of spice. Palate was light bodied and smooth. Flavors of wheat, light banana and clove with a smooth clovey finish.

Bottle under the name of "Weiss" rather than "Hefe-Weiss." Im assuming its the same thing. This is a very typical German wheat all around, and thats certainly a good thing. Citric, sweet fruity taste is very refreshing. Quite thick and creamy on the palate. A bit of an acidic metallic aftertaste that I could do without. Overall, a nice beer for sure.

Bottled.  Hazy yellow in color with a thick smooth tall white head.  Lemon yeast aroma, some citrus, and clove.  Creamy yeast flavors, citrus, bannana, light flavors that are smooth with a medium yeasty body.  Refreshing beer, not bad on a warm Chicago, 71 degree day in April.
Really enjoyed this hefeweizen.  Has a nice cloudy golden appearance to it.  Great citrus flavor and goes down real smooth.  After each sip I wanted another, overall a very good beer.

Called  Bräu -  Weisse  Lacy white head over fully hazy orange beer. Banana, fruitmash, sweet and fruity. A bit drier taste. Still very fruity and a boatload of bananas. BIt of cloves retronasal, even mint. Medium bodied, wheat slickness.  Übliches Hefe
Bottled. Classic Weiss flavour, lemon sherbet, banana. White shinny head. Refreshing drink.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2007 How popular did this beer get? I remember having this beer like 5 years ago for the first time, I fell in love with this beer, soo smooth, tasty, great with everything. And now I can get it just about anywhere... Got to admit this was my first true love (in beers), I thought I loved Killians but I was young and inexpierence with good beers.

Draft.  Pours a cloudy, light orange with a nice white head.  Aroma of cloves, spices, wheat, and dry citrus.  Taste is the same with some fruit and yeast thrown in there as well.  This is a solid hefeweizen.  Its nothing amazing but I can see no faults.
Thin white head, hazy golden color. Citrus aroma. Taste was similar to the aroma; a quality hefe weisse. Very drinkable.
(bottle) This is a nice wheat. Pours a dark brownish orange; cloudy of course.  Nice smooth yaest and bubbly wheat with no chalkiness that most imitators have.  bueno!

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a pint glass, cloudy orange-gold in color with a thin white head. Faint smell of citrus and hops, typical of a hefe weisse. The taste is subdued with notes of yeast, wheat and lemony citrus. Nice carbonation. Nothing really jumps out at me here. Good drinkable session beer for summer.
Hacker-Pschorr makes great beer. I love anything wheat, and this is a great one. The taste is sweet, but not real sweet. I recommend it, and I believe its relatively easy to find.
Nice thick white head fruity and sweet smelling, typical weiss colouring.  Sweet, fruity, slight banana taste.. but also a bit metallic.  An OK white beer.
Nose has fruit somewere between apricot and apple. Hazy golden color with a dense head that doesnt last long. Has a bite that is hidden between a smooth start and finish

12 oz bottle.  Aroma is citrusy and yeasty.  I swirled the dregs of the bottle into my weizen beir glass so the appearance is a cloudy goldeness.  It looks okay, nothing out of the ordinary.  Nice big fluffy head is to style.  The head lingers approapriately.  The flavor is lemony with a tilt toward the wheat malt.  I want more from the yeast characteristics.  Rather one dimentional.  Im not getting any tilt toward banana or clove.  You definately don t need a slice of lemon in this one.  Save the lemon for the crystal weizen.  I like other hefe weizen better than this one, but itll do when the others arent available.  I know a lot of weizen neophytes like this one.

Bottle. Aroma-light and fruity. Appearance-pours orangish-brown, with a decent head. Flavor-malty and full-bodied; a great taste for a hefe-weizen. Finish is crisp, making it a quaffable drink. Ill be sure to try other styles  they make, for this is surely made with a lot of attention. .

Bottle. Pours orange, white head. Aroma of banana, orange, whiffs of spice, smells like some marvelously decadent pastry. And the taste? The best hefe Ive had yet, creamy smooth, just the right balance between sweet and tart, no hint of bitterness, oranges, banana, yeast, even my friend S who usually likes his beers as bitter as a thrice-jilted lover, pronounced this one "quality".

Produced on date of 08/05.

Pours a hazy pale orange/gold color with a half inch head, slowly receding to a thin cap that leaves a nice webbing of lace.

Smell; fruity, with bananas and oranges. Theres a bit of cloves and the yeast and wheat you expect in a hefe-weizen.

Taste; nice yeasty bread dough at first and then those oranges and bananas really jump out at you, especially the bananas. Towards the finish this has a very nice spicy bite to it that kind of balances out the bready qualities. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate carbonation, and so very drinkable.
user_location: Where the hell am I?, Nebraska, USA

text: A cloudy, golden yellow colored body that as a wonderful banana and clove aroma. The banana and clove flavors are initially apparent and then followed by a nice citrusy flavor.  Overall this is my favorite hefeweizen beer.

Good cloudy body.  Right amout of head for style.  Lots of banana and clove in the aroma.  Hints of citrus, some other types of tangyness.  Flavors include citrus, banana, lemon.  Very crisp.  Very little finish.  Some lingering clove flavor in the fine finish.

Hazy amber-orange color with thick, frothy white head.  The nose is fruity and abundant in yeast like a belgian strong ale.  Delicious fruity quality (citrus and prunes) intertwined with a more subtle bitter aftertaste.  Goes down remarkably well with a smooth, well-rounded finish.  In general, Im not a fan of hefe weisse bier, but this one is great.
Draft -Munich. Serviced in German 1 L stein just outside the Glochenshpiel (spelling?). Solif Hefe with a color that is slightly on the dark side.
Pours hazy medium orange with a huge rocky white head.  Aroma is complex, hay, citrus, leather, banana.  Flavor is well balanced, banana.  Light to medium bodied watery, dry and livley.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2007 Bottled at Monk Café, stockholm.  Cloudy golden, creamy head. Bready banana aroma. Light-medium bodied with resrained swetnes, plenty of raspberry esters and rounded mouthfeel. A well made traditional weizen.

Bottled, fresh citrus and orange aroma, pours with a substantial frothy head and a cloudy bronze hue, quite a thin palate, quite a subtle taste,orange, even a hint of strawberries and a sweet aftertaste, im generally not a fan of the hefe weisse style but this one is ok.

poured from a bottle.  I liked this beer a lot.  Nice creamy head, good lacing.  The color is a rich opaque orange (near the top of the glass).  Slightly banana and citrus.  Very easy to drink.  Certainly one of my top hefes.

I consider this beer is something of a classic.  It is a widely available, German hefeweizen that is true to style (near as my simple mind can tell) and wonderful.

It pours a cloudy tan/yellow with an abundant, fluffy white head with excellent staying power.

This beer is frequently served with a slice of some sort of fruit, which I could take or leave.  Even without it, it smells light, fruity, slightly malty, and citrusy.

Taste is full, slightly sweet, and extremely pleasant.  As I said, it is true to style.

Mouthfeel is full without being exhausting.  I find this beer to be somewhat drinkable, but I probably wouldnt suck down more than two of these tall beers.

Cloudy golden-yellow body with a large white head.  Aroma has the expected wheat and some citrus but less banana than Im used for the style.  I also note a little coriander presence.  I dont smell that often in german weizen.  Mouthfeel is pleasant although the body is a bit thin.  Wheat presence is moderate but the beer is also surprisingly yeasty.  Theres also a nice lemon/lime twist.  Overall this felt like a cross between a german weizen and a beligian witbier, and a good one at that.  I liked it, a good one from Hacker.  If all hackers were that nice I woudnt need a firewall.
Hazy golden yellow color. Nice white head. Citrus aroma with strong lemon and orange tones. Tates of slight sourness and yeast with a great citrus character. Unique and drinkable. Great Beer.

Pours a hazy orangey golden with consistant off white head. Big banana aroma and loads of yeast. Very creamy body, solid wheat malt with eccentuated fruityness of ripe sweet banana, slight, soft orange citrus character and a big late yeastyness. Extremely drinkable.

On draft. Hazy golden color with small fluffy white head. Grains and spice in the nose. Smooth malty wheat flavor accented by cirtus and cloves, bread and banana in the background. Smooth and somewhat thick mouthfeel. Very enjoyable and easy drinking.

Sampled this beer from the bottle, poured into a glass.  A light, but cloudy, amber color with a thick white head and lots of carbonation.  Very wheaty taste and aroma, with yeast scents as well.  A moderately sweet beer with a slightly bitter after taste.  The body and texture were both somewhat thick.

500ml bottle. Very reminiscing of Fin du Monde. A moderately complex beer, with very familiar tastes. Not as well brewed as the latter, but it definitely holds its own. Wheaty taste with a yeasty smell. Pale golden brown pour. May satisfy those who like Fin du Monde. But not my cup of tea.
a great hazy golden color with a good head and  a great wheat taste this is a safe bet for a wheat beer , but there are many others that are better
Draft, Hazy amber beer with a whitish head. Clove, banana aroma. Clove, banana flavor with some wheat backing. Medium bodied. Nice balance without too much wheat. Nice yeasty qualities.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2006 Bright white head, golden color beer, very dense looking.  Aroma is sweet, some fruit like banana and citrus, and slight malt smell.  Taste is very sweet, banana in the flavor. Very refreshing and enjoyable. Add a lemon and you have quite the pair. Much better than Paulaner, but I dont think I like it better than the Spatan-Franzikaner (spelling?)

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2009 I had a bottle of Hacker-Pschorr Weisse .  I cant find this exact beer on the site so I will put it here. It was a very good unfiltered wheat beer. One of the better that I have had. Only had one bottle. Will pck up a six pack and try it on tap at the Yard House. A nice sweet flavor with a nice creamy head and lots of it.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2008 OK, this label translating thing is getting out of hand.  Is Weisse the same as hefe-weisse?  Well, if it is, I got a bottle of weisse.  Clean fresh aroma.  Another good beer by hacker.  Just a little cloudy light yellow in my steeer stein.  Nice, without added flavors of detectable coriander or citrus.  Finish like freshly fallen snow, but just a slight 
slushy bitter aftertaste.  However, does not linger.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 500ml bottle. Pours cloudy medium orange with white head. Aroma citrus, cloves, and wheat. Taste is very balanced fruity and wheat, with a slightly bitter after taste. Great body for a Hefe. One of my favorite Hefeweizens.
UPDATED: AUG 23, 2007 Pours a cloudy orange/yellow with a white head. Aroma of cloves, citrus and banana. Similar flavour. Medium bodied with a creamy-like mouthfeel. Very good Hefe.
UPDATED: MAR 18, 2008 Pours a very cloudy orange with a decent white head. Average hefe aroma, slightly weak, nice flavor and palate. Solid.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2007 definetly better than the paulaner descent aroma not over powering a hint of lemon.the taste is awsome with loads of wheat, yeast, and a little lemon. i can barely taste any alcohol and always love the unfiltered sediment. i love this wheat beer!

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2006 500 ml bottle - pours an opaque honey colour with a nice big white head.  Aroma somewhat muted, but you get the usual hefeweizen notes - nothing out of the ordinary.  The real surprise comes with the first sip; the aroma is misleading because you expect a sort of run-of-the-mill taste, but theres a great explosion of flavour - the usual hefe stuff, yeast, banana, lemons, some spice, followed by a quick hit of the alcohol - very fresh tasting.   Aggressively carbonated, though that faded halfway through the glass.  All in all, a very drinkable wheat beer.
Fairly decent. Full with some unusual sourness. Full-bodied but still easy to drink. Quite refreshing.

A nice weisse, but a little thin for my taste.  Also, the immense sweetness seems to end with some acidity.  I think I have become used to American micro wheats such as Oberon.  Pair this with a lemon...  Had in a bottle in Chicago.
Bottle. Pours a murky orange with a thick white head. Smells of banana, citrus, and cloves, and the taste agrees. Crisp... a bit thin. Good stuff anyways.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2007 Nice pour, thick white creamy head(good head retention) I smell a bannana aroma. Good crisp clean taste with slight bitterness.

A real good Hefe

(bottle) Cloudy orange colour with a big and slowly lacing yellowish foamy head. Sweet and yeasty grainy and fruity (orange, banana) aroma with shy notes of cloves. Sweet flavoured, light to medium bodied with a creamy mouthfeel. Wheaty and grainy taste with well-rounded fruity accents; sweet and slightly tart finish with a well-integrated, delicate clovy touch. Pretty balanced and elegant stuff.

Bottle.  Shared with Chilethai.  Classic Hefe color, flavors, and aromas.  I agree with ChileThai that this was a little thin.  I usually get this on tap and am much more satisfied.  I also like to put a lemon in it for a little extra citrus.

Bottle.  Shared with Mild4wild.  Pours a hazy yellow with a decent, foamy top hat.  Nose is banana and wheat, but very thin and subdued.  Flavor is thin and watery, although all the components of a hefeweizen are there.  I was disappointed with this one.

Bottle 355 ml from Dominicks in Geneva on Randall Road.  It has a nice murky amber/brown color, typical with most wheat beers.  The head was fizzy but did not last particularly long.  Nice wheat and banana aroma.  The banana flavor is apparent at first but the light citrus notes finish the taste.  A very enjoyable wheat beer.

Pours a hazy amber color with a light and persistant white head, lots of fizzies. The nose is ripe with wheat, malt and some straw. Light banana and orange clove notes. The flavor is clean and light with a touch of citrusy acidity and some smooth malt essence. Nice finish and a clean drinking hefeweizen thats not too chewy in the wheat and yeast department.
Bottle: Cloudy golden color with a medium white head. Aroma of yeast, bready wheat, and a bit of spice. Flavor is a little lemony and bready, with a bit of spice to back it up.
Pours hazy amber into a weizen glass.  Bright white micro head with excellent retention.  Clove notes.  Upfront spicy clove with a sharp, bitter lasting finish.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2015 Bottle.  Hazy orange with a creamy white head, light carbonation.  Heavy wheat and citrus odor, lightly sweet, light banana, light yeast, and even lighter bubblegum.  Crisp, smooth, light pie crust / cracker malt in the mouth, light sweetness.  Backs off from a tendency toward oiliness, but also leaves behind any chance at a full body.  Wheat flavor is key.  Very light sourness after a few swigs.  Nothing here to really distinguish from any other German wheat, but this is well crafted. [2006.09.01: 3.2]Re-rate and this bottle (04/15) is just slathered in heavy phenols, slight clove and more bubblegum, getting very jammy and fruity.  Banana more yeasty-crackery but light, and theres some orange citrus.  Light body and seemingly not as carbonated as others, but still somewhat refreshing if overall dull.  Just so watery and still, takes away a ton!  [2015.02.25: 3.1]

Pellucid amber with a thick white head. Very spicy nose with clove dominating the citrus and wheat. Lemon with some grassy notes as well. Flavor is rather malty with a good deal of wheat present, though. Strong citrus flavor with some clove but not nearly as much as the nose. Bitter hops tighten up the back of the mouth towards the end. Palate is a bit thin, almost watery. Not quite enough body.

Had this on tap at Taco Mac. Nice dense head with great lacing. Aroma is heavier on clove than some other hefes. It also had a little more of a hint of hope/citrusy. Taste had a little more of a bit than some others and more of malt presence. Definitley a decent hefe, but not quite as good as some others.
UPDATED: NOV 19, 2006 had on tab at old chicago.  nice orange citrus, sweet with banana and yeast.  very enjoyable.

Im sure Ive had this pre-RB days but had a glass last night at a friends house.  great appearance, hazy golden amber with a huge white head, slowly settling to lace that hangs around throughout the entire consumption.  aroma and flavor is a wonderful mix of banana, clove, yeast and other citrus notes.  a well done, true to style German hefe.
Cloudy gold with a decent head. Initial taste wheat and yeast. Starts outs very doughy then becomes frutier with hints of banana and strong lemon. Carbonation is robust, mildly bitter. Well balanced.
Bottle. Poured a nice golden orange with a fairly large foamy head. Scents of wheat, yeast, some sourness. Taste is smooth with some smoky notes, with a slight citrus bite. Nice mouthfeel.

Bottle: Orangey coloured, hazy, medium-sized creamy head; citrus-fruity, a bit yeasty nose; sweetish flavour, covering a bit of sourness, medium bodied, soft MF, light oily texture; zesty, fruity finish with a light tartness. A very pleasant, well rounded - almost "clove-free" - Weizen !

Hazy golden-yellow beer with thin, disappearing white head. The aroma is average in intensity and filled with grain and straw malts, grassy hops, dough, banana, citrus and apple. Nicely sweet for a hefe with a light bitterness at the finish. The beer presents more grain as it warms. The palate was clean with fizzy carbonation. Solid wheat beer.

Bottle.  Poured a cloudy gold with a thick off-white head.  Smells of sweet clove and banana with a noticable malt sweetness.  Not too sweet upfront with a light flavor of spicy clove and a touch of bitterness in the finish.  Slightly watery, and feels foamy and smooth in the mouth.

500 ml bottle.  Very grainy and sweet.  Feels like Im drinking Pilsbury Grands (TM) and bananas.  Medium mouthfeel.  I have just the Weisse, but could not find just the wheat on this database.  Cant say Im a fan of this style.  Very Soapy in the middle.
(0.5L Bottle) Pours hazy gold with large head. Tastes of citrus, cloves, and bananas. Great tasting and refreshing brew.

Pours cloudy amber/gold with medium head.  Very strong-scented beer, with banana, yeast, a bit of citrus.  More citrus in the taste.  A bit of clove and pepper.  A little hoppy bitter in the mouth, but sweetens in the finish.  Solid, but not outstanding in every category.  Very drinkable.

On tap @The Griffin (Battle Creek)  cloudy gold with a decent head.  Initial taste is wheat andyeast.   Starts out very doughy.  This becomes more fruity with hints of bananna and strong lemon.   Carbonation is robust, mildly bitter.  Well balanced - overall : excellent Hefe.
Good german wheat.  Lots of clove and banana.  A little bland citrus hops.  Worth the pour.

Bottle 0.5L.
Moderate malty and yeasty (earth) aroma, with light hoppy notes (orange).
Clear orange body with a large, rocky, white head; mostly lasting with a good lacing.
Flavour is moderate-to-heavy sweet, with a moderate acidic note; short sweetish finish.
Light-to-medium body with a watery-to-oily texture; average carbonation; light astringent feeling in the finish.
Nice beer; maybe a bit too sweet.
500ml. Pours cloudy light amber with a quickly diminishing white head. Nearly still body. Mild lemons and bread on the nose. Neutral palate with a bit of tart lemon and wheat on the finish. Bland.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2006 Bottle, One of my favorite Hefeweizens.  Lemon and orande aroma with some banana and clove.  Head diminishes quickly.  Slighty acidic initial flavor with a bitter lasting finish.  Dry on the palate.  Good and refreshing on a summer day.  Could drink several in one sitting.

A wonderful Hefe.  Draft at San Diego Brewing Company.  Lots of banana in the aroma coming off of this hazy amber pour with a nice head.  Flavors really brought in the clove to go along with the banana.  Everything I expect from a good Hefe.  Very Nice

tap. Pours golden with a fairly huge  head that lasts. This is a very flavorful HefeWeisse, pronounced yeast and bread flavors, with a very full body. Hints of malts and very little hops. Classic German style.

Beer is a hazy medium bright gold with a large, frothy/creamy white, mostly lasting head. The aroma is pretty nice. Malty with a light note of grain; Hoppy with a light almonst-floral note of herb; Yesty with a trace note of dough; Light miscellaneous note of banana clove, trace white pepper. The flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic with a short, lightly malty sweet, lightly dry finish. The body is light, the texture is velvety and the carbonation is lively.

Had this at a beer-food pairing event at Rohrbachs.  No much of a head on my glass, but there was a string of bubbles continually raising to the top.  Aroma of banana was evident.  Light refreshing and smooth mouthfeel.  It was good but I added then added some lemon to increase the enjoyment.

Had this at a beer-food pairing event at Rohrbachs.  Contrasted against Rohrbachs own Hefe I thought this one was much more flavorful.  Heeping helping of banana in the palate.  No need for a lemon with this brew!  Nice appearance, too, hazy with a nice white head.
Copper/orange color. Has a cloudy appearance, characteristic of wheat beer. The head is nice and thick. Overall a very good German beer.

0.5L bottle.  Orange/amber hazy color...  this one had an impressively thick and foamy 1"+  head that lasted for the life of the beer.  Perfect amount of carbonation, this beer was nice and refreshing.  Flavors werent too complex--I thought it was a fairly "light" tasting hefeweizen.  I dont want to say watery, but ...maybe slightly.  Easy to drink, not awful... but not exactly "great".

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2006 The best wheat  beer Ive had. Great with the lemon slice. Essen House owner distributes kegs of german beer in this Madison WI area and I enjoy this on tap at Laurel Tavern.
Must have sugar I do not taste because this stuff goes down easy and can really hang you over.

500mL bottle: Pours a humungous head, white, somewhat lasting, creamy looking.  Yellow-orangish color, very fizzy looking.  Very flowery aroma, reminiscent of a triple.  Slight flowery taste.  Slightly watery taste.  Very light taste.

500ml brown bottle from LCBO. Cloudy amber with thick head, some lacing.  Definitely can taste the banana as well some citrus notes and hints of cloves here and there.  Nice bitter finish.  This is the only Hefeweiss Ive tried so far since its one of the few widely available bottled in my area, so I dont really have a good reference point for the style.  In general though, I enjoyed this beer.

bottle.  Aroma:  Banana, wheat, lemon, and slight clove.  Appearance:  Poured a very hazy light orange color.  Somewhat surprised at how dark this beer is.  Head was huge, white, and mousselike.  Great head retention, but almost no lacing.  Flavor:  Nice lemony sourness upfront, followed by some nice esthers and phenols (mostly bananas and cloves), and then some good bready flavors of wheat.  The finish is just bitter enough to clear the tongue and leaves you wanting to drink more.  Light to medium bodied.  High carbonation but appropriate to the style.  Overall:  A good weissbier, and a pleasure to drink, but seemed a little flat flavor-wise.

Citrusy aroma. Nice cloudy honey-coloured wheat beer with beautiful big head that coats the glass as it settles. Some banana flavour present but not much clove. Bitterness appropriate to style. Sparkling effervescent mouthfeel and smooth creamy finish. Not the perfect example of the style but definitely a good example and very drinkable too. Bottle.

A combined aroma of banana and clove is noticible.  The pour is a cloudy orange with a white head.  The flavor of bananas comes through immediately followed by a light spritzy fruitiess and light finish.
hazy orange with a medium head.  Aroma was light banana, clove, some tart citrus.  Taste was aboutthe same with some wheat and a smooth finish.  light and refreshing.

"Poured a light orange color with a very fizzy head which didnt last or lace well. Aroma was citrus banana and some spices. Flavor was much the same but was a tad on the acidic side. Overall not a bad beer at all. ""
On tap at Bayerischer Donisl, Munich. A good Hefe, which Ive previously enjoyed in bottles. Darker colour, fluffy head. Solid flavour, with creamy yeast and a little fruit. Nice, engaging stuff.

Poured with a generous head, but the dark / amber-like color was most shocking for a weisse, as it wasnt close to being white. Rechecked the label to make sure I wasnt holding the dunkel (and I wasnt). Aroma was clovey with some citrus detectable. Hardly any bananas in the aroma or flavor and the latter was wheaty with light citrus and cloves.

Pours a murky golden-orange with a creamy white head.  Aroma is of banana, orange and wheat.  Taste is a heavy mix of the same with the addition of cloves and possibly ginger.  Finishes quite mild and leaves a slight cream taste.  An excellent beer for all occasions.
This had a nice head.Color was a medium amber.aroma was hops.Medium bodied beer,which finished bitter.A bit sour drinking.Not bad.I think I need to try again.

Nice weisse, perhaps the perfect example of the style?  Missing the tangy sweetness that sneaks into many wheats and replaces that with a velvet smoothness that makes you wonder why some brewers even try.
This is an outstanding weisse beer.  Has a profound banana aroma and taste. A well balanced wheat and mild spice.  Really refreshing.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2007  I drink this stuff a lot as it is one of the only good beers  they stock at my local LCBO.  Slightly fruity and very refreshing. I wish it was a little more complex but overall a great brew.
UPDATED: NOV 15, 2011 Germans can sure make a damn fine wheat beer and this is one of the best examples.  This beer has a light maltiness and mild hops with a good yeast character.
Hazy golden color. The aroma has light spices and fruits. The mouthfeel is soft, some malt, some residual sweetness; light spices and fruitness. Classic, but too simple.

500ml Bottle: Pours beautiful with a thick head, stays cloudy as it should.  Head dissipates fairly quickly to a thin line.  Aroma of wheat and bananas.  Flavour is excellent; a blend of orange, banana, and clove with somewhat heavy carbonation.  Finishes clean, with a slight creaminess in the mouth.  Overall a very good brew.

My bottle just says weisse on it. I think this is it.  Full head, banana aroma, but okay. Head has a nice German wheat flavor and the main flavor isnt so bad either. Has a sweet candy finish w/some bananas. Okay for the style.
50 cl bottle. Golden/orange colour with a nice white head. Lovely aroma of banana, yeast and some bread too. Smooth flavour of wheat, spices and yeast, very smooth and nice.

Nice weiss.  When you find a good one, it just goes down so easy, and you instantly know it just feels right.  I like a bit more sweetness in the flavor, but I think this is a great example of the style.
(Bottle 50 cl) Hazy amber golden with a dense, white head. Distinct esters of banana and citrus. Medium body with lots of banana flavours and some phenols. A nice Hefe. 300406
A hazy orange beer with a thin white head. The aroma is sweet wheaty with nice notes of banan - and so is the aroma, leading to a dry wheaty end.

Bottle.
Cloudy golden coloured with a huge white head.
Aroma of bananas, overriped bananas and spices.
Flavour of fruits, bananas and spices.
sexy a little watery i used to think it was amazing but now just tastes like fresh fruits banana lemon orange nice head nearly a full bodied beer yet is a little watered up

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2013 orange gold with large white creamy head.  sweet banana and yeast aroma.  banana and malts in flavor.  alcohol shows through too much.  decent.  4/27/06

cloudy gold with small, creamy white head.  buttery caramel aroma.  bruised banana with caramel and diacetyl.  almost get some christmas candy flavor (white hard candies with purple or green ribbons).

Robe blonde foncée voilée surmontée dune mousse blanche mince qui persiste. Arômes de bananes, de gomme balloune et de levure. Saveurs de bananes, de gomme balloune, de citron et de levure. Superbe texture douce et moelleuse.
Draught.  Tall glass of cloudy ice tea on  a hot Texas day.  Nose is all banana with a subtle clove/hallertau.  Tounge has notes of bubble gum in adition.  Mouth is a nice carbonation, alive.

Aroma of wheat, banana and some citrus notes. Cloudy, yellow coloured with a lasting, white head. Taste is sweet with good wheats. Fruity-fresh taste with mostly bananas and some citric and spicy tones . Medium bodied and well balanced. This is quite a decent weizen.
Cloudy golden color, medium white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, bit spicy. Bit sweet hefeweizen taste, banana. Thick and sticky mouthfeel. Good hefeweizen.

If you like bananas like I do, then this is the hefe for you!  Labeled simply as "Hacker-Pschorr Weisse" on the bottle (.5 L, no "Hefe") here in the states, the pour is a wonderful orange-peachy haze with a beautifully lasting foamy head.  The nose is of pure banana, spice and yeasty malt.  The banana sweetness pours through the light spice flavor, with the "ever-so-slight" back palate of citrus and clove overtones.  It has a wonderful, bready melon-plaintain finish that works nicely with the crisp carbonation.  Certainly a wonderful warm spring/summer brew, and definitely one to keep stocked!

The aroma is very complex, spicy, wheathy. The appearance is yellow-orange, with bubble and texture is very dense. The palate of this beer is great and flavor of wheat is present. Very good beer and an other good one from my third best producer of beer country, Germany.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2006 quite good.  aroma is perhaps more inviting than the taste.  banana/wheat certainly.  gotta find out what cloves taste like...  rerate. darkish for a hefe, looks good.  big thick head. opposite of my last time: a bit light on aroma and flavor is tremendous.  great creamy/smooth texture.
Draft.  Really enjoyed this beer.  Wheat flavor, with a clove aftertaste.  Relatively dry.  Easy to finish.

In the 0.5 L bottle at the Huber Haus Weissbier tasting 4/11/6. Solid cloudy gold in color maybe a bit peachy in color. Medium white head. Banana esters with a slight clove aroma. Mild flavor- standard for the style. Quick finish.

An excellent German hefe, although these ratings do not reflect it.  Pours a cloudy light orange with a big, puffy white head.  Aroma of bananas, cloves, and wheat.  Taste is very balanced, with a lot of the wheat and yeast coming through.  Nice bananas and spice in the finish.  Nothing is overpowering, but all the flavors you expect are there.

Strong banana clove aroma, with some fruity, orange notes.  Thick white head, over a cloudy gold body.  Very refreshing flavor.  Extremely well done.  May be my favorite in this style so far.  A great hefeweizen.

Bottled. It had a soy sauce scent to it. It oddly tastes like sushi/raw fish to me for some reason. Possibly because this is the first wheat beer Ive ever had or its probably an old bottle. But I liked it, and I would drink it again! Its like drinking a meal!
Bottle: Pours hazy yellow with large white head.  Aroma of Bread like yeast and cloves wiith no trace of hop smell.  Tastes a bit like chewing on a piece of bread
Hacker-Pschorr Weisse-12oz bottle-pours a big foamy white head with hazy/cloudy gold color.  Aroma is banana, wheat.  Taste is malt, wheat, banana, secondary spice, medium body.
Cloudy yellowish color like most hefeweizens, great flavor served with a lemon to add flavor. Definately worth trying and paying for

500ml Bottle, 5.5% a/v
Pours a cloudy orange color with a nicely latticing white head. Smells spicy and a bit malty. Tastes spicy, nutty and a bit malty, with a nice cinammon and nutmeg aftertaste. 

Definetly a nice treat for a cool winter or fall day.
Pours a hazy golden yellow with white head.  Aroma of yeast, wheat and malt with a crisp refreshing slightly fruity flavor... .  Ive always been a fan of german beers.  Wonder why?

now most of these hefe that are from the real region of bavaria you cant really go wrong.  this one is typical with a hazy yellow look and a white head.  nose of bubblegum and spices.  yeasty german wheat flavors envelope the palate. very light and refreshing.

Poured a hazy yellow gold color. I am not a fan of hereweizen but this one definitly got it right. Tastes exactally like it should. Because of this it does taste fairly generic. It doesnt have any hidden flavors or aromas. Nothing complex about this beer. This is going to be my reference for hefeweizens here on out. A very unoffensive brew.
Nice and cloudy dont let the bartender give you fruit with it.  Nice undertones of sweet apricot not a bad hefe.
A really tame hefeweizen, not much flavor to this one, still better than most American hefes I´ve had, but this one is lacking, will re-rate again.

Hazy appearance, with a robust apricot color. Clove undertones, with a banana-like flavor common of wheat beers. Needs to be savored to fully appreciate all the characteristics. Very yeasty, and quite good.
Another excellent German wheat! Dirty orange amber, big pillowy head. Aromas of banana, yeast, and cardamom. Wheaty palate, fruity with bold sweet spices. Excellent.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 12 oz bottle pours cloudy golden with a short white head that stays pretty well and laces some.  Aroma is bananna yeast, and  touch of clove.   Flavor is alot of bannana and a touch of clove.  Some bready dough as well.  Palate is light and airy and smooth.  Nice hefe!

Poured a nice golden colour with a nice thick white head.  A wonderful aroma of bananna and yeast, with a dry semi-sweet taste.  No aftertaste left on my palate and over all it was a wonderful beer though no my favorite of the heffes.  It didnt have enough flavor to sustain.

Amber honey dust in color. A full, malty weissbier nose. Medium nectar. No medicinal flavors present with a tangy finish. Not complex at all and I didnt feel it had the medicinal signature that the great weissbiers possess. All in all a good brew.

Pleasing banana aroma.  Attractive cloudy gold in appearance.  Not an overwhelming "yeasty" flavor for a hefe.
Flavorful and refreshing.  Lightly carbonated (in pint on tap).  Medium body.
UPDATED: MAR 26, 2006 rerate. I had this on tap and served in the proper glass and it was fabulous.  Smooth and crisp.  Nice banana and clove flavors. awesome.
Nice looking beer. Good carbonation. Smooth mouth feel. Sweet wheat character.

From a 12 oz long neck brown bottle with a date in bottom right hand corner of front label. Made a good appearance, poured a cloudy orange hued golden with a large creamy white that reduced to a thin semi-sticky lacing. Had a nice Hefe aroma, clove, peppery spice and a light fruitiness and wheat malt scents. Good carbonation and a smooth, creamy medium bodied mouth feel, good drinkability. Fruity, a soft clove spicy, a sweet wheat maltiness and a crisp, semi-dry finish, very tasty.
nice, refreshing beer.  loads of fresh wheat flavours, just not as overwhelming as some  hav had.  its cloudy, and much more orange than yellow.  nice

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2015 500 ml bottle purchased at the SAQ in Rosemère (Quebec) on May 22, 2015. Dark hazy gold, medium head. Aroma of malted wheat and sweet berries, not too dry. Nice juicy wheat taste, a bit tarte, nice dry herb finish. From 2.1 to 3.7, my taste buds have really change!

bottle - Cloudy beer with a thin, enduring head.  The flavor nicely combines the sweet wheat character with the sour citrus notes.  Its good and refreshing, though nothing really jumps out at me as really impressive.
Banana/clove/yeast aromas. The flavor is crisp and refreshing...citrus(orange juice and lemons), clove, bananas, and cut grass.   A very well-done hefe.
This is one of my favorite beers, golden color, cloudy appearance, creamy white head, very pleasing aroma. Taste is very creamy, not very strong but still enought to satisfy, a very good weiss.

Wow! A very nice wheat beer with a nice orange-yellow hue, fluffy head, nice aroma of yeast, crackers and some citrus (typical for a wheat beer). The first taste blasts you with an incredible "bready" taste, like eating wheat thins. Really really good. Drinkability rating is off the scale. Ill definitely be plunking down my $2.00 a pint again for this baby. Very refreshing

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2006 0.5 mL bottle. Pours gorgeous. A huge initial creamy head of white/off-white eventually diminishes to a white ring. Good lacing. Body is a sparkling and hazy  orange with hints of amber. A light and acidic flavor with slight bitterness. Taste continues for a moderate amount of time and is mainly acidic/citrusy. This beer is a bit fizzy with a slightly dry palate and light body.
This is a nice thick beer with a thick head of foam. Very good stuff period.

From a tap, a nice cloudy, slightly orange pour, with a small but well retained head. Nice rich, pungent Hefe aroma, more on the pungent side than the raw, spicey wheat side of things. Flavour continues that pungency and ads the typical banana and clove.  I dont get much citrus, but a little straw/hay.  Not overbearing, medium body, fairly smooth, nothing unpleasant in the finish.  Ill order this again if I have a chance.

Bottle. Hazy orange with a white frothy head. Aromas of banana and some citrus with a spicy clove note in the background(i.e. hefeweizen). Sweet grainy flavors with a refreshing citric twang and the previously mentioned banana clove thing. The cloviness and fruitiness are clean and not as overbearing as in a Paulaner. Tasty.

Light banana clove aroma, dusty hops and a bit of lemon zest. Mild floral sweetness. Cloudy warm butterscotch abmer with white foamy lacing head. Light bodied with medium carbonation. Starts a little dusty and dry with wheaty malt sweetness and loight carbonic acidity. Good citrusy hops finish. Barnyard dust and dry finish. Light chalky after and a bit weak overall. Easy drinking, though.

"If I cant find a Paulaner,  I buy a Hacker".   Its a bit darker then most of the other Hefs that I drink,  The fun part about this beer is you can truly variate the flavor depending on how much of the yeast you stir up from the bottom.  If Im in a lighter mood Ill leave it all on the bottom.  If I want the full flavor Ill take the time to stir it up and pour it properly.
Bottled. 1/1/06. Wheat colored and hazy, sweet, fruity notes, very mild flavors. Standard German wheat beer.

On draft, great presentation and aroma, but personally I dont really like citrus or fruity beers. It kinda reminds me of Blue Moon for some reason, which I dont particularily like, but as far as being a well made beer this one is at the top

Bottle. Hazy/cloudy gold with moderate-large head with good lacing. Quite aromatic. Light sweet malt flavour with some citrus tones coming through with a hint of clove . A bit thin but not watery. Unique in its aftertaste. Very enjoyable beer.
Great head and beautiful muddy amber color. Strong wheat aroma.  Too carbonated. Full wheat taste and not bitter

12z bottle.  Hazy golden hue with a slight orange-bronze shade.  Nice finger width of foamy white head.  Nose is very doughy and bananas.  Also slight notes of citrus, vanilla, and clove in the nose.  Light, crisp and lively in the mouth.   Apples and bread, Citrus and bananas, Light malt roast and grainy flavors.  Slightly sweet, but with a citrus bite in the middle, finishing with a tingling floral hop stickiness.  Much better than most Hefes Ive come across.  Wunderbar!

12oz bottle.  Pours a hazy gold with moderate-large head.  Smells of banana, yeast, a little bit of lemon, and a little bit of spices(clove?). More banana and yeast on the palate, and a nice sour finish.  Not terribly complex-but good nonetheless.  A very good hefe, in my opinion.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA
