text: Hazy orange-honeyish hue, with a white head, banana nose, with a note of spiciness and wheaty-yeasty aroma follows through on a medium-bodied smooth mouthfilling wheaty palate, with a yeasty, fruity accent, with in a wheaty character, leading towards a banana-like note and a light tart yeasty finish.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2006 golden in color, nice head.....lemon but no bananna hints.....boring and sour.....ordered it in a resturant.....thus, my lame review 5 hours later..second review...not has sour as i remember...

500 mL brown bottle purchased from Armanettis, Mundelein, IL. 5.5% ABV.  Cloudy orange hued ale having a large long-lasting white head with good lacing.  Aroma bouquet of fruity esters (grapes?), cloves, and spices.  Soft carbonation. Light-to-medium bodied that starts with light sweet malt flavor with notable sourness, sharp acidity and fruitiness.  Finishes dry with slight bitterness and hint of pencil shavings taste. A very good wheat beer.

was pumped up for greatness but was let down at the first swallow.  the octoberfect is great but this year round falls short of something spectacular.  A beer to sip on an not take to quickly.  Great tast but leave a resin on the palate.
On tap.  Pours golden and cloudy with the expected foamy white head.  Sweet citrus and bananas along with yeast are all present.  Very nice.
500 ml bottle.  Good foamy head.  Cloudy.  Good citrus taste.  Smooth beer.
On tap - unfortuately, I didnt have my notepad with me so Im rating this from memory.  I do remember that it was refreshing and overall pretty good.

Draft in Florida. Hazy amber color with a moderate white head that diminished slowly. Medium citrus wheat aroma. Medium body with sticky texture. Good sweet flavor with a moderate sour finish. Good brew.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2006 Deep gold body with lemon highlights and soft head.  The spritzy aroma is mostly esthery-yeast, but also some earthy malt pushes through.  The wheat lends itself to a smooth, velvetty mouthfeel that compliments the medium body.  More banana/clove esthers are apparent throughout the body, but in good proportion to the wheat malt.  Hints of caramel and fruity apple also come through in the finish.  This is a textbook Hefe.

The aroma is bananas, toasted wheat, and yeast. The appearance is a hazy gold and the head is persistent. The flavor is very nice. It is crisp and clean with citrus, malt and toffee. The palate is somewhat thin but somehow it avoids being watery. Light aftertaste is somewhat bitter. Easy drinking beer.

Light and crisp, has a sweet, tangy sensation, that enlighten the tounge 
smells of banana and toffee. taste of nice malts, little hops. 
Summer drinking beer
My first weisse beer, many years ago in Chicago. Good stuff. If you catch it near the end of its shelf life the sourness can be quite pleasing.
Bottle. Wunderfull creamy mostly lasting head. A bit sour aroma, gets better along the way. Also harsh flavour. Palate to fizzy. Not a fantastic hefe.
Amber colour with a huge long lasting white head. Sour citrous aroma. Fresh flavour of yeast and hobs and citrous. Medium body. A bit over rated.

Bottle.  Poured out a cloudy light brown with a nice off white head.  Aroma is wheat, pie spices, banana and a touch of citrus.  Palate is medium bodied with nice fizz, but definitely a little heavier than most hefes I have had.  The flavor was strong on wheat with some banana and a touch of citrus coming through, and a nice yeast finish.  If more hefes were like this I think I would appreciate them more.  Very good.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2005 Big fluffy white head, lots of carbonation.  Very clean wheat/yeast and a little citrus taste.  Finishes with a hint of clove.  Not a very complex beer.  Can drink a lot of this beer.  This beer is excellent as a session beer.  Mouthfull is very smooth.

Pours hazy straw with a big white head. Tiny beads and plentiful carbonation. Nose of light clove, banana, grassy wheat and honey. Traces of peppercorn and less than expected citrus. Some light bready malts. Strictest sense a good benchmark H.W. but doesnt show much excitement. Quite clean and drinkable.

Impressive white head that dies down to a thin layer that stays.  Strong aroma of banana with some citrus and yeast aromas floating around as well.  This is a well balanced beer!   The wheat/yeast/fruity flavors mix very nicely, and the mouthfeel of this hefe-weizen is fuller than others I have had.  This would be a great session beer
Cloudy orange amber colour with thick tan head. Mild malt nose. Mild dry malt taste with slight yeast finish.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2006 Thick dense head that takes over 5 minutes to subside. Very little lacing. Smell is of barley and ?lemon? Smooth and mild going down with a slight aftertaste of carbonated cloves & yeast.  A very good wheat beer.

Bottle poured cloudy gold with a big thick head and heavy lacing
Crisp fruity aroma with yeasty notes.
Flavor is clean and crisp,fruit, banana with a tangy light yeast finish.
A decent wheat beer.  Usual banana notes from the yeast, light color, very refreshing.  Nice head and the mouthfeel is smooth.

Couleur jaune dorée, apparence partiellement brouillée et nuageuse, surmontée dune abondante mousse blanche et persistante.  Signée par le citron, les bananes bonbons, le blé et les levures.  Flaveurs de bananes et de légère gomme baloune, doucement épicées.  Épaisseur adéquate pour le style, peut-être un peu mince.  Carbonatation piquante.  Un exemple décent du style, sans plus.

(500 ml: $2.19 at BevMo in La Jolla, CA) Many of the German Hefeweizens Ive tried have been fairly clean on the palate, but mostly because they werent all that flavorful to begin with.  This beer is quite flavorful, but is still very clean because of the overall balance of the beer.  There is a decent banana component, but its balanced by wheat, clove and a very subtle tartness toward the finish.  All the desired components are present, but none are out of balance.  Again, wheat, banana and clove are in nice balance in the nose.  Medium bodied from start to finish, and though well-carbonated, its quite smooth and easy on the palate.  Dark golden in color and fully cloudy, a tall, off-white head gradually settles to a somewhat thin but full layer, leaving a few spots of lace on the glass.  Not a German Hefeweizen thats big and bold, but neither is it a thin, watery beer.  Nicely done and very enjoyable.  One of the better beers Ive tried in this style.

On tap at the Northside.  Pours a cloudy golden with a great fluffy white head that laced perfectly.  Aroma of wheat, banana, citrus and some spice.  Flavor is citrus and some slight bitterness at the end.

From the bottle: Pours a cloudy orangish yellow with a medium white bubbly head.
Typical weizen banana, clove, citrus aroma.
Strong start to the flavour with an orange and wheat flavour that is quite effervescent but fades through the middle. Very clean finish. Not too yeasty despite a full bottle pour for me.
Pours cloudy orange/gold with large white head. Strong banana aroma and flavor. Hints of yeast and clove. A little sweetness. Good mouthfeel. A nice wheat.

Deep amber-colored, murky, with a large white head. Aromas start delicate and dry, then open up to full-on yeastiness... bread dough and over-ripe banana with mild moldy notes. Smooth flavor, moderately sour and bitter to start with light acidity and bitterness to end. Held a creamy texture with a dry finish. Good Hefe.
<font size=-4>A perk of working for a <a href=http://www.workinlate.com/bier.html>mag that occasionally runs beer reviews :)<font size=-1>
hazy golden w/ huge white sustaining white foam.  aroma of citrus and apple, light bodied and easy drinking.  one of the better hefes.

This beer il fresh like all Hacker-Pschorr. 
Light Banana, valilla, citrus, apple in aroma. 
To try

Aroma:light banana flavor...
Appearance:light hazy gold-orange,big head....
Flavor:Citrus fruit,banana,vanilla....

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2009 Pours a hazy golden with a thin foamy off-white head.  Nice blend of sweet banana, soft wheat, and mild spice. Medium bodied with a very soft mouthfeel and lush carbonation. A great hefeweizen that I last rated on 8/18/2005, with same score.
Pretty boring though certainly unoffensive wheat. Flavor has a little lemon in the finish, mostly just yeasty. Little nose, palate a tad watery, appearance typical.

500ml bottle.  Aroma is light hoppy and wheaty with a good amount of banana, especially as it warmed up a bit.  Average size think white head with most lasting to the end.  Colour is light gold and cloudy as expected.  The banana flavour is well balanced with a slight sweetness and light to moderate bitterness.  Good light-medium body mouthfeel - probably from the suspended yeast and wheat.  After finishing this bottle I wish I had bought more especially on a hot day like today.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2005 Bottle (500 ml).  In my Hacker-Pschorr glass.  Poured an opaque, very hazy, lively juicy orange with a large white foamy head, nice thick drapes of lacing.  Aroma - oh yeah, its wheat-y! - of coriander, clove, sharp,ashy hops, lots of fruit essence (citrus, banana - these are esters?), maybe a bit of candyish malt.  Taste - mildly spicy, the hops are there but restrained, enough lemon to make me think someone squeezed a slice in while my back was turned (not the case), again strong on the fruit essence as above, couldnt say there was malt flavour, but it balanced over to the sweet side.  Very juicy and a bit acidic mouthfeel, definitely a beer to consume many of on a fine summer day.

1pint 0.9 oz bottle( October 2003) Only $2.29 +tax & of course CRV.  Aroma is a welcoming of bubblegumm, spice, clove, wheat, and perhaps malt as well. Created a thick yet soft pillow of head and it sat gently over a gold crystal clear beer. The flavor is rather bland, but it does contain some tiny signs of bubblegum, sourgrass and lemon squeeze. Its okay, but in my opinion falls short from meeting what i expect in a hefeweizen, especially a German import.

Draft: Had this many a times in a bottle, but decided that I finally needed to rate this brew now. Poured a typical golden wheat color. Nice and cloudy. Tasted of storng banana esters, with lots of citrus also. Nice clean finish and body. I drank may of these tonight. Yum yum. A solid session brew.

12 ounce bottle, poured into a Weihenstephaner weisse glass.
...but not very skillfully...weve got 3 inches of beer and 8 inches of foam....now, we play the waiting game..
looks lovely, cloudy tangerine, vast, dotted froth...
aroma: banana, lemon, and orange leap right out the glass and invade the nose, with a kick of spice at the side...traces of cookie dough and soft cinnamon.
Taste: fruity at the fore, sparkly and spicy...then smooth and tasty. Ridiculously drinkable, medium-bodied, with a light, yet lingering citrus & yeast finish.
This beverage easily meets my approval. I could have a hearty session with these in hot weather such as we have now...heck, Im already on my second bottle!

bottle poured into weizen glass.a decent hefe.  could have used more body, but hit the spot in a bar that has mostly bmc taps.  again, i need to remember to ask for no fruit in my beers.  oh well.  very accessable brew.
A very good hefeweizen.  Banana, citrus in the aroma, and nice carbonation.  The taste was very pleasing, smooth and refreshing.  A nice beer to have on a hot day.  One of my favorite hefes.

Bouteille-De couleur ambré et opaque, goût rafraichissant dorange et de céréales. Une très mince couche de mousse. Un goût fort mais pas durable.--Bottle-Amber, opaque. Orange and cereals taste. A very thin white head with strong taste but it is not lasting
Nice Hefe witha definite sourness to counter the estery wheat character of banana and breads. Refreshing.

Wow, this was much worse than I expected. It tasted incredibly flat, so I suspect something might have been wrong with the tap. Very thin head, very thin feel to it. Aroma is very citrus, almost overly so. The taste relies too much on orange/lemon flavor for me. Not my thing.

Deep amber, almost orange in colour, very cloudy. Medium head. Strongly yeasty (dough, white bread), chewing gum, banana aroma. Taste is strongly malty, rather sweet, but with a dry yeasty finish. Medium to full mouthfeel.

Das ist der lipschmacker ja! Was ist lost mit dem fotografier aben der dourische porschmuckem? Ach, beiren haben zum obsomunschem isben aum guffenzeitgeistenbrauerieplau. Verstanden sie? Nein! Zu, sie is dumkopf.

Big white head on top of a murky yellow/brown body.  Smells of bnread dough, tropical fruit, and clove.  Has a spicy flavor up front, along with various fruits.  Finishes crisp and clean.  Very refreshing and enjoyable beer.

now this is what i call a very good weissen. aroma: vanilla, banana, cloves and more spices. taste: vanilla, banana, wheat, yeast. i dont think im doing justice to this beer with my descriptions, its better than that. the best weizen ive had! also tastes good when warming up.
Extrememly mild hefe. Flavors were very light, almost to the point of being watery. It was light and refreshing though. Good for a hot summer day.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2006 Draft at A.J.s sports bar. Good flavor, decent smell, apearance hazy golden color, decent head which disapates in to good lacing. smooth, very drinkable, had it served to me with a lemon floating atop, dont know if that affected the rating, but i loved this beer.

The 12 0z. bottle pours a hazy, orangish yellow body with a large and loose white head that left good lacing.  The aroma is orange citrus with clove and a bit of yeast.  Dryish initial palate quickly gives way to expected banana and citrus fruit esters.  Short, mellow and beguiling aftertaste totally masks higer (5.5%) alcohol content.  This beer is refreshing, well-carbonated and effervescent.  An excellent choice.
Pours a cloudy yellowish color.  Thin head diminishing head.  Smells of banana, clove, and yeast.  Taste mirrors the aroma but with a bit more esters and bubblegum flavor.  Very refreshing.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden-orange. Solid head, which slowly dissolved, with notable lacing. Strong aromas of gingerbread and cloves with undertones of burnt matches. Flavor was not as strong as the nose, but was failry similar with creamy, fruity undertones. Dry finish. overall,  I enjoyed it.

Cloudy, dark peach with a huge, fuzzy cover that receded to a thick blanket.  Spicy clove and bready yeast aroma mixed with sweet banana malt.  Estery and tingly on the nose.  Weak soda watery flavour with some banana and bready and sour notes.  Some plasticy note.  This beer grew on me as I got closer to the end of the glass, but I still think the flavour was lacking.  Light body and high carbonation with a clean, watery finish.  Refreshing.
Bottle, orangish tint to the color like a hefe should.  Smells very pleasent with overtones of spicy citrus,  Good hefewiezen but not the best.  Very drinkable.

Bouteille de 500 ml achetée à la SAQ du Marché 440. Arôme: Odeur dagrûmes, dépices et de bananes. Apparence: Couleur blonde voilée. Large col mousseux blanc. Faible densité des bulles. Large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût doranges et de clou de Girofle. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Corps moyen avec une texture aqueuse. Forte effervescence en bouche. Légère amertume en arrière goût. (Rating #150)

Bottled.  Orangey brown beer with a strong head.  The aroma is fruity, bitter and citric with a mulled like feel, and the flavour is generally dry, slightly fruity with a slight finish of banana.  Overall a plainish beer.

From a 12oz bottle.

This is a nice beer.

Big frothy head. Body is cloudy but bright gold. Foam is persistent and leaves heavy lacing. Nose is spicy. Smells of wheat, with citrus and banana undertones. Taste is lighter than anticipated. Bitter aftertaste lingers on back of tongue. Strong spice/hops flavors, nice bright malt tast down the middle of tongue. Hint of cloves. Is light bodied for sure. Fizzy and slightly bitter. Very good brew although probably better suited for summer than autumn. I was really wanting a good German weisse and this certainly hit the spot.
Bottled: Sourly aroma with lemon note. Hazy orange color, light astringent finish. Flavor is spicy, sourly, light clove note. Pleasant drinkable but nothing special.

Cloudy orage with a dense head.  Aromas are banana and spices with lemon - sweet, but not too sweet.  Flavours are sweet wheat and  vanilla with citrus notes.  Pretty creamy yet quite dry and refreshing.  Everything a Weisse should be.

Nice and cloudy. Big puffy cream colored head. Seems to have more flavor than other German hefes. Fruit and slight citrus flavor. A tad thin & watery at times; neverltheless, a better than avg. hefe that Id drink again.

Pours hazy yellow with abundant carbonation and a persistent fluffy white head. Slightly sweet aroma with malt, vanilla, banana and a bit of spice. Mild on the palate with a soft, crisp finish. Delicately balanced with no emphasis on any one of the elements. My favorite of the Munich Hefeweizens.

Cloudy dark gold, huge fluffy white head.  Very nice nose on this with hints of spicy coriander, lemon snaps, bubblegum, and white bread, with lesser tones of banana, wheat and grass.  Flavor was just as nice with spicy wheaty tones up front, and a light tangy German hoppiness rounding this out.  Light to medium bodied, soft carbonation,  semi-dry, spritzy finish.  A perfect summer thirst quencher....
The beer poured with a huge, frothy head.  The aroma is fruity, and the beer brings a very refreshing taste, with the typical sour aftertaste.
bottly, clove, corianderish. smooth flavor, some lemon. refreshing with no aftertaste. ill go back to this one once in a while. solid hefeweizen.
Much, much better on tap if you can find it. Still decent in bottles, but do learn how to pour it before treating yourself to a bottle.

On tap at Williams Uptown Peanut Bar in Minneapolis. Strong banana aroma; I couldnt really pick out much clove. Cloudy orange. not quite dark enough for my tastes where Weissbiers are concerned. Some white lace. A decent and good weissbier. Just a little thin and not rich enough.

I poured the bottle carefully because it is bottle conditioned and unfiltered. The result was a beautiful, clear, light amber liquid covered by an ample, thick creamy head that lasted throughout the consumption of the beer. The aroma was the classic Weisse sweet-citrus. There were notes of cotton candy and lemon. The flavor starts off smooth and slightly sour. It matures in the mouth to reveal notes of lemon and cloves in the middle and the finish is long lasting and warming.
Cloudy bright yellow/orange color with white head. Smells of citrus fruit and some hops. Has an orange almost banana like taste to it. Pretty mild.

Hazy golden amber... creamy off-white head. Nice looking. Slightly smokey wheat, cloves, banana. Most of your typical hefeweizen components, plus that slight smoke tint. It is not light at all in the aroma department though. Full and fizzy flavor. Some lemony cloves and banana in a sweet wheat body. I can never go into detail about this style... its got what it takes to make it a hefeweizen... but that doesnt mean I like it a lot. It really isnt bad though...
Bottle. Hazy orange colour with a big white head. Yeasty sweet citrus aroma and fresh taste. Medium body and a light sweet finish.

Cloudy Orange/yellow, white head.  Aomras of wheat, malt, breads, yeast, lemons, oranges, tangerines, other citrus, thow all are quite weak.  Flavor typical to a wheat beer, medium sweetness.  Nothing outstanding here, a fairly mediocre effort.
Hazy orarge. Sweet yeasty aroma. Smooth malty sweetness, simple and drinkable. So, while there isnt anything special about it to make it stand out, it is still a solid hefe that is very refreshing.
Pours and looks just like you would imagine a wheat beer would. Refreshing taste of wheat and fruit does remind you of a fall day.
A average Hefe Weisse, blonde hazy apparence, fruity notes and hoppiness. Finishes dry. One of my favorite of the style.
Bottled.  A hazy copper-blonde coloured beer with a full aroma of bananas wheat lemons and a bit of bubblegum.  The taste is more of the same and its nicely bodied for a hefe.  Enjoyable.
UPDATED: MAY 22, 2005 Bottle. First beer of a weekend morning.A sweet bready palate.A citrus tinge and very little bitterness A good beer to have while mowing.
cloudy, murky, yellowish-orange appearance with huge head....aroma of spices, lemons, sugars; flavor nothing far from a typical wheat beer; okay palate...not bad, but nothing special

I am not sure what Hacker I had, but I am pretty sure it is this one.  It pours a cloudy golden color.  It smelled sweet like banana and tasted similar.  There was also hints of citrus in the flavor.  It was a little sticky in my mouth, but not bad considering I dont usually like Hefes.
Bottled: Aroma has a sweet, citrus like quality.  The head is very large and white.  The overall appearance is very murky and gold.  Flavor is a moderately sweet finish that is hidden at first.

Cloudy amber beer with a nice creamy white head which recedes after a while.  pleasant yeasty citrus aroma.  Flavor is excellent, fuity, wheaty, with at slight lemon tartness.   Exactly what you expect and want in a quality German weisse.  Very tasty with a smooth mouthfeel, and medium body.  I like this.  Got a sixer for $8.62 at European Street Cafe in Jacksonville Florida. They also had it on tap.  Excellent!

Finally got around to trying this one. Was dissapointed they didnt have a pinter. This is a pretty good and smoothe wheat beer. Nice  hazy colour. Aroma has banana and lemon. Taste follows suit add the honey and a bit of wheat, bubble-gum, no blow joe commics though. Very refreshing overall.

This beer wet my feet as far as German beers go.  I think the lemon over powered it a bit, I get the taste of lemon seeds.  Without the training wheels, nice and cloudy, yeasty, wheaty, a little sweet.  Did not notice any head with the lemon, but without, plenty of white foam, too much, actually.

This is a decent standard to go by for German wheat beer in America.  It has the usual hazy gold color with the large white head.  Aroma of bananas and yeast.  Light aroma of cloves, bubble-gum.  Body is decent when the yeast is swirled from the bottom of the bottle.  A fine grocery store quality wheat.

Bottle, bought at Pittsburgh Bottle shop cafe.  My bottle said only "Weisse" on the label, but the ratebeer bigwigs told me that my beer was probably this one, so....  It poured a cloudy golden with a light head that dissipated quickly.  Nose was great wheat malty sweetness with straw and fresh grass in it.  Nice.  Nice bubble gum, banana, and cloves in the taste.  nice wheat tartness.  Mouthfeel was a nice refreshing small bubbled fullness.  Good beer.
Pours a bit light in color with no sediment from the bottle. Looking forward to this beer, but was a disapointed. A nice wiesse if money is a factor.

Bought this for some ridiculousy low price , like 6 bucks for a CASE! wasnt all to good, dont really like this style of beer period, but cant complain for 6 bucks! good lord! cant be sure which variety of hack shore it was, but this might have been it....

Pours a hazy yellow/copper color. Sweet yeast aroma, a little banana scent is present. Flavor is somewhat grainy. Has a bit of a bitter taste as well . A little spicy. Not great, but it is easy to drink.

01.15.05  500ml bottle.  Cloudy gold but not too cloudy, big white head.  Light banana, clove, yada, yada.  Anything I say about this beer will sound like Im copying the style guide, yet its just a notch below in every respect.  Nice soft palate is its best asset.
Cloudy, yeasty, wheaty. Dont know how else to describe it.  Didnt care for it when I first tried it in college, but I enjoy it often 10 years later.

Yummy. I used to drink this on tap at a local bar thats since gone out of business, so it had been a while until I had it tonight. I dont really know if its totally acceptable, but I used to have it with a slice of lemon, and its the only way I can have it. Its perfect in the summer as a light, quenching wheat that has a slight sweetness and bitterness. Its extremely cloudy with a big head that quickly disappates with the lemon. The lemon gives it an additional sweetness and citrus bitterness that compliments the beer well. A good classic standby that gets me to feeling sentimental about my early days of beer snobbery.
nice and cloudy with  refreshing head  very good wheat beer golden in color and very smooth taste
Pours is a very cloudy brown with a  small white head.  Aroma is banana and cloves.  Flavor is a nice deep wheat and lemon combo. Maybe a bit wattery at the end but still very tasty and refreshing.
A good beer when this is the best a bar has.  If served with lemon, taste may vary with the quality/flavor of the lemon.

a nice drink for a festive brunch, full of dry creamy orange flavors, and as easy drinking as a mamosa-- with some of the same corky and yeasty white wine flavors as a belgian tripel.  a slushy white head resides with tenacity on a milky looking orange beer-- littered with inter-space debris-- a brew that glows like a hot fireplace poker. fruit cocktail aroma, dominated by mango, banana and white grapes, plus powdered clove, a trace of alcohol and the antiquated must of heirloom linens.  creamy feel, light bodied but not insubstantial; balanced and artfully mild.
Cloudy yellow in colour. Light lolly banana aroma. Sweet sugar slightly buttery flavour with banana and clove notes. Thin though refreshing.
Pours cloudy gold. A good classic wheat beer. Wheat and sweet banana mix with a touch of clove and spice.

nice overall beer, hard to give specific details on much because this was consumed at the library in La Crosse, which isnt the best rating environment.  I do remember noticing some cloudiness, and a whole wheat flavor, similar to capital kloster and new glarus solstice, but not quite as strong/

Large Bottle. PouredYellow with a large white creamy head. Diminish but had ok lacing.Cloudy hazy body. Lemon-yeasty aroma.Somewhat sweet yet refreshing. This would be great in summer after some yard work. Good fizzy, not too much. Nice weisse.

500ml brown bottle. Dark gold pour with hints of amber. Cloudy. Head was initially full thick and white but thinned out considerably to a thin film. This surprised me because usually when I have this beer its the draught version, and theres never a shortage of head. Expected notes of yeast lemon and clove were found.

Cloudy yellow with a thick white head.
Aroma of yeast,cloves and bananas. Flavor of citrus, yeast and cloves. Nice tart finish.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2004 A good, solid hefe.  Smooth, sweet and a nice balance of wheat and spices.  Textbook example of a well done wheat.  Tastes better on tap than from the bottle, but either way its a win-win.

Good hazy deep yellow with a classic tall dense wheat beer head. 
Mild banana estery aroma.
Rich smooth filling palate delivers a mildly sweet flavor with just a bit of that wheat beer tang that I expect in the finish. Well done and probably not nearly as good as this is when its sampled over in Germany when its freshest.
Bottle.  Citrusy banana aroma.  Medium yellow color - cloudy.  Nice malt flavor balanced with the banana and slight lemon flavors.  Good body but just a bit on the lighter side.
Clear with adherent and persistent foam. Scents of wine cellar, mildew, seasoned. A great weisse.

Refreshing. Lemony, creamy with a nice kick of carbonation to tickle the throat.

Very good summer beer...goes very nice with food - sushi, steak ribs.

Overall very satisfying.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2005   This is a descent hefeweizen but far from the best.  I want to rerate this properly versus just giving it a grade.  It pours a nice golden color which looks like a tripel but less cloudy.  There is a lot of banana and lemon and surprisingly low carbonation.  The aroma is very pleasant and consists of malts, wheat, banana, lemon and a touch of white wine.  The taste is dominated by banana and lemon with a bit of white wine in it as well.  It is good but too one dimensional.  I like complexity and I am not getting that here.  This beer is pretty good and certainly easy to drink.

This is the beer that made me realize that there is more out there than BMC. Wonderful wheat and banana aroma. Slight citric taste. Please dont let your bartender ruin this with a lemon slice. Second only to Weihenstephener.

Poured a murky amber with a large white head that left a thin lacing on the glass.  Aroma is strong and smells of fresh banana.  Taste has a good hefe sweetness, but not overly spicy.  Very drinkable, and definitely one of the better hefes Ive had.

Ok second Hacker beer of the night.
Have to say its a rather average looking hefe, slighly hazy orange with a large pure white frothy head.
Smell is quite pleasant ..the usual..bananas, clovestec tec.
The  after the good aroma I was expecting a nice tasting German hefe..but it was quite flat..the flavours are all there but they are muted..dissapointing.
Quite average on the palate.
Its drinkable but no were near as good as the Dunkle -weissen.

Pours a hazy deep yellow color with a frothy white head.  Mild banana and grassy aroma.  Very soft, smooth in the mouth.  Some spiciness, banana, and a touch of citric in the flavor.  Quite refreahing with a slightly tart finish.  Good stuff.

Draft, near the top of the Zugspitz.  Massive lasting head tops beautiful bright orange nearly opaque body---like every other proper weizen. Low key banana esters in the nose, pleasant but nothing to stand out from the crowd. Very soft and smooth mouthfeel, quite sweet, lightly bready, not at all tart. This is certainly well-done, but doesnt seem like anything special to me.  I think I enjoyed it more because I was thousands of feet up there, and the air was a bit thin.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2006 I dont mind what other say, this is the supreme Weiss Bier of all!. Creamy, deliscious, after it, all the weize beers I have drank are just that, but this is THE WEISS BIER. I tasted it in München.

Pours a cloudy orangish amber, with a decent sized off white head that settles to a thin cap.
Aroma is yeasty, floral, grainy, fruity (bannana, pineapple).
Flavor is griany, spicy, fruity.
finish is lightly grainy, lightly spicy.
Good beer, but I think Im getting bored with Hefe.
youll find the usual hefe suspects here: banana & clove. tasty. an enjoyable beer that does the job well

Bottle:  Pours a caramel cloudy body with thick off white head.  Aroma is spicy with slight banana and hops aromas.  Taste is bready, fruity, and bitter sweet.  smooth finish, and a slight sour afterfeel.  A good Beer!

Hazy orange colour. Lacey head. Cloves aroma, with some banana. Citric taste, somewhat sour. Yeasty. Some spiciness in the finish.  Medium-bodied. A little too much on the citric side for me, otherwise an excellent weizen.

Tap.  hazy dark yellow with medium white head.  Lots of lacing.  Aroma citrus, mostly lemon.  Some banana.  Flavor is almost all lemon and some other citrus.  Fairly light and refreshing.  Fizzy, which helps the refreshingness.  I need to be out in the sun not a dark stank bar.

Orange cloudy with a small head that dissipates quickly.  Clove and malt aroma, slightly stronger than usual weizens. Flavor is banana dominated with bready notes of wheat at the end. Nice smooth palate with refreshing fizziness. A well balanced weizen without surprises.

My bottle is just labeled "Weisse," but judging from the ratings and the fact it is labeled at 5.5% Im guessing its the same thing. 
Cloudy yellow, nice head. Aroma is all citrus, lots of lemon and orange. Good malty mouthfeel, maybe a little too fizzy. Taste is full and citrusy with hints of wheat, but not much. Some slightly off bitterness in the finish, but not bad. Aftertaste is just a little dry and alcholic. Not a bad offering at all- why all the low scores guys?

Milky cloudy orange with thick foam like head. Strong banana, clove and citrus aromas draw from the glass. Creamy medium mouthfeel with nice acidity on the finish. Flavors of banana and spice with a underlying citrus back bone. Very nice beer.
Golden brown (cloudy) with thick beige head.  Nice balanced banana and some sort of nuts.  Nice clean wheat flavor, very quaffable, really well made hefeweizen.

Some kinds of pussies squirt lemon in this beer.

This beer has its own taste and needs no help from fruit (its not a friggin a friggin garbage/corona or Anheuser World Select) . 
If you drink this beer and dont find it to be phenomenal, you dont know what a wheat beer is or should be. 

All in all, this is one of the best wheat beers that money can buy and if you dont enjoy it, shut your filthy mouth and never talk again.

Bottle pours a slightly hazy golden, HUGE foamy head, decent carbonated, with fairly sticky lacing. &nbsp Wheat malts, slight banana & cloves on the nose. &nbsp Wheaty body, well rounded mouthfeel, hints of cloves, slightly bready. &nbsp Not as heavy as Paulaner, but not as crisp as a Weihenstephaner. &nbsp Otherwise, fairly tasty.

Light, attractive honey colour and sweet nose.  Thick, white head that dissipates relatively quickly.  Smooth, sweetish palate; complex taste, light finish.  Fairly heavy carbonation.  Very enjoyable.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Poured a cloudy orange colour with a big, white, dimpley head. Aroma is cloves, bubblegum, wheat and hops. Refreshing flavour, wheat and yeast, threatens sourness but doesnt quite deliver. Slight bitterness. Medium, averagely carbonated mouthfeel. Thirst quenching and very good.

Pours a dirty yellow with a small white head that dissipates to few tiny bubbles quickly.  Aroma is hops and wheat with a roasty nose.  Flavor is lightly bitter with wheat throughout.  Palate is refreshing.
On tap.  Color is golden/straw cloudy.  Aroma is wheaty and yeasty.  Flavor is big yeast/wheat with sourness in the finish.  This is a very good hefe.

i really enjoyed this brew, probably because it was in the mix of a saturday swill drinking fest.  this one definitly stood out in the crowd of medicore watery brews.  it was quite sweet, more then i remember from my past experiences, different hints of fruit.  i was impressed and will lean towards making this my choice beer when there is no choice of the good stuff.
On tap. Poured a medium, hazy/cloudy orange with a small head. Standard, wheaty and fruity (banana) aroma and tastes. Light bitter finish.
Hazy amber yellow, nice head.  Slightly bready aroma.  bit of a dusty wheat flavor.  Very faint cloves and bananas.  Just not enough esters here to get me excited.

Bottle. Just a solid German wheat. Standard banana and clove, tart, sweet to start, but i found it dried out a bit towards the end, wheaty and soft, pretty decent, some lemony tang in there aswell. Similiar to many other German wheats, it has to be said.
UPDATED: AUG 26, 2004 Cloudy, tropical fruit tones, and richly aromatic -- not surprising for a german beer.
Bottle. Looks like a hefe. Smells like a heffe. Tastes like heffe. They all taste the same.

A fairly decent beer, smooth, soft head, mellow and honeyed.  Not a butch beer.  Rich amber color reminicent of autumn, but the flavor lacks autumn spices.  Would probably not have this one with a lemon.  Would prefer a different beer for multitudinous rounds.
Another wheat...cloudy...fruity aroma...thicker bodied than most wheats...bitter finish...
tap at the Bavarian Grille. Golden Hazy rich color. wheaty fruit nose. nice banana and apple in the taste leaves a creamy bitter finish.
A good typical German Hefe, although I would choose others over this.  Light citrus, yeast, wheaty.  I was not impressed with the aroma.

Beautiful hazy amber.  Big frothy head.  Fruity, wheaty, yeasty aroma.  Smooth feeling with a hint of acidity in my mouth.  Notes of orange and clove.  Tastes similar to other Hefeweizens.  Good joerb Hacker-Pschorr.
Nice orange amber body with an off-white head.  Little in the way of aroma.  Has a nice citrus tast with lemony overtones.  A nice summer beer.
Cloudy orange with a medium white head. Smells of wheat and citrus. Not as good as other Hefes I have had.
This was not a bad one. White head and amber color. Taste of wheat, malt and some citrus/other fruits. Dry finish. Kind of ordinary but still enjoyable.
This is a good German Hefeweizen.  Wheat, malty and citrus flavors.  Finishes clean, crisp, and dry.
Awesome banana smell.  pale cloudy yellow colour.  tastes of banana and citrus.  large white head that lasts until the end.  very nice.

Bottled.
Hazy amber with a white head.
A hervy banana-aroma and flavour.
Late bitterness.
Hazy amber beer with a  big bubble white head . Light banana aroma. Pleasant malt and wheat, with some nice clove overtones. Nicely balanced. Medium bodied.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2008 [bottle - Great European Beerfest 8, Sharp Edge Tavern - East Liberty, PA] Poured a cloudy orange color with a thin and bubbly white head. Yeast and wheat in the aroma combined with lemon, other citrus and banana. Very nicely balanced taste of wheat, yeast and the citrus. I could definitely taste the barley which gave it a smooth and slightly sweet finish.

Bottle. Poured a cloudy, golden hazy colour - not yellow, darker.  Huge fluffy white head.  Lots of lemon in the aroma and flavour.  Nothing that struck me as incredible, but all the ingredients are there for the style - citrusy flavours and hops, a nice crisp taste but not over carbonated. I really enjoyed it, a great summer beer.
Golden, nice head. Aroma from grass, prefume and exotic fruits. Flavor from sweet almond, prefume, al ittle sweet. Very mild and nice.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2009  Bottled. 
Hazy orange. A bit herbal in the aroma with notes of chewing gum and banana. Clean maltiness and long in flavour. A little dry.
Poured a cloudy golden colour.Aromas of banana, pineapple, and yeasts. The taste is good and refreshing, banana, pineapple and a mild tartness. Excellent summer drinking.

Hazy golden. Nice offwhite head that fades a little too soon. Mild fruity aroma from sweet oranges and pineapples. Flavor is fruity, with some almond and touches of yeast. Some bitterness in the finish, a good weissbier.
Coloring Murky/Cloudy Orange.  Yeasty, Orange Taste.  Little bit of a hit...a very decent Weisse

Pours with a medium, fugaceous white head. Cloudy golden color with medium carbonation. Nice banana aroma with spices and clove/herbs. Banana, citrus and spices flavor. Crisp mouthfeel. A problem Ive encountered with this beer is the lack of reglularity, sometimes its great, sometimes its ordinary.

Wonderful orange-gold cloudy body with moderate carbonation and dense foamy head that turns from off-white to white as it fades. Nose is particularly pleasant. It bears fresh notes of orange, banana, spices and herbs. Mouthfeel is gorgeous from A to Z. The carbonated and spicy attack gives some punch and makes you appreciate the fruitiness of the taste and the mildness of the texture afterwards. It ends with a long and relatively bitter final. That one deserves to stand in the top-10 of its category.
Fine bubbly head, golden cloudy color. Light smooth soft malty citrus wheaty yeasty flavours and a bit sweet.

As soon as this became available at the Beer Store I sought it out. Became a standard in my fridge for quite a few months. Has a wonderful, light amber, cloudy appearance, good pearl-stringed bubbles and a great creamy head that provides a good cover throughout. 

The aroma is banana and cut grass.

Mouthfeel is crisp and creamy with a nice medium-high carbonation that gives it some pep.

First taste gives me cloves cloves cloves with a good bite. Theres a sweet banana start and a mild and subdued hoppy bitter to finish that lingers in the aftertaste. The hopped character becomes more prominent as it warms, but to me, this is a real banana cream. I love it.
Not what it was say 10-12 years ago,but still one of the better weisse beers around. A summer staple for sure.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2004 Bottle from The Wine Company, Slough. Bottled (500ml). Typical murky orange, with the regulation overactive head. The wheat is there but not horribly dominant, as in others, slightly spicy, fruity (citrus/bannana). A very drinkable hefe.

poured yellow orange decent head. aroma yeast citrus (lemon)spicy.flavor how can I say this nicely Yuk not a fan of this a friend of mine told me in the bars they put lemon in it so I tried that still yuk.

I have been on a weisse kick lately and this one is a favorite.  Pours a murky straw orange.  Nice foamy white head that lasts a long time.  The aroma is wheat, yeast, banana and bubblegum.  Wheat and banana come through in the taste.  Nice sweet finish.

I dont even know if this is the same beer that I tasted.  Hacker-Pschoor Weisse was on the label but there isnt one listed.  No matter.  This was "lawnmower beer."  Amber with foamy white head.  Mild wheaty aroma.  Light to medium body and mediocre flavor.  Good cold on a hot day and with food.
A very citrusy and easy to drink weiss.  Just a light bit of spiciness compliments the yeastiness in the banana and clove.  Good to drink on a hot summer evening like last night.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2011 A solid weizen that can be found quite a few places. +++Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer pours a cloudy tan-orange color with a large tan head. The aroma is sweet, sour and wheaty.  The flavor is wheaty, yeasty, peppery, a touch musty  and has a definite lemony undertone. There is a faint amount of spice. Very good.
This is a pretty solid pint.  The pour is an opaque yellow that has a frothy head.  The flavor had some coriander and banana.  Quaffable from start to finish.
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2007 Nice little wheat from this Munich brewery. Easy drinking beer that you can look cool drinking without choking. Nice and fruity with yeast and a clean hop finish. Nice.

Nice, but my 500ml bottle tasted like it was getting a bit stale.  But still nice - looks like a fog of peach, nice fresh smell and a good taste to it, fruity with body, but Ive tasted better.  Not to say this isnt worth a try - its a quality brew.

Tasted in Toronto from LCBO.  Tasted in dimple mug. Tasted at 10.9C.  Initially a large cumulous head, fluffy with good glass lacing and volume.  Aroma is of slight banana, with a slightly bitter orange or lemon finish. Very subtle and light grassy scent.  Flavour is more muted.  Starts off delicately sweet, and moves to a slightly sour earthy finish.  Hints of spice and banana.  Final tang of sourness and its over.

Very hazy orange with a creamy white head, which lasts until the glass is finished.  Aroma is heavy on the banana and cloves.  Taste is very pleasant.  Very smooth, creamy mouthfeel, and a nice balance of wheat, yeast, cloves, banana, coreander, orange peel and a really smooth finish.  Can I say creamy again?  Its almost like drinking a milkshake.  This one has it all as far as hefes go.  Fantastic.  I probably rated it a bit high, but this is right up my alley.

Poured from 12 oz. bottles. The smell of lemon pepper and a little corriander hit me right away. Starts with a fluffy, large head and changes to a thin long-lasting head. The appearance was orange and cloudy. Pears, bananas and a little pepper spice keep this interesting. This has a medium, greasy mouthfeel. Overall, a very good hefeweizen.
Cloudy amber, huge beige head. Light yeast malt nose. Light malt flavor with yeasty overtones. Not as cloyingly yeasty as most
Dont like German Hefes, sorry.  HP was sour and acidic, with the banana flavor I was looking for absent.  Bought at a Beer Store in Ontario so Lord knows its been there for a while....

Pours turbid gold with a huge head and nice lace.  Great citrus, yeats, and slight banana aroma.  Tastes somewhat sour, yeasty, and citrusy.  Finishes very dry, with lemon, yeast, malt, and hops at the finish.  Not as sweet as the weisses I prefer. but a great beer.
This pours a foamy white head with a substantial noticeable body. Its flavour is of bananas and cloves and smells wonderful. My overall impression is positive, positing this beer as a quality brew.

Nice to have a wheat beer that isnt bubble gum, but rather balanced. Some malt and dry aftertatste and banana and cloves flavour. GOOD with food. Unfiltered adds to taste but subtracts from appearance as murkiness.
Right up there with the best wheats that I have sampled, pour it right and enjoy!  Pour it wrong and suffer.

Aroma =yeast profile with banana and clove
Cloudy yellow gold color
Full palet warm and high carbonation
Taste=sweet tart wheat, phenolic
good lace nice head but it disapated quickly even in clean glass
True to style
but I personally dont care for the high accurace of phenols
SIDE NOTE. This beer gave me close to 12 hours of bad bad gas after drinking...The yeast strikes back
On draft at Azure (pint glass, not weizen glass. Classic german hefe weizen:  cloudy, fizzy, refreshing and reenergizing brew.
Fruity smooth and refreshing, wheat beers don't get much better then this.

One of the most balanced hefeweizens that I've had. Equal portions of banana and spicy flavors, plus good balance between sweetness and dryness. Not as cloudy as I thought it would be though. Highly drinkable, on par with Paulaner's version.

My first wheat beer.  I had it on tap, and was surprised how much it resembled a belgian.  The strong presence of cloves reminds me of Tripel Karmeliet.  Having no frame of reference, I can't say much else about it.

Cloudy golden color, nice white head.  Citrusy, wheaty sweet and spicy clove aroma.  Taste of citrus, banana, although alittle more thin than the Paulaner.  But on the beautiful day, I enjoyed this more as a refresher out at the park.

Smells of lemon, citrus, and wheat.  Not a strong smell.  Slightly cloudy, light golden color.  Flavors of wheat, caramel, citrus, coriander, slight spice.  Easy drink.  Overall Impression: an ok Hefe.  Not wheaty enough.
Nice looking beer with a huge off white head and dark golden color.  Aroma is wheat with banana and a little clove.  Flavor is sweet wheat with a little clove in the finish.  Good beer.
Creamy burnt sweetness.  A familar taste of toasted orange peels.  An autumnal nose.  A taste of honey.  Some clove.  Nice, smooth sweetness.

Man this stuff was bad.  Brown and gold color, decent head, musty and moldy aroma of wheat, lemons, skunky corn and other unappealing products.  Flavor was more of the same.  Really, really surprised how bad this one was.
Good beer, nice fruity aroma. A little too carbonated for me, but taste is light and wheaty. I would have this again.
Smells like Applesauce.  Slight spicy aroma, followed by a standard wheaty-yeasty taste.  Apple finish.  Just doesn't have the substance of better weizens.
Sadly, served on tap within a plastic cup.  Very nice creamy head that lasted forever.  Very bananna and clove.  Smooth rich mouthfeel.  Would have again for sure.

Pretty much your typical German hefeweizen: cloudy gold in colour, banana and clove aroma, etc.  Flavor wise, this is one leans a bit more towards the banana side and just hints at clove and citrus. Not quite as balanced as the Paulaner, but still refreshing and full of flavor. Definitely worth seeking out. Thanks Rastacouere!

Pours a hazy amber with a light white head.

Aroma is banana, lemons, spiciness clove (?) yeah definitely clove. Slightly sour aroma, which heightens the attractiveness of all the other smells.

Flavor is tart slightly, but sweet, fruity and crisp. Excellent per style, or otherwise.

Mouthfeel is adequate.

Drinkability is great as this is a good, refreshing, thirst-quenching, but quality brew. When people tell me they want a miller or bud light in the summer because it's refreshing, I have to wonder if they've never experience a refreshing AND flavorful brew such as this one.

My top pick for beers with light lunch!

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2006 Comes in a 1/2 liter long neck crown top with best before code and a lush label with some dickens-era geek on it.

When the crown was cracked, a noticeable whoosh of natural CO2 escapes

The pour produces a delicious looking murky orange-gold liquid capped with a frothy cap that lasts as a lace and ring. Noticeable streaking of effervescence and yeast.. very active in the glass.

Odors of citrus and spice and sweet malt...nice !

Starts peppery like a Heffe-weisse then mellows on the palate with a pleasant departure of the malts mingle with the spicy-citrus hop and yeast tastes...then the finish on this one is glorious...you get a spiced-caramel-biscuit taste then a lingering prickly dryness some banana esters but not over powering like in some heffes.

This could become a favorite summer beer for me I like the mellowness and maltiness better than the Paulaner Heffe-weisse but the margin is pretty thin....both are fine lively, yeasty-malty. dry wheat ales.

Bottle pours a cloudy straw color with a small head and no lace.  The aroma is a clove and banana show.  The flavor is quite wheaty, showing some citrus along with the banana and clove notes.  The palate is good and refreshing.  Overall, this is good.
Deep golden yellow colour.   Banana and lemon esters, with some spices showing too.  A little sweet.  Nice.
Nice opaque banana color with huge airy/bubbly head.  Almost spicy aroma; yeast is here of course, but there's also the a different fruit flavor, almost cinnamon.  Excellent.
Hazy yellow beer with a huge rocky head. Aroma is citrisy and clove. The taste is tart with a clove punch.

Appearance is a cloudy yellowish/orange. Aroma is citrusy. Flavor is slightly sour with some bananas, lemons, and oranges. Bananas are the dominate flavor however. A nice beer but I honestly dont enjoy this style of beer very much. Its alright.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2008 Sample- 500 ML bottle- Poured an off white and thick head. Cloudy yellow body with small amounts of sediment. Aroma was apples/bananas and lemon with lots of clove and yeast. Taste was fruity(banana, lemon) and spicy(clove), quite floral and yeasty. Sweet, tart, refreshing. A great beer all around.
Nice color, excellent taste, full of yeast and some fruity notes.  Had this in bottle and on tap on many occasion, very excellent hefeweizen

Cloudy light amber beer with champagne-like carbonation and a large white head.  Immediate smell of banana, apple, and clove.  Taste is awesome, bready and yeasty, with lots of fruit and spice.  Pleasantly sweet.  Good citrus notes as well.  Very refreshing and a great example of this style.
Head quit at about halftime.  Nice estery aroma with hints of cider. Sharp wheat mouthfeel. Not much really going on here, just your standard weizen.

Murky, golden lager with a large, creamy, white head. Great retention and thick lacework.
Hearty aroma. Malty and spicy with notes of clove and bubblegum. Well-balanced, sweet-tart flavor with hints of citrus fruit (grapefruit and lemon). Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Acetic, dry finish reminiscent of a nice, dry chardonnay.

Golden, with a white head that was a bit less than I'd anticipated.  It dissipated quickly to nothing.
Gentle malt with the disctinctive wheat wang to it.  Nice floaral character, with fruity esters like apricot or peach.  The yeast in this beer has some really distinctive characteristics.  Clean finish. slightly sweet.
Big frothy head on top of a cloudy amber body. Citrus and yeast on the nose and then a little spicy with maybe a hint of coriander. Nice.

12 oz bottle.  Massive lasting head tops beautiful bright orange nearly opaque body -- yeah, like every other proper weizen.  Low key banana esters in the nose, pleasant but nothing to stand out from the crowd.  Very soft and smooth mouthfeel, quite sweet, lightly bready, not at all acidic.  I love an even halfway decent hefe, and this is certainly well-done, but doesn't seem like anything special to me.
For an easy to get beer in america, this is some good stuff.  hints of citrus.  good finish, easy to drink a few in a row.

Pours thick, almost "gloppy". Sits in glass thick and cloudy. Has a bitter, orange peel background.
Definately not a beer to "slam". Overall I'm not too impressed. It has a funny aftertaste to it.

pours well with a hazy pale orange, has a thick white head although it dissipates rather quickly with an aroma of citrus and malt with similar flavor plus the hint of banana...overall this isn't a great nor a terrible hefeweizen

i've got to be in the mood for weizen beer but this one is very good. it poured cloudy with a thin head as all weizens that i've sampled.  felt bubbly and citrusy/spicey in my mouth.  smooth refreshing aftertaste.

I'm not a big hefeweizen fan, so I was reluctant to buy this one. It poured a murky orange, with a nice foamy white head that lasted throughout the beer. The aroma was a little fruity and some malted notes. Nice well-balanced mouthfeel. Citrus, spice, grain, and banana. Nice smooth and refreshing finish. Not bad!!

Tastes like a typical wheat beer, maybe not quite as fruity in the finish. This was the 1st German beer that I've had in a while that didn't have that slightly skunked-German beer taste (coincidentally, it's in a brown bottle - not the typical green as with many German beers).

Cloudy yellow pour with a very nice head. Yeast, citrus, and wheat spring from the aroma. Well balanced, no lemon needed in this glass. Some banana in the taste as well as some spice. A pretty good Hefe! On tap at the Beer Sellar in Knoxville, TN.

Cloudy yellow, with very nice white head, lasted pretty well. Yeasty nose, some citrus fruit. Nice complex yet refreshing flavour, very well balanced flavours, some banana and lemon. Very nice hefeweizen. Bottle.

The pour revealed a nice light golden colour, very cloudy though since it is unfiltered...Yah?
The initial scent was of sugar candy and maybe some maple sugar with a touch of citrus. The head was excellent and thick for most of the beer. In the first taste I could taste the small amount of maple flavour. from what I don't know?!
Mild to medium wheat flavour.
Very smooth though,even the finish seemed to disappear gradually with no change in taste.
Very good, will be having again!

looks like a wheat beer should: light golden color, and a little cloudy.  nice foamy head.  typical hefeweizen nose of banana and citrus and spice.  mild body very smooth, and a semi-dry finish.  a great representative of the style!
Very nice. Good cloudy, yellowy-orange color, with a nice nose of bananas and citrus. Very soft and smooth on the palate. Very refreshing.
This was a very nice brew altogether. Nice and wheaty, but a little high on carbonation.  Great flavor and palate.

At the bottom of the 16.9 oz bottle it simply said "Weisse" - the Weisse labels shown in the pics here all have another word in front of the "Weisse", but judging by the descriptions, I think I have the right one. The bartender poured the first 2/3 in a normal fashion... then he put the bottle down on its side, rolled it back and forth, poured more, and repeated that procedure 3 times (in order to mix all of the sediment into the glass (which was a 16.9 oz Franziskaner glass). Golden yellow - Incredible head - down to the last mouthful, there was atleast a half inch head - continuous stream of micro-fine bubbles - wheaty aroma (slightly lemon) - pleasant wheaty taste - very nice indeed
light straw body a bleach white, big doamy head.  light wheat nose, esters and subdued phenol nose.  sweet and light, awesome on hot, humid summer evenings

Nice blond wheat beer with a nice head. Very good taste of hweat with a subtle sweet touch. I was very impressed with that brew. It is very simple but very pleasant and well done. A real german mastercraft of a beer.

Cloudy pale orange. & I can pour it correctly from the bottle. Nice half inch foamy head. Smells like wheat and lemon. Nice flavor. Bubble gum, licorice & lemon, carbonated and tangy. If you add lemon it pulls out more of the citrus flavor but I don't recommend it. It loses its other flavors. Great beer, excellent hefeweizen.
(Bottle)  Another wonderful beer from Hacker-Pschorr.  Pours a hazy golden color with a thick, frothy white head.  Love the smooth finish on this beer.  Keeps your tastebuds craving for more...
Bottled. Huge amount of banana in the smell and taste. Was a little on the sweet side. Besides that it's your typical hefe.
Has the usual going on with more sweetness than others of the style. Crisp, drying kinda sour lemonish finish.

This was a below average hefe.  Aroma is sweet, but you really have to work for it.  Taste is very sweet and kind of thin up front, with a weird herbal ending.  I can't imagine drinking any kind of quantity of this.

Pours a cloudy medium golden, huge pillowy white head, mostly lasting and lacing nicelt.  Aroma is sweety, malty, lot's of banana and clove to be found.  Flavor is crisp, lot's of banana, and a huge punch of clove spice as well.  Medium body, very smooth, crisp, good clean finish.

Pours a very cloudy deep orange with amber highlights. The head is large and exceptionally dense. It fades very, very slowly into a rocky layer of white foam atop the beer. Curiously, minimal lacing was left on the glass; the foam seemed to want to stay together. What was left was a thick sheet that slowly sid down to rejoin the rest of the foam. The aroma is clove, banana, and wheat spiciness with just a hint of hops. Sort of standard fare for a wheat, but very well balanced and inviting. The taste is very good, with a nice yeastiness. This bready component is accented by banana and clove flavors. The wheat puts a sharp bite on the finish, and the hops clean the palate. The mouthfeel is full but astringent, giving it a refreshing quality.
Pretty good - had on tap at the Flying Saucer.  Small head, slightly thin palate, but a nice biting flavour.  Definite spicy aroma and flavour - little banana, clove, and cinnamon.

From 0.5L bottle. The pour in a Blanche de Chambly flute is a beautiful hazy pale golden. The head is impressing. Every one of those millions tiny bubbles is precisely the same size than its neighbor. Intense carbonation keeps feeding it. Stickiness to the glass is exemplary. Truly a beautiful appearance. Aroma is of bananas and citrus. It tastes wheat a lot. Sour bananas, oranges, subtle cloves. More wheat in the aftertaste. A small touch of bitterness in the finish. Medium body, mouthfeel is not exactly up to the level of the appearance. Soft and refreshing.
Great wheat beer. Pours an almost opaque gold, with a big white head. Great citrus and spice comes through.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2007 Sept 2007. Draft @ Castros Lounge in Toronto. Hazy orange body with a lovely creamy white head (4+). Muted, mild aroma is musty and yeasty. Flavour is mild, fairly generic wheat beer flavours with just light yeasty character, muted esters, and mild dry hops and alcohol in the finish. (6+) Average palate. Quaffable but quite a mild take on the style. 6+/4+/7/3/12-13 - 3.3

Sept 2003. Pours cloudy gold with a good size white head that diminished to a smallish white head with nice lacing. Aroma of clove, slightly banana. Bit of banana and esters in the flavour. Not one of the best wheat beers I have had. Have enjoyed this on tap previously much more than this bottle. 5/4/6/3/13 - 3.1
A Well made example of a weiss beer. Banana/Clove aroma. Cloudy apearance from the yeast and good head retention. Good crisp/refreshing malt flavor. High carbonation. Very drinkable.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: This brew poured a small head of mostly diminishing bubbles that left behind a fair lacing and a transparent straw yellow colored body.  It had a mild malt hop aroma and a mild bitter mouthfeel.  The flavor was one of those typical malted hoped ones.

Citrusy aroma. Nice cloudy honey-coloured wheat beer with beautiful big head that coats the glass as it settles. Some banana flavour present but not much clove. Bitterness appropriate to style. Sparkling effervescent mouthfeel and smooth creamy finish. Not the perfect example of the style but definitely a good example and very drinkable too. Bottle.

Dayton, OH AleFest: As much as I luv German beers, this one was a disappointment as there was nothing all that special about it and it lacked character.On to my rating...small sized white head with fine sized bubbles.The body was clear and it contained some carbonation.The nose was malty, hoppy, citrus and spicy.The flavor was lightly bitter tasting and there were notes of malt and hops.The mouthfeel of this beer was smooth and light bodied.

Bottle, murky orange with medium white head that hung around for a while. Yeast and spicy aroma. Has a big banana flavor, medium body, citrus bite. Lively carbonation yet soft and smooth, yes indeed refreshing which is the true reason for drinking a hefeweizenbier.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2004 Nice wheat/citrus nose. Golden cloudy with a
medium head and good amounts of lacing. Wonderful light citrus flavor. Very pleasent experience. (note: the bottle had the label of "weisse" only)

Solid looking hefe, cloudy pale yellow with a tint of orange, large puffy white head that sticks around, hardly fades at all and lacing in lots of strings and spots. Smell is subdued and a little light for a hefe, but what's there is quite complex with a dullish lemon and sweet wheat grain front with lots of herbal things playing in the background of grasses,clove, and spicey yeast. Taste is alot more of the same, very mellow and even balance of dulled lemon and wheat grainy malts, very fresh with a nice herbal flower sense and very mild playing hops. Everything seems softer then I like in a hefe, needs to be a bit more pronounced in flavors for me, but the herbal quality, which I liked alot, is what kept me drinking this, its delicate and softer approach is nice in that respect. Lighter then medium body with a lightly playing crispness of lemon zip and sweet wheat with a nice soft texture which makes for some very easy drinking on this stuff. Not bad at all, a bit more body and flavor and it would have me hooked.

From a bottle.  I didn't notice much of an aroma after this was poured but the appearance and the taste made up for it.  Very pretty cloudy orange-amber in the glass with a few visible "floaties".  Man, look at that head build--and it sticks around for a long time, too.  Taste is very nice with plenty of cloves & banana to satify my taste buds.  Great mouthfeel as well; about the "creamiest" beer I've ever had. Very yummy.

pours a beautiful murky orange tinged with brown. strong complex smell of bananas wheat and spice. great rounded mouthfeel and complex wheat and spice. im partial to wheat beers and this one I like a ton.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2005 Gold-orange and lightly hazy with a thick, tight white head. Aroma of black pepper, oranges, and crackers. Tangy citrus flavors and wheaty body. Actually its too much citrus tang and not enough depth of flavor. An average bottled hefe.

I had this beer on draught, it was cloudy with a slight white head that disappeared quickly.  Has a fruity aroma and it tasted nice and refreshing.  A great summer beer.  Nice subtle notes of banana and clove.  Not bitter at all, quite smooth with a mellow yeasty fruitiness.  A nice balanced example of a weisse beer, though there are much better out there.

Hazy golden yellow with a fluffy head. Fruity outdoors aroma, apples, lemons. Began slightly sweet and breadlike, turning citrusy with a background sourness. Smooth tangy finish. I just love this style when it is right, full of flavor and easy to drink. Should have bought two.

Hazy golden yellow brown with medium sized short lasting head. Mild sourdough yeast and fruit with hint of sweet floral nectar honey and passion fruit. Smooth filling low carb body. Excellent mild citric sour balanced by fruity esters, flowery and honey flavours. Lightly acidic and spicy  bready yeast finish.

Bottle.  Nice example of a Hefe.  Poured golden and hazy with a massive white head, just like the hefe's that I've had on draft in Germany.  Fruity, spicy, wheaty nose with lots of citrus and yeast.  Flavor is sweet and spicy with a pronounced lemon tang and smooth finish.  Medium body with plenty of carbonation to give that refreshing summer taste.  Enjoyable!
One of the best gardenbiers, nothing like it on tap, bottles are good too, but taps rule!
Bright and hazy  gold colour. Aroma of clove and citric fruit. Big banana notes in the flavour, with a hint of bubblegum and lemon. The finish is a little short, but otherwise, it's a great brew.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2007 Bottle.
Strong malty wheat aroma. Pours dark yellow with some light orange tinges and somewhat cloudy.
This had a nice yeasty taste to it that remained true to the unfiltered nature. Some "unfiltered" beers make me really wonder how unfiltered they are.  This had a crisp wheat taste and did not have that bubble gum/cloying taste.  In fact it was not terribly sweet at all, but had a nice clean medium body with some lemon on the finish.  I really appreciate this beer, as it is the least sweet of the hefes Ive tried but still maintains an excellent flavor, balancing the malt, yeast and wheat.

Hazy amber color with huge  frothy, mostly lasting white head. Excellent lacing. Light bodied. Moderate malty aroma, hint of lemon, banana, and clove. Citrusy and light spice on the palate, finished lightly sweet and moderately acidic. Clean and dry.

A beautiful German Wheat beer, cloudy, with a citrus start and citrus finish, a real nice head on this one. Half the fun is in the pouring. If you're looking to get relaxed in a hurry, the alcohol kick in Hacker-Pschorr Hefe Weisse is up to the task.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2004 My bottle just says "weisse" and not "hefe weisse".  I think that it is the same thing though.  Decent white head with good carbonation.  Color of murky orange.  Nice aroma of wheat, dry hay and cloves.  Bit of orange in there also.  Flavor is nice with a hefty helping of wheat and some malt.  Finish is dry, fizzy, and a little bit chalky (probably from it being unfiltered). Bit of caramel as an aftertaste.  A good quality wheat beer although wheat beer are not my favorite.
great color and head. love the spicy clove and fruity banana flavors. skip the lemon slice.

Another great Weizen from Deutschland! Looks a little darker than most somewhere between a Paulaner and a Schneider. Nice thick towering head and cloudy. Very spicy and fragrant, clove standing out and a little banana possibly. Smootha and not as effervescent as the Schneiderweisse. All around good beer.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Hazy orange, light orange foamy head. . . sticky aroma with lots of wheat, and some oranges.  Flavour is full of spicy cloves, with some light citrus notes and some piney hops. . . Palate is very chewy, which isn't for me, but the flavour was plesant enough.
One of the better Wheat beers I have tryed.Nice aroma(wheaty).Cloudy color with white creamy head. Nice citrus flavor that is smooth.Solid

Nice cloudy dark orange color and generous white head start this one.  The aroma is very nice, not quite as "wheaty" as some.  The flavor is very soft and subtle on this one...this is a very smooth, nice, "summery" wheat.  A good beer!

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2005 Strong aroma of fruit.  Cloudy and dark orange.  Very sweet with a citrus taste.  Refreshing.  Excellent.  One of the best.
rerate: 2/05.  My recent tastings have convinced me thiis beer lacks the heavy palate and full flavor of Franzinkaner or New Glarus.  Not so good lately.

WOW....boy did i find a nice staple to keep around the house in this Hefeweisse. Beautiful cloudy orange yellow pour with a huge long lasting white creamy head...some lacing evident. The aroma frolics over my nose with banana's, cloves, and wheat. The taste is so damn tangy, fruity, banana and clove like, with some syrupy tang going on here and a nice malty balance right in the mid sip. Dry balanced finish..banana and clove bring the tang to just the right level. Remember..no one should ever turn down tang if they get the chance (..see that 70's show for copyrights on that one). A beautiful beer, and one that shall forever be in my fridge.
I think this is the best looking beer in a glass.  Banana, clove and sweet aroma.  Big foamy white head .  Flavor is sweet, wheaty, and a touch spicy.  Extremelly smooth and refreshing.
Banana aroma, Banananana flavor. Nice cloudy appearance. Clean finish, for a weisse

On tap.  Cloudy ochre gold with a fat white head.  Popping out of the mug, even.  Slightly heavier bodied than I can remeber from any other hefeweizen.  Mild flavor with a bit of tanginess and even a bit of acidity.  Very fruity.  Not too bad, even though I dislike the style in general.  I could have another round.

Typical hefe nose, but a little too light - also smells a little like a clogged drain. Cloudy orange color and a low tight head. Some spiciness in the middle and a grassy finish. Thinish and a watery finish. Not the best hefe, but decent.
Grapes and cloves nose, but weak. Cloudy orange, foamy little head, soft carbonation. Peppery - nutmeg and banana taste. Thin and almost watery finish.
Bottle.  A hazy golden color with rising bubbles and a foamy white head.  The aroma has citrus, coriander, wheat, and candy.  Lively in the mouth with a touch of vanilla with the wheat malts.
UPDATED: JUL 11, 2007 A standard German wheat.  A great banana/spice aroma in a hazy gold beer with a large white head.  Delicious wheat flavors and mouthfeel.  One of the better wheats you can buy.

Medium gold color, slightly hazy. Enormous head. Aroma is yeast and malt, with a touch of rye. A medium bodied weisse. Malts are pronounced for a German Wheat. Some of the banana and clove flavor thing going on, but there is some fruitiness and there is a very definite rye spiciness as well. Very smooth. Very tasty. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is very slightly sweet.
Nice spicy, yeast aroma. Pours cloudy with a big foamy head. Moderate carbonation A good spice and banana taste typical of the style.

Excellent German Wheat - fits the profile well. Frothy white head with a good amount of lacing.  Orange, unfiltered, cloudy appearance.  Sweet banana undertones with a hint of spiciness - possibly cloves - that presnts itself halfway through which is a tad bit distracting.  Strong to the finish. Overall, impressive.

Nice cloudly orange color.  The aroma was a bit citrusy, but that may have been from the orange slice that was placed on the rim of the glass.  The taste was ok, but there was a hint of something that I couldnt make out.  I guess I just need more pracitce with tasting beers.

A cloudy golden color with a long foamy/bubbly, off-white head with great lacing. The aroma is extremely wheaty and spicy. The flavors have hints of spice, especially clove.  Very consistent, the beer taste virtually the same from beginning to end almost 30 minutes later.  I second 49degrees comments as I bought the Canadian version as well called Hefe Weisse at 5.5%ABV.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2003 Ooh, good interesting flavor.  Wheat and yeast were tasty and smooth.  Poored nicely and had solid lacing and a good clean flavor throughout.  bottle just said weisse, not hefe weisse although it looks the same.
Good solid flavor that lasts after swallowed.  Slight sweetness with strong taste of wheat and yeasts.
Quite decent and not too harsh. Fruity and malty and yeasty. Cloudy gold and a sweet aroma. quite enjoyable. I hope I have the same beer my alk content was marked 5.5% on the bottle

Pours a cloudy golden color with a short, off-white head.  The aroma is pretty wheaty and spicy.  The flavors have the obvious banana and clove, but not to the point of being overdone.  A good wheat beer, but not the best.
Highly recommended for someone who enjoys wheat beers.  Ranks among my favorites along with hoegaarden, schneider, and wittekerke.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2003 Wonderful fruity-spicy aroma. Pours dark yellow, with an orange tinge. High carbonation, cloudy, rather thick head that is quite long lasting. Starts with a spicy taste, touch of sourness in the middle, but the finish is rather flat. But that is a minor complaint. Overall my favourite wheat. Refreshing, flavourful and priced right.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2004 One of my favorite treat beers. Always pours with a tall foamy white head. Cloudy orange color. Hint of banana flavor. Good balance and nice clean finish.

This is an exceptional wheat beer that should easily rank amongst the top Hefeweizen styled brews in the world.

A textbook classic, featuring a cloudy copper toned appearance that allows for a giant foamy (bubble bath style) head to fill the glass.  Head takes a considerable amount of time to dissipate and leaves extensive lacing around the glass. (Be sure to drink this one from a traditional Weissbier styled glass for full enjoyment).

Super flowery aroma jam packed with the strength of its wheat base plus hints of citrus fruits, clove and a complex selection of malts. 

All of the aromas come through in the taste of this beer with complexities of its fruity palette shining through.  A beer with great characteristics and with an extremely consistent behavior from the first sip to the very last drop.  Enjoy it in good health.

(NOTE: Based on a 500ml bottle sold under the HEFE WEISSE name in Canada.  After much digging on the Internet it would appear that although the beer is often sold throughout the world as either WEISSE and HEFE WEISSE, the brew is supposedly the same thing despite packaging differences and the apparent  availability of both versions at the same time from the same retailer.)

The beer has a faint, but pleasing aroma of wheat grass and citrus that seems almost floral. The color is opaque and somewhat golden, being very reminiscent of honey. The foamy head is medium in body and persists lightly until it is all gone. It has a nice, light wheat flavor with hints of vanilla and citrus. Its smooth and goes down well, with but little aftertaste. Excellent beer.
Creamy unfiltered golden colour. Aley smell. Great mellow taste...somewhat citrusey, like hooegarden!
The appearence is between tea and honey. Aroma of yeast and butter. The flavour is acid and starchy.

Wheat beers arent my favorite, but my German-beer-loving younger brother adores Hacker-Pschorr so we had some for Christmas. Im still not a lager convert or a weisse-head, but I did enjoy the refreshing almost cleansing flavor and subtly fruity character.
Cloudy gold. Abundant head, even though Maxs Allegheny Tavern serves all their beer in mason jars. Pretty much a good solid hefe, better than many. Spicy.
Weird smell, but fruity spicey, raisen taste.  Cloudy color.
user_location: Middle of no where, Ohio, USA

text: RERATE:  Well, now Ive had quite a few more beers since I first rated this one.  Its good, but not quite the 4.5 I gave it the first time around.  Wonderful, almost fruity beer.  One of the best wheat beers Ive ever tasted.  Mouth feels clean (cool feeling) after drinking one of these.
UPDATED: MAR 21, 2004 Wow. Great head and tantalizing aroma of banana, spicy cloves.  Very smooth going down. a great choice when it's available

Excellent beer.  Light bodied, but very flavorful.  Strong very-ripe banana aromas and flavors.  Refreshing but subtle hop aromas.  A bit of hoppy bitterness.  Yeastiness is a plus.  Poured with a perfect foamy head.  Worth drinking just for the bananas.
Another German wheat beer with the aftertaste of bananas. Cloudy as hell when enjoyed on tap. Pleasant taste though better when tried in Germany!

Had on tap.  Definately one of the best weizens out there.  Nice appearance- cloudy yellow and nice white foamy head.  Great citrusy/lemmony aroma, with some banana.  Awesome flavor- and very complex- not watered down at all.  Excellent!

A friend showed up at the frat house one year with a case of this and swore it was the best beer in the world.  At the time, we thought we were cool because we drank MGD out of a keg.  The aroma and flavor of this beer always brings back that initial shock of tasting something that changed my palate forever.  Cloudy yellow with a huge fluffy white head and a very spicey nose.  Deep spice flavors of clove and coriander balanced with a fruit sweetness.  Very clean, crisp and dry.  My absolute favorite Weisse.

Great head, very nice unfiltered colour (golden brown, cloudy).  Citrus yeast aroma.  No front to the taste, sour/yeast middle, and my favourite, a yeasty/nutty/bread like finish.  I was wrong, Denisons is better than this.  Otherwise, good, a bit better than Paulaner.
i dont know did have a comment but it escaped me i need another to get a better idea but so far a middle of the road wheat
There is so much flavor packed in this perfectly balanced weizen.  Lots of clove and light fruit in nose and in flavor profile.  Damned fine stuff and drinkable in quantity.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2003 Cloudy orange colour, head is persistant.  Mostly yeast, wheat and banana.  A bit of wheat acidity, somewhat metallic taste at first but it goes away after a few sips.  Whole wheat bread finish.
A good example of th style.  Overall I prefere Belgian White.  Nice head, cloudy colour.  Citrus edge.
This is a very good wheat beer, it is extremely balanced.  Has almost no hint of lemon, but retains an orange rind taste.  Nice head and body, but the finish is short.

Beautiful presentation as it sits in the hefewiezen glass.  Huge, pillowy white head with a cloudy amber hue to the liquid.  Aromas of yeast, wheat and caraway seeds.  Flavor is initially yeasty with a light malt presence, eventually falling into a dominate malt profile with a wheat presence.  Finish is mildly citric and somewhere between sticky and somewhat clean.  Good, but give me a Maisels.
Pours a cloudy golden color with a rich frothy white head.  Slighty sweet with lots of banana and clove flavor.  The finish is smooth and warming.  A fine German Weissbier.

Sweet nose that gives way to vapors of wheat. Very easy, smoothe, crisp, with hints of sweetness and wheat that wash over your tongue. Perfect carbonation. I just love this style and this is one of the best ive had yet.
Color and aroma to style.  Light clove, no banana esters.  Perhaps a touch of phenolics.  A refreshing beer.  A bit thin.

This is the first wheat beer I actually like... of course, I havent had any of the really good wheats, but thats not the point... the point is, that this is one incredibly balanced wheat. Probably because it doesnt just taste like lemons... it has the wonderful yeasty peppermint, grapefruit rind flavor that I enjoy and plenty of spices to go around. Little to no lemon flavor and thank god for that... I mean really.
I tried this beer on two separate occasions, and it is overated for a wheat beer. There are lots of better ones available.

Cloudy golden color w/ a soft aroma wheat, yeast, citrus, and cloves.  The flavor was similar (kinda heavier on the wheat than the others) but it also had a lot of water to it.  Soft, easy finish that was very easy on the palate.  An ok German Wheat.  The best beer at the restaurant I was at, but then again it was up against Coors and Bud.
