first impression..apple.  very tart.  i think of fruit skins.  a decent wheat all and all

I got this stuff in a variety 3-pack with a glass at the Living Earth in Worcester.  A cloudy golden color with a sweet smell.  The taste is spicy/fruity, typical wheat flavor.  Fairly light and very refreshing with little to no bitterness.  Overall much better than the Blue Moon as it does not have the soapy taste and I would purchase it again.
True to style. Nice spicy, yeasty, citusy flavors. Very good stuff.
Hazy golden color that is characteristic of this style. Citrusy aroma with a pretty good dose of clove spiciness too.  Very smooth and not too sweet.
wheat beer tasting 02:  well retained, creamy head.  clove and citrus well balanced with the malt.
Nice wheat beer, almost identitical to Paulaner Hefeweizen with all the elements of citrus, yeast and bananas.  Highly recommended.

Ive had this many a time, just realized now i had never rated it. A nice German Wheat, cloudy spicy, yeasty, clove, banana, citrus. Not as creamy as i would like perhaps, but it is often the best available.

You cannot really go wrong with this beer. Typical of the german wheat beers, this beer which is available on tap in the better Ontario pubs, is quite malty and lightly hopped. This beer is cloudy with the usual protein haze and yeast suspensions. The predominant flavours are yeast oriented: yeastiness, yes but also a balance of cloves and bananas.  Hacker-Pschorr Weiss is particularly strong on the banana flavours and aroma-indicative of slightly higher fermentation temperature.
Excellent wheat beer.  My standard for comparing others to.  And I can get it for $5.99 a sixer, hardly more than Bud!
Average German wheat.  Hazy golden color.  Has a nice flavor, a bit sweet and tangy, sort of like lemons coated with sugar.  First wheat beer I ever had, and still one of my favorites.
Nice German wheat, but nothing special.  Standard wheat sweetness, with yeastiness apparent.  Aroma also has some clove.
Nice Citrusy aroma, and hazy in color. A very good wheat beer!!
Solid fruit and yeast aroma. Im having a hard time deciding what wheat I like best. This one is good though.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2003 Wonderfully refreshing. All the right aroma and flavor, except it smells slightly stronger than others of the style, but it is no flaw. Looks good and feels great too. My whole glass is lined with bubbles up and down.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2009 Luscious plantanes levitate from the milky yeastSoft and frothy effervescence carries delicately citrusy wheat and doughy bread...Palpitations arise from the smell of a good summer weizen

This Weisse isnt your typical Weisse beer. When you pour it, you can see the yeast wafting through your glass. Then, once you taste it, and close your eyes, you can see this old-fashioned brewery, lots of wooden barrels and vats, and all of a sudden everything makes sense.
Seriously though, this beer is unique in its aftertaste, which lingers for quite a while. The beer itself is a bit on the watery side, which again would make it a great refreshing beer, on a hot day.
A tremendous example...nice & cloudy, hefty, a lot like the Paulaner.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Pours what youd expect of a hefe.Cloudy gold.Big white head that recedes pretty quickly. Aroma of citrus and spice. Good palate,nicely carbonated giving it a lively mouthfeel. Flavor is excellent, wheaty with a little tartness at the end.
UPDATED: JUL 4, 2003 My fifth-favorite wheat.  Even beats the Weihenstephaner Hefeweisse.  Very wheaty, with a hint of sourness.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2003 My favorite hefe-weizen. Cloudy brownish blond. Lots of yeast. Spices throughout. Perfect amount of hops. Hint of lemon/sourness. VERY refreshing. HIGHLY recommended hefe-weizen.
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2004 Didn't think I would like but decided to give it a try.  I definatley liked the mild banana taste.
The epitome of a great German wheat.  Clove and banana character from yeast very noticable.  Hops (Hallertau?) well balanced for style  Excellent with a slice of lemon.

Compared this side-by-side with Hacker Kristall.  On the whole, this was less sedate and livelier than the kristall. Definitely spicier, fruitier and more bittered.  Mildly grassy tasting, with a fresh non-musky aroma.  Cloudy, peach-gold with a huge, granular head.  Satisfying palate which doesnt linger.
cool cloudy-yellow color and a great taste-probaby my fav wheat beer out there-had on tap-very tasty!!!!

I recently tried this beer side by side with Paulaner Hefe-Weizen.  While it wasnt as satisfyingly cloudy  it actually faired better than Paulaner taste wise. It had the appropriate wheaty bannana clove smell and tasted less alcoholic than the Paulaner.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2003 Cloudy hazy yellow color, with a huge fluffy white head that sticks around for awhile. Light banana-clove aromas, has a tart wheaty, yeasty flavors, light to medium body, crisp mouthfeel, has a nice clean and crisp citrus finish, this is one of my favorite unfiltered wheats

This beer poured a cloudy light tan color with some carbonation present. This helped to create a white, very foamy head that looked like a float when it subsided and left some lace. The aroma was of hops and some citrus and clove. The flavor was of hops, lemon-citrus with wheat. The finish was tangy, almost sour. A good beer, though I still prefer some others more than this one.
Excellent.  Satisfying, not overly drinkable due to the alcohol content.  Try it with lemon.
Banana like aroma, frothy head.  Not as strong (wheat wise) as other Wiess beers which is a good thing in my opinion.  Not a big fan of the style but I enjoy this one.

Remarkably, this is on tap in the Eagle River, Wisconsin establishment where my father-in-law tends.  As a result (and esp. because the others on tap are predictable mass brews), I have had quite a bit of it and it is almost singlehandedly responsible for my swing toward affection for wheat beer.
An absolutely phenominal German Wheat. Very heavy notes of banana and cloves. Great looking, great smelling, and great tasting! Wonderful Summer Brew!
The weisse that got me hooked! Nice banana nose, wheat flavor, and good head.

Orange yellow and with a vanilla/banana aroma.
This weizen has everything it needs.
A very good Weisse beer.  I really like this one.  Nice citrusy fruit flavors with a little spice.  A lovely cloudy dark color.  Well worth drinking.
Clearly the class of the weiss beers i tried last night - very subatantial body with beautiful citrus and more gentle fruit tones.
Very nice in all areas.  Highly recommended weisse.

Typical banana nose, foamy head, and cloudy light orange appearance. Mild
flavors, similar to stable-mate Paulaner Hefe-Weisse, but with minimal
carbonation and less creaminess. Good , but not outstanding, example of
the style.
Cloudy orange in colour, generous frothy head with hints of citrus and fruits in the flavour.  Lots of wheat with just a hint of sourness in the finish.
A yellow-brown milky weissbier. A wee bit of sweet and wood in the aroma. A soft bitter finish. A well balanced beer.
Mmmmmm.. yummy, great wheat.
Pretty cloudy orange colour, sweet and fruity taste.  I think it is a great German wheat beer.
A great german beer.  It goes excellent with a lemon and is somehow refreshing and flavorful at the same time.  Nice work Hacker-pschorr, keep up the good work!

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2007 Bottle 500 ml

Hazy amber with honey with large, thick fine creamy head.

Initial sweet caramel nose balanced with green hoppy accents. Lightly spiced, more of wheat in character at base mixed with chocolate dipped orange peel.

Medium bodied, soft texture. Malty middle with yeasty accents. Bavarian bread character is shown but this is not exposed as well as it could be. I remember this wheat to of richer personality. Step above average. Finish lightly dry and alcoholic.
Quite spicy aroma, big head.  Distinctive clove, slight banana in taste that points my wheat-o-meter more towards a hefe.  Clean and refreshing, not bad.

Orange, cloudy, and a bit of bite.  Fortunately, this yeasty Weiss is isnt bitter to me.  I thought it was smooth and it warmed me up nicely.  I wish that I drank a few more, instead of some of the other beers that I tried last night.  Ill be buying a 6 pack tonight if I can find one.
cloudy orange colour, fine head, floral, yeasty and buttery aroma, sweet, quite neutral flavour, light citrusy finish

This is a good hefe. Nice cloudy dark orange color with average hefe head. The nose is a bit spicy (almost like they used belgian yeast, but not quite) with notes of esters and some citrus. The esters arent quite as strong as in Schneider Weiss, but this is still one of the more flavorful hefes Ive had.
This beer has a beautiful foam with a dark orange colour. The aroma is fruity (banana). The flavour is quite sweet and the aftertaste a little bit short and flat

Big thick head over bright golden, slightly cloudy colored pint. Just smelling it brought back long lost memories of my 3 year stint in Gemany. Big bready, yeasty taste that seems dry on the roof of my mouth, and citrusy on the tongue. Thick and refreshing...the memories.
Although it has an interesting fruity aroma, I didnt really care for this.  Actually, it is pretty boring.
Cloudy yellow color with a thick head and citric (pineapple) aroma. I find German Wheat beers to be a little on the sweet side for my tastes.
A very solid weisse. The bottles always end with a slightly dry bite which makes me rank Paulaner ahead of this. Still a great beer on a hot summer day.

Full head and extremely cloudy yellow.  Aroma has an exceptionaly strong wheat presence.  Taste is too much for me and has a thick finish.  One of the best wheats Ive had just not a big fan of this style
A solid hefe.  Straw color with a nice head.  A middle of the road german weiss.
One of my favorite wheats. Such a refreshing and crisp taste.
A mighty tasty German Brew. Watch out for the hangover affects though, they can be deadly.

Nice long finish and gentle sweetness, but I was disappointed by how limp this beer was on my palate, especially given the vigorous head.  I had the first half liter glass off of a keg, after I watched the barmaid pull off three glasses of foam--lots of head here! (had on tap at hotel in Oberschleisheim)

This is a very tasty German Wheat weissbier, I still like Paulaner the best,but this one is pretty good!!! Sweet,but notTOO sweet..
another winner in my book of German Wheat brews!
Supremely quaffable Weissbier. Clove/banana yeast profile, slightly sweet body; what more could you ask for?
This is one of my favorites, I like the color and texture.
One of the best wheats Ive had.  Big foamy head.  Typical wheat with a cloudy body.  A distinct hint of clove in the flavorings.

The perfect weisse. Beats Weihenstephan, Paulaner, and a number of other brewers. Delicious smell of yeast and bananas, a head that doesnt quit, and the taste, the taste! Smooth, sweet, like bananas with vanilla ice cream.. love it!
Sweet malt smell. Cloudy golden colour.Lovely taste of wheat, well balanced. Very good.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2003 One of the top three beers I ever had. It tastes like wheat wafers with some lemon. I could eat this stuff. Wonderfull. German wheat and hell German beer period IS Hacker-Pschorr
Smooth wheaty taste with an almost imperceptible piny hop underpinning.  Quite a good refreshment, and a smooth treat that surprised me as I had previously heard of this german wheat beer.

Honey colored with a thick creamy head that does not dissipate completely and leaves nice lacing on the glass.  Yeasty cookie dough aroma with a hint of banana.  Yeasty, herby, banana, slightly acidic taste.  Well balanced; delicious.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2012 Bottle (BB Sep 12). Head is initially large, frothy, white, mostly lasting. Body is hazy light to medium amber, bottle conditioned. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with light notes of gum and pepper. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Not much going on in the nose.  Decent enough balance.  Forgettable.  The color of an ur-weisse (this used to be plain yellow before the Paulaner take-over), but lacking the character.
funky cabbage aroma, other than, the taste is pretty damn good....lots of spice

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2004 Yum, yum, give me some. A banana split in beer form, not as spicy as some weissen I've tried. Perfect with food, a great head, and overall a refreshing beer, especially for stout fans like myself.
im going to have to agree with the rest this is one damm good wiesse the best ive had so far
As all reviewers say, incredible head on this one.  Flavor is pleasingly crisp, with loads of the expected citrus and banana.  The finish is lacking something, but still quite refreshing.
Yuck! It smells like the ethanol factory down the road from my apartment. Overly yeasty. Tastes like over-ripe bananas with too much carbonation. This was very gross. Avoid!

All around good Hefeweizen.
Readily available.
I do not like this beer at all.  Im more of a dark, bock, person.  But the aftertaste on this could kill a small animal.
Drink this as it should be served; a tall weizen style glass and dont forget the lemon wedge. Goes great with breaded pork chops and German noodles!
my favorite weisse beer.  look at that head!
Not a bad weisse.  I would have liked more yeasty flavor though.  Its good, but theres nothing that really sets it apart from other wheats.

Re-Rate 01/19/02: Pours a slightly Chill Hazed golden amber color, generous frothy head, sheet lace upon the glass. Citrus and earthy grainy malt nose, the start is sweet, the middle is medium, as is the carbonation, and the finish is faintly hopped, dry, acidic and overall a pretty decent beer.
Bronze-gold appearance, faint fruity/yeasty esters but a decent wheat.

First time Id heard of this brewery, but hopefully not the last.  I like German Wheat and this is a fine example.  The color is slightly opaque, the head absolutely magnificent, almost like whipped cream.  The taste is typical but slightly sweeter than others in this category.  The finish is nice but not spectacular.  Overall, a good choice but a little expensive.
Very cloudy dark straw. Decent head and lace. Wheat, slight clove, and sweet nose. Soft, creamy, slight fruity with a carbonation bite. Very drinkable. An average wheat.
UPDATED: MAY 29, 2003 Another classic German version with lots of flavor to match. US brewers take note. US drinkers forget the lemon.
Never disappoints. Exactly what a nice hefe-weizen should be! Best in the summer time but any time is OK. Delicate and sometimes a little citrusy. Mmmm!
Pretty good beer; there are many better ones, but not for $1.69 a pint.

nice  hefe weiss.  has a lot of natural tart and citrus tastes -no lemon needed here. 
also some clove and banana flavours.

Humongous head; smell slightly off, one of my buddies, who does theater tech work, said it tasted like blue board. You might think of heavy styrofoam instead. Pleasant beginning; disappointing ending.
Not even close to what I look for in a wheat. The pallate was the deal-breaker for me.
Soft, fruity, with a pleasant malty sweetness.
Good stuff. Bready, vanilla, bit of alcohol in finish, spicy and nourishing.
I thought this was a little harsh, almost wine like.  Mine was a little on the warm side, so it might be a better beer colder.

I tend to prefer Hefes, but this one was good, slight banana and clove, but not nearly as pronounced as Franziskaner or Paulaner.  Perhaps a lemon would add to the unrounded finish.  Not bad.  Cheers!
user_location: Palm Beach Gardens, FL, Florida, USA

text: A very good wheat beer. I prefer the unfiltered to the filtered version. A great thirst quencher in the summer. Try with a little lemon.
Wonderful brew.  Goes great with food.  The glass that goes with this beer is reason enough to get it.
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2003 A five star beer from the greatest of german breweries. This stuff tastes absolutely great.
I was really unimpressed.  Maybe I had an old bottle, so I will try it again.
Fairly good hefe weizen.  Some spiciness, good head.  Fairly fruity aroma.  A little too spritzy.

A perfectly decent wheat beer that nonetheless left me rather unexcited. I would like to try the draft version, though. This had something of the same banana flavor as Ayinger Ur-Weisse, but more subtly (the Ayinger really makes you snap to attention).
Crispy, citrus and an interesting yeasty nose suggesting rye or caraway. Too bad for those getting banana. How this would go with and evokes cabbage and sausage -- this states very clearly: BAVARIAN.

Golden brown, slightly murky with a persistent white head.  Appley, banana aroma with noticeable absence of spice. Subtle banana-bread flavor; mellow and a bit watery.  Rather weak for a heffeweissen, although not unpleasant.
quite good....nice banana finish. smells delish. its pretty high on my list of favorite german wheats. (maissels weisse is still at the top.)
One of my absolute favorite hefes.  Delish.

**Rating is for draft version**
Good, clean well-balanced hefe.  Cloudy appearence.  Bannana, sweet yeasty flavours.  Right on the money.
The bottled version has a less-appealing aftertaste, but the draught version is very good. Definite banana character to the flavour.
Really loses on the nose and particularly the flavor because of the carbolic taste and aroma.
Better than the Paulaner, not as good as the Weihenstephaner.  Nice aroma and a good banana flavor.
Better than any American-style hefe, of course, but doesnt seem too be as generous of flavor as its Teutonic brethren.
Sort of a smokey taste.  Quite different from other beer Ive had.... That was a few months ago.  I since tried it again.  I didnt like it as much.  Its OK I guess
A very yeasty taste...almost like alcoholic bread.  Goes good with yesterdays stale party pretzles
Its just not good.  This is a beer you obviously have to develop a taste for.
I like smoking and I like beer, but I dont like smokey beer.
Good real good, great looking and a great taste!  Booyah!
very cloudy, and a really nice citrus aroma.  deffinetly a must buy

The first wheat I ever tried
and still one of my favorites
(among the German ones, anyway).  I enjoy the medium
bodied malt profile, which
provides a clean sort of
sweetness to balance out the
zesty sour flavors from the 
yeast.  The big thick foamy
head is quite entertaining, too.
Another good weiss beer.
This is only a little better than the Paulaner.  It didnt make me want to puke when I first tried it.  Its just too different for me to handle.
Probably my favorite wheat beer.  Excellent appearance, nice German wheat taste.
